Title: Bhima panel to summon Sharad Pawar and Devendra Fadnavis?
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

MUMBAI: The Koregaon Bhima inquiry commission has decided to summon NCP chief Sharad Pawar and former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis for examination as witnesses in the caste violence case.

However, the state recently gave an extension to the commission until April 8, 2020 and made it clear this would be the ‘final’ extension. Given the number of cross-examinations already pending (nearly 50), it is unlikely Pawar could be examined as witness by April 8.

On Monday, the cross-examination of IPS officer Lakhmi Gautam was completed. The commission has planned the next hearing of eyewitnesses in Pune in March. During Gautam’s cross- examination, advocate Pradip Gavade referred to the application he has submitted before the commission on behalf of a Pune resident, Sagar Shinde, demanding that Sharad Pawar be summoned for examination.

In his application to the commission, Gavade stated that Pawar had, in a recent press conference (February 18, 2020), alleged that right-wing activists Milind Ekbote and Sambhaji Bhide had created a certain atmosphere at Koregaon Bhima and its vicinity in the backdrop of the violence. “Pawar also alleged that the role played by the Pune police was doubtful and must be investigated,” according to the application.

It further stated that the NCP chief’s statement is within the purview of the terms of reference of the commission and therefore relevant. “Pawar has certain relevant and additional information relating to the violence in Koregaon Bhima. Therefore, in the interests of justice, the applicant prays to the commission to issue summons to Pawar and require him to depose before the commission in person,” the application stated.

JN Patel, the head of the two-member commission, said that Pawar would be summoned for examination as he has already submitted an affidavit in the matter. Patel also mentioned that among heads of political parties, the NCP chief is the only one who has responded to the commission.

“Not only Pawar but former CM Devendra Fadnavis too and, if required, other political leaders will summoned by the commission,” Ashish Satpute, advocate for the commission, told TOI.

Pointing out that the tenure of the commission is only up to April 8, Satpute said, “It is difficult to complete the process of examining political leaders (by April 8) as many cross-examinations are pending. Pawar may be examined only if the state gives further extension to the commission, but the commission will not be seeking an extension. It is the responsibility of the government to give ample time to the commission to give justice to the case.”

The event to mark the 200th anniversary of the Koregaon Bhima battle in Pune district was marred by violence on January 1, 2018. During the violence, one person from the Maratha community was killed.

Title: Marandi elected legislative party chief days after returning to BJP
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Jharkhand Vikas Morcha (Prajatantrik) Party President Babulal Marandi (C) being welcomed by BJP national gener... Read More

RANCHI: The BJP’s state unit on Monday unanimously elected former chief minister Babulal Marandi as its legislative party leader at a meeting convened in the presence of BJP’s central observer Muralidhar Rao , less than a week after Babulal merged his party, JVM-P, with the BJP.

With this, Marandi, MLA from Dhanwar, will now become the leader of opposition in the state assembly. “I thank the party for the responsibility and warmth accorded to me,” Marandi said after his election.

Arun Singh, BJP national general secretary, said soon after the meeting: “Rajmahal MLA Anant Ojha moved a proposal to appoint Marandi for the post and the proposal was backed by all our 25 MLAs through a voice vote as well as a written undertaking. As per protocol, the party will formally apprise the assembly speaker about the appointment.”

Singh added that given his experience, Marandi fits the role of the leader of opposition and would rejuvenate the BJP by taking on the Mahagathbandhan government, the JMM-led coalition which includes the Congress and the RJD.

“He (Babulal) has years of political and administrative experience. The entire party leadership acknowledges his capabilities,” Singh said.

BJP hopes Marandi, one of the tallest tribal leaders in the state, will counter the Mahagathbandhan government during the month-long budget session scheduled to begin on February 28.

Two former chief ministers — Raghubar Das and Arjun Munda (now Union minister for tribal affairs) — congratulated Marandi. Das said, “Marandi’s return to BJP and taking on the mantle of the leader of opposition will go a long way in reviving the party in the state. He has always been vocal on public issues.”

Arjun Munda later met Marandi at the party office and presented a bouquet to him.

Chief minister Hemant Soren also congratulated Marandi on his appointment as leader of opposition. In a tweet, he said, “Babulal ji, I congratulate you on your appointment as leader of opposition in Jharkhand assembly. I have full faith that under your leadership, the opposition will play a meaningful and constructive role.”

Om Mathur, BJP national vice-president, who played a crucial role in convincing Marandi to return to the saffron fold, said Marandi’s appointment was the correct decision taken at the right time by all stakeholders.

“Even though he left the party in 2006, his politics revolved around BJP’s ideology. We may have lost the election last year, but we won over a dedicated party worker who will help strengthen the party and bring it back into focus,” Mathur said.

Title: Join PM-Kisan, it will benefit 70L farmers: Centre to Didi
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

NEW DELHI: As the West Bengal government continues to deny ‘income support’ to its farmers under PM-Kisan, the Centre on Monday urged CM Mamata Banerjee to let her state join the scheme which would provide over Rs 4,000 crore to farmers.

Appealing to the CM, Union agriculture minister Narendra Singh Tomar said the state can avail over Rs 4,000 crore and it would not only benefit over 70 lakh eligible farmers but also help the state in strengthening its economy.

He said about 10 lakh farmers from the state have applied individually online, but the entire database has to verified by the state government.

Under the scheme, Rs 6,000 a year is transferred in three quarterly instalments of Rs 2,000 each directly into farmers’ bank accounts.

Bengal is the only state that has not joined the scheme.

Title: NGO alleges EC junked ’19 paper trail, cries foul
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

NEW DELHI: NGO ‘Association for Democratic Reforms’ through advocate Prashant Bhushan told the Supreme Court on Monday that RTI responses had revealed the Commission had destroyed all Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) slips of the 2019 general elections even though the rules said they had to be retained for a year.

The NGO and Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra have filed petitions seeking publication of various forms that inform the candidate about the number of votes polled, rejected, NOTA and how many the candidate got. The SC had issued notice to the EC on December 7.

Appearing before a bench of Chief Justice S A Bobde and Justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant , Bhushan said the Conduct of Election Rules mandated that VVPAT slips collected from EVMs should be retained for a year unless the EC decides otherwise. “Why should the EC decide otherwise for destruction of VVPAT slips when there is so many instances of mismatch between EVM vote count and VVPAT slip counts?” he asked.

Appearing for the EC, advocate Amit Sharma said Bhushan was arguing an issue which did not find mention in the pending petitions. When Bhushan said he would file a supplementary application raising this issue before the court, the bench said, “As of now, the issue is not before the court, so reserve your arguments till the time the issue comes before the court.”

Sharma said the EC would file a comprehensive response to both the petitions and the bench adjourned hearing for four weeks.

Title: MP and Rajasthan pushing stray cattle into UP, says mantri
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representational photo.

LUCKNOW: The menace of stray cattle in Uttar Pradesh took political overtones on Monday when state parliamentary affairs minister Suresh Khanna said that the people living across the borders in Congress-governed MP and Rajasthan were releasing their herds into the state.

"The entry of stray cattle from MP and Rajasthan should be looked into," he said, while responding to a query raised in the UP assembly by Congress MLA and UP party state chief Ajay Kumar Lallu who sought to ask what steps the state government was taking to curtail the menace which is damaging crops of farmers.

"The farmers have been left with no option but to guard their fields. There have been a number of instances where in stray cattle entered the fields of farmers and damaged their crops," he said.

Khanna said that the state government was taking various steps including setting up of cattle shelter homes. "We also need to consider the fact where these stray cattle are coming from. They are being left on the borders of MP and Rajasthan from where they enter into UP," he said.

His response led to a fracas in the assembly with Congress slamming the state government of making its failure a political issue. Leader of opposition and SP MLA Ram Govind Chaudhary said that the menace of stray cattle has only grown after Yogi government came to power. To this, animal husbandry ministry Laxmi Narayan Chaudhary said that during the previous SP regime the bovine were subjected to illegal slaughtering. "All that has now stopped," he said.

Title: Centre, states hold meet on forest land ownership claims
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

NEW DELHI: The ministry of tribal affairs on Monday held a review meet with states to establish the number of land ownership claims under the Forest Rights Act 2006 that have been so far rejected, accepted and those that are pending. The ministry plans to compile the data and accordingly issue directions to states.

The ministry is of the view that if and when the matter comes up in Supreme Court where the case has been going on, the Centre wants the states to be ready with their updates.

TOI had reported in August last year that in a big relief to lakhs of tribals and traditional forest dwellers who are facing eviction from forest land after state governments rejected their claims, several states have now admitted before the Supreme Court their fault in passing adverse orders against them and decided to review their decision.

The apex court had on February 13, 2019 asked states and Union Territories to implement their own orders rejecting 11.8 lakh claims over forest land by scheduled tribes and OTFDs and pass eviction orders to free lakhs of hectares of forest land. This order created a stir across the tribal belts as fears of large-scale evictions were raised.

But the court subsequently stayed the eviction order after doubts were raised on the legality of procedures adopted by the state authorities to reject the claims.

The court had directed the states to file a comprehensive report on how the claims were decided.

Title: Maharashtra government earmarks Rs 15,000 crore for loan waiver
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

MUMBAI: The government presented supplementary demands of Rs 24,723 crore in the legislature on Monday, earmarking the largest chunk, Rs 15,000 crore, for the crop loan waiver scheme. Supplementary demands are additional expenditures that are not part of the main budget. The amount presented by the MVA government is one of the highest in recent years and will further widen the state’s fiscal deficit, which, according to the finance department’s estimates, will be over Rs 90,000 crore by the end of the current financial year.

Of the total supplementary demands, Rs 18,719 crore will be spent towards planned works and the rest towards committed works. Monday saw the release of the first list of crop loan waiver beneficiaries under the scheme: the list contains 15,358 eligible farmers from 68 villages across the state; disbursals will be made to their loan accounts within two days. “This is a trial list. We took a small number to test the procedure set up for the scheme. If the process proves to be smooth, the second list which will be released on February 28. It will be a much longer list,” said revenue minister Balasaheb Thorat (Congress).

Chief minister Uddhav Thackeray (Shiv Sena), on video conference, asked at least two beneficiaries per district if they faced issues availing of the scheme. Officials said information on 34.8 lakh farmers’ accounts has been obtained by the state and details of another 1.61 lakh accounts is expected. Under the scheme — officially called Mahatma Jyotirao Phule Shetkari Karjmukti Yojana — which was announced by the MVA government in December 2019, crop loans of up to Rs 2 lakh outstanding till September 30, 2019, will be waived off. The scheme was Thackeray’s pet poll plank and is his government’s biggest welfare scheme yet.

Of the Rs 15,000 crore the government has budgeted as part of supplementary demands, Rs 10,000 crore will be used to recoup an advance drawn from the contingency fund for the scheme. The government had taken a decision to dip into the contingency fund to be able to pay for the scheme. The remaining Rs 5,000 crore has been budgeted to be used under the scheme till the next budget comes into effect from April 1 onwards.

Apart from loan waiver, Rs 16.2 crore will be spent on welfare schemes for the next of kin of farmers who committed suicide, Rs 3,523 crore has been earmarked for the revenue and forests department, and an equal amount for projects under the public works department.

Also, Rs 6.5 crore will go towards the Shiv Bhojan scheme, which is aimed at providing a meal to the poor for just Rs 10. For the urban development department, Rs 679 crore has been budgeted, including Rs 103 crore for the Pune Metro.

Title: Telangana to waive farm loans up to 50k at one go?
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

HYDERABAD: Small and marginal farmers of Telangana who have taken loans up to Rs 50,000 and less are likely to get the loan waiver at one go.

The state government has started working out modalities to implement the loan waiver scheme, which is set to cost Rs 25,000 crore to Rs 30,000 crore, senior officials said. Sources said the government is planning to extend a one-time settlement to the farmers whose loans are less than Rs 50,000.

Farmers who had obtained loans of over Rs 50,000 and those whose loans exceed Rs 1 lakh are likely to get waiver in three to four instalments. The government’s decision to waive off loans of small and marginal famers in instalments had drawn a lot of criticism last year.

The government allocated Rs 6,000 crore in the current fiscal for the crop loan waiver scheme but did not release any money for crop loan waiver till now.

Title: Take action against ‘rogue’ cops: HC
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

ALLAHABAD: The Allahabad high court on Monday directed the UP DGP to identify and take action against the policemen who were involved in stray cases of damaging motorcycles and unnecessarily caning the apprehended students of Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) during the anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protest in last December.

Passing the order on the recommendations of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC), Chief Justice Govind Mathur and Justice Samit Gopal directed the state police chief to adhere to the report of the rights body. Last month, the high court had asked the NHRC to probe the allegations levelled in a PIL filed by Mohammad Akram Khan .

After the probe, the NHRC recommended that a suitable action might be taken against identified cops as per rules that exist for subordinate officers in UP Police . “The police force should be sensitised and special training modules be carried out to inculcate professionalism in handling such situations,” it added.

Hearing the PIL, the HC took the NHRC report on record and directed the UP chief secretary, the DGP, the CRPF, the vice-chancellor and registrar of AMU to adhere to its recommendations, including payment of compensation to injured AMU students. The court has sought a compliance report on March 25.

Earlier on January 8, the HC had directed the NHRC to probe the allegations levelled in the PIL by Mohammad Akram Khan, who accused cops of unleashing brutality upon students. The petition was filed requesting the court to pass several directions, including setting up of a ‘court monitored committee’ to have a judicial inquiry into acts of violence and arbitrary detention of students by the state police and para-military forces at AMU from December 12 to December 15.

Following the court’s direction, a six-member team of NHRC enquired into the matter and submitted its report before the court.

The report also recommended that the court may direct the AMU V-C, registrar and other authorities to establish a mechanism for better communication with students so that they are not influenced by outsiders.

Title: Take action against 'rogue' cops, says HC
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

ALLAHABAD: The Allahabad HC on Monday directed the UP DGP to identify and take action against the policemen who were involved in stray cases of damaging motorcycles and unnecessarily caning the apprehended students of Aligarh Muslim University during the anti-CAA protest in December last year.

Passing the order on recommendations of National Human Rights Commission (NHRC), Chief Justice Govind Mathur and Justice Samit Gopal directed the state police chief to adhere to the report of the rights body. Last month, the HC had asked the NHRC to probe the allegations levelled in a PIL filed by Mohammad Akram Khan .

After the probe, NHRC recommended a suitable action might be taken against identified cops as per rules and provisions that exist for subordinate officers in UP Police. "The police force should be sensitized and special training modules be carried out to inculcate professionalism in handling such situations," it added.

Hearing the PIL, the HC took the NHRC report on record and directed the UP chief secretary, the DGP, the Central Reserve Police Force, vice-chancellor and registrar of AMU to adhere to its recommendations, including payment of compensation to injured AMU students. The court has sought a compliance report on March 25, 2020, which is the next date of hearing.

In its recommendation, the NHRC has said a direction be given to UP chief secretary to provide suitable compensation to the six students of AMU, who have been grievously injured, commensurate with their injuries, on humanitarian grounds.

Title: Hyderabad techies team up, flaunt helmets with messages on fuel saving, blood donation
Content:
Techies have printed the messages on their helmets

HYDERABAD: Bikers wearing helmets with the message ‘turn off engines at traffic signals’ and ‘donate blood and be a hero’ can be spotted on city roads. A group of about 20 techies, part of two teams, have hit on a novel idea to spread awareness on these issues. They have printed the messages on their bikes or helmets, urging other commuters to make small changes that could have a massive impact.‘Team Suri’ named in memory of a college student Surender who passed away in 2017 has been active across the city. “We started the campaign to save fuel about two weeks ago. We want people to understand that if everyone switches off their vehicles at traffic signals, it will save a lot of fuel as well as decrease pollution levels,” said Akhil Velagandula, who works for an IT firm in Hi-Tec City.Sharath Kumar Mariyala, another volunteer, said, “Initially I felt some discomfort at having to turn off the engine every single time, but then I soon got habituated to this.” He said what would help in the endeavour is if timers are kept at most signals. “This would help motorists know how much time they spend at the signal and help them turn the key off during extended waiting time.”This team was inspired by another group called ‘Team Asraya’, which not only came up with the idea of saving non-renewable resources, but also has been raising awareness on blood donation . Members of ‘Team Asraya’ drive around the city with their blood group printed on their vehicles. “Once while driving, a motorist stopped and asked me what the purpose of the campaign was. We exchanged details, and when someone was in need of blood, he stepped up and donated,” said Kedarnath Gujjulwar, a team member. Incidentally, ‘Asraya’ in Sanskrit means ‘providing shelter’.Both the teams now plan to work together to promote carpooling. Shiva Reddy, a volunteer, said: “In the west of the city, we see several commuters heading to work alone in their four-wheelers. We want to urge them to take to carpooling which will significantly cut pollution levels and traffic.”

Title: Surat: Shooter claims he was given contract by Bishnoi to fire
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

SURAT: Police investigation into the incident of firing at a jewellery showroom at Mini Bazaar area of Varachha revealed on Monday that shooter Vijay Karpada was given the contract by Lawrence Bishnoi to threaten the jeweller. Police are yet to confirm if the firing was an extortion attempt or a plan to threaten the jeweller over some dispute.

Vijay Karpada, nabbed from the spot by staffers of Amar Jewellers on Sunday, was arrested on Monday and will be produced by police in court on Tuesday. Karpada had come to the spot on a scooter with two other persons who, however, managed to escape from the spot. Karpada had earlier claimed that Dinesh Shukla and Mayursinh Jadeja were with him but during detailed questioning, he named Kapil alias Bavo and Mahendra alias Mando as the two persons who had accompanied him to the showroom.

Police have recovered the scooter which was abandoned by the accused from Swarg Residency in Kholwad near Kamrej. All the three accused had been staying at Shubham Society in Kholwad for the past few days. Police investigation revealed that the scooter belonged to a person named Lalbhai and was registered at Rajkot RTO.

Karpada informed police that he was put in touch with Bishnoi, a history-sheeter from Rajasthan, by Shukla and Jadeja, with whom he had escaped from Limbdi sub-jail on January 12. Bishnoi had offered the contract to Karpada to carry out firing in the showroom, police said.

The accused claims he was asked to fire in the air to threaten Nitesh Vavaiya, owner of Amar Jewellers. However, police are not convinced since Karpada had fired at Vavaiya. But the bullets hit Sanjay Patel, an employee of the showroom. Patel suffered two bullet injuries.

"The accused is not revealing the exact reason behind his opening fire in the showroom. We cannot reveal the details of investigation now due to sensitivity of the case," a police officer said.

Title: Surat: Fire breaks out in textile godown at Umarwada
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: A major fire broke out in a textile warehouse located on ground floor of Kiran Textile House at Umarwada here on Monday. There were no casualties in the fire.

Fire and emergency services department of Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) stated that the fire broke out at the warehouse in Kiran Textile House at about 11:30am. The warehouse was full with saris, dress material and furniture.

Fire officials stated that the entire building has been sealed by the fire department and investigation ordered.

Fire officer Dipak Makhijani told TOI, “The fire in the warehouse broke out due to a short-circuit. It took more than three hours to control the fire as the entire basement was engulfed in flames.”

Sources said there have been more than five fire incidents in the industrial estates housing embroidery units and sewing machines in the last 10 days. In majority of the cases, short-circuit was the cause of fire.

Chief fire officer Basant Pareek said, “The department had issued notice to Kiran Textile House owners in January 2020 for lack of fire safety system. The building owners had not complied with fire safety norms. We have sealed the entire building for investigation.”

Title: Father-son duo booked for murder after man they stabbed succumbs
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: A man and his son were booked on Monday for murder after the 50-year-old man, who the duo had stabbed on February 17 died , in Mesvada of Kuvadava locality on the outskirts of Rajkot. The father-son duo are currently in jail.

Khimaji Bawalia and his son Haka Bawalia were booked on February 17 for allegedly stabbing Mera Sangadia. However, after Sangadia succumbed to injuries on Monday, police converted the case from attempt to murder to murder.

According to the details of the case, Haka used to hurl abuses near Sangadia’s dairy. Sangadia’s brother Vala once chided him and asked him to go away. Nursing a grudge against the Sangadia family, Haka would come to the dairy frequently and hurl abuses.

On February 17, Haka along with his father Khimaji came to the dairy and resorted to stone pelting in which the monitor of a computer inside the dairy was damaged and Sangadia’s cousin Kalu got injured.

“Hearing the commotion, Sangadia rushed to the spot. Haka stabbed him thrice in his chest and ribs. After Sangadia collapsed both Haka and Khimaji fled from the spot,” said an official from Rajkot crime branch.

Soon after the crime, the crime branch officials nabbed the father-son duo from Beti na Patia and handed them over to Kuvadava police station.

Title: Bihar government signs MoU for better mental healthcare
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: In order to provide better mental healthcare service in Bihar , the state health department signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Mariwala Health Foundation , Indian Law Society, Pune, and Initiating Concern For All (iCALL) to establish a technical support unit (TSU) in state.

Health department principal secretary Sanjay Kumar said this TSU will help set up a state mental authority and a district mental authority, which in turn will help in implementing Mental Healthcare Act, 2017 and provide basic mental services to people in need. Some of the salient features of this Act include right to people suffering from mental illness to live with dignity and confidentiality. The person also has right to give advance directive about his treatment.

Apart from setting up state and district authorities, this TSU will support the state government in strengthening its mental healthcare by ensuring delivery of basic mental health services. As per the press release issued by the health department, the MoU will be effective for five years commencing from Monday.

Highlighting its components, Kumar said it will help in capacity building of those associated with providing health service in state, as well as implementation of state mental health authority and mental health review boards for implementation of Mental Healthcare Act, 2017.

The TSU will help in establishing legal aid cells in regional mental hospitals as well as development and implementation of suicide prevention activities with different stakeholders in Bihar. Situational analysis of district mental health programmes will also be done to understand its strengths and gaps.

Title: Rule of law top priority: Phagu Chauhan
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Governor Phagu Chauhan addresses during the first day of Budget session of the state assembly in Patna on Mond... Read More

PATNA: Governor Phagu Chauhan on Monday said the Nitish Kumar-led government had taken several “meaningful steps” to ensure overall progress in the state, besides implementing the policy of good governance and development with justice.

Addressing a joint session of the state legislature in the central hall, the governor said, “Providing a fearless society to the people by establishing rule of law is the top priority of the government. It has put an effective check on organized crimes in the state. Police machinery has been strengthened so that it discharges its duties effectively.”

He added, “As per the crime data released by the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) for 2018, the number of registered cognisable offences in Bihar was 222.1 per lakh of population as against the national average of 383.5.”

Chauhan also hailed the statewide human chain formed on January 19 on the call of chief minister Nitish Kumar to support the government’s efforts towards environment protection. “An 18,000km-long human chain was formed in support of climate change in which 5.16 crore people participated to show their solidarity towards environment protection efforts,” he said.

The governor, in his address, also highlighted the state government’s works in the field of women empowerment and putting an effective ban on sale and consumption of liquor. He also talked about the ‘seven resolves’ of the government.

He said the state government had launched the ‘Jal-Jivan-Hariyali Abhiyan’ for creating awareness about environment protection. “A sum of Rs 24,524 crore will be spent on the campaign in a mission mode through different schemes,” he added.

Stressing that the state government had a zero-tolerance policy towards corruption, Chauhan said the Vigilance Investigation Bureau had lodged 54 cases in 2019 that included 41 of trap, six of amassing disproportionate assets and seven pertaining to misuse of power.

“A total of 85 cases have been lodged under the Bihar Special Court Act for confiscating properties worth Rs 81 crore. Besides, agencies have sent recommendations to the Enforcement Directorate to seize assets worth Rs 35.59 crore amassed by criminals for which cases have been lodged under Prevention of Money Laundering Act in 2019,” the governor said.

Title: Udyami Mela attracts 55,000 visitors in four days
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Shoppers at Mahila Udyami Mela at Gyan Bhawan in Patna on Monday

PATNA: The four-day ‘Mahila Udyami-cum-Rozgar Mela’ organized by the Women Development Corporation , a wing of the social welfare department, concluded at Gyan Bhawan on Monday.

According to the figures provided by the organizers, more than 55,000 people visited the fair and articles worth Rs 11.5 lakh were sold in four days. Altogether 842 women trained by the WDC and other agencies also got job offers from different firms.

WDC consultant Ravi Ranjan told this newspaper, “Different banks explained women entrepreneurs about the procedure of taking loans for their start-ups. Although the fair has been organized after a gap of eight years, it got a great response from people.”

Around 70 stalls, selling handicraft items, Madhubani paintings, wall-hangings, plants, artificial flowers, ‘kurtis’, dress materials, artificial jewellery, accessories, lamps, utensils and edible products, had been put up by women entrepreneurs at the fair.

A seller, Shilpa, said, “There were some customers, who visited my stall thrice, and even brought their friends and relatives along. Most of them bought wooden boxes,, tea coasters, wall hangings, clocks and other home decor items.”

Patna Women’s College student Anamika Sinha bought ‘kurtis’ and stoles. She said, “I loved the wide range of rings and earrings being sold here. I also purchased bangles, which look wonderful.”

Patliputra Colony resident Komal Agarwal bought bedsheets, curtains and other home decor items at “reasonable prices”.

A large number of people could be seen at stalls selling indoor and outdoor plants at the fair. One of the sellers, Abhijeet, was happy with the customers’ response. “Some people have even promised that they will visit my nursery in Ashiana Nagar later,” he said.

Bari Path resident Bipin Sahay loves indoor plants, especially those that purify the air. He said, “I bought spider plant and anthurium as well as wall plates and Madhubani paintings.”

Youngsters clicked pictures at the selfie points created on the premises of Gyan Bhawan.

Title: KVT offers land for hospice for cancer patients, research centre
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Varanasi: Kashi Vishwanath temple has offered it’s 40 bigha (10 hectare) land in Mirzapur district to Tata Memorial Centre for establishing an international standard hospice for cancer patients in their final phase of the terminal illness as well as a research centre for incorporating Ayurveda in cancer treatment.

A memorandum of understanding (MoU) regarding the same was signed by divisional commissioner Deepak Agrawal and TMC director Dr Rajendra A Badwe on Sunday night.

Giving details about the two projects, Badwe told TOI, “We have a hospice in Mumbai where family members of the patients in their final phase of terminal illness are imparted two-week training to take care of the patients focusing on their comfort and quality of life. As palliative care provides support to patients in reducing their sufferings, we had been planning an international standard hospice in Varanasi after opening of Mahamana Pt Madan Mohan Malviya Cancer Centre (MPMMMCC) and Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital (HBCH) here.”

Regarding incorporating ayurveda in cancer treatment, Badwe said, “Ayurveda has medicines to support in cancer treatment but they have not been tested. We have decided to study ancient Indian medications as patients often ask about adopting or supplementing their modern medicines with ancient Indian medicines. Thus a need of establishing a research centre to explore the possibility of including ayurveda in cancer treatment was felt.”

A team of TMC was recently in Varanasi to search land for these projects, said Agrawal. “As finding land for these projects was difficult in the limits of Varanasi, the TMC was offered KVT ’s 40 bigha land available at two different areas in Kakrahi village of Jamalpur area in Mirzapur district, for the hospice and research centre. The village is just 30 km away from the city. The TMC officials, after visiting the site, agreed to accept the offer.”

It was decided to sign a MoU between KVT and TMC, said Agrawal, adding that, “Now, KVT and TMC will table this proposal before their boards for final approval after which further conditions and provisions will be finalised. We are of the view that Sri Kashi Vishwanath should remain as prefix in the names of the proposed hospice and cancer research centre.”

“It will be over 80-bed hospice where apart from providing training to relatives of patients for their care at home, facility of staying till last breath if wished by any patient, will also be available, said Badwe.

Title: Shopkeepers oppose AMC’s parking and hawkers policies
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Aurangabad: The newly-announced parking and hawker zone policies of Aurangabad Municipal Corporation ( AMC ) have been opposed by the shopkeepers from markets like Paithan Gate, Tilak Path and Gulmandi.

According to the shop owners, the new policies will have a negative impact on their business. On Monday, a delegation of shopkeepers met mayor Nandkumar Ghodele and commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad, asking them to roll back the policies.

The Aurangabad Jilha Vyapari Mahasangh and Paithan Gate-Tilak Path Vyapari Association have also submitted different memorandums of their demands. They stated that for the past 10 years, the hawkers and street vendors have been conducting business on spaces in front of their shops in the market areas of the Old City that is affecting their business.

“We have been making requests to the commissioner of police to free the market space from the hawkers as it obstructs the customers from visiting their shops. Due to this inconvenience, people are not willing to visit the markets and it eventually affects our business,” a memorandum submitted by Paithan Gate-Tilak Path Vyapari Association said.

Aurangabad Jilha Vyapari Mahasangh president Jagannath Kale said the AMC has recently decided to charge a fee from the hawkers and give them licenses to run their business on the road in front of their shops.

“We object to this move and demand that until space is provided to the hawkers, the AMC should not collect fee from them otherwise the businessmen will suffer heavy losses,” he said.

Yusuf Mukati, secretary of Paithan Gate-Tilak Path Vyapari Association, said that allowing vehicles to park on the road will also affect their businesses. “Separate parking should be provided before implementation of the policy,” he said.

Ghodele said a committee, comprising AMC officials, traffic police officers and representatives of businessmen, will carry out feasibility survey of both the policies and will submit a report in eight days. “The policies will not be implemented until the report is received,” he said.

Title: 20-mark projects to help ’22 ISC students score higher
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kolkata: The Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE), in keeping with the pattern followed in the majority of the subjects at the ISC level, has decided to introduce a 20-mark project in Indian languages, English and mathematics from the 2021-2022 academic session. The theory examinations will, hence, carry 80 marks.

The change will be applicable for students promoted to Class XI this year. Internal tests, project viva or internal evaluation — ranging between 20 and 30 marks — is taken by ISC candidates in several other subjects, including physics, chemistry, biology, history and geography. “Now there will be parity among all subjects,” said a principal of a city school.

A teacher pointed out that there have always been grievances among students regarding the method of scoring in Plus-II. “The students felt that in the absence of internal marking, English, other Indian language subjects and mathematics became more difficult to score marks in. With the introduction of the 20-mark internal evaluation, it will be convenient for students to secure higher scores in these subjects too,” the teacher added.

Some educationists pointed out that introduction of projects was aimed at giving students an edge during the Board examinations.

“Many CISCE students felt they were at a disadvantage since there was less scope to score high. This problem will now be addressed. The projects will also give students an edge since the projects will expand a students domain of understanding the subject. Most boards already have such a system for mathematics,” the teacher said.

For mathematics, students may be asked to derive a solution based on Theorems while in English language, they may be asked to write essays. For English literature, student may be asked to sketch a character they have come across in their text books. “Apart from getting an opportunity to score more marks, the projects will test the students’ knowledge,” a teacher said.

Starting this year, the CISCE circular added, for subjects with more than one paper, ICSE candidates will be able to apply for a recheck of their individual papers instead of the subjects as a whole. Thus, for science, candidates will have the option of applying for a recheck of their individual physics, chemistry or biology papers.

Title: No support for Win 7, but most ATMs yet to upgrade
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Mayur Shetty | TNN

Mumbai: Several ATMs in the country continue to run on Windows 7 , even though Microsoft ended support for its decade-old operating system in January.

According to industry sources, many banks have not yet discussed an upgrade with their management service providers although an RBI circular in June 2018 mandated using supported versions of operating systems in ATMs. Given that the Indian banking industry has deployed over 2 lakh ATMs, the cost of an upgrade is expected to run into hundreds of crores.

“Support to Microsoft Win 7 is not available from January 14, 2020. Hence, it is important that all existing terminals running on Windows 7 are upgraded to Windows 10 . Alternatively, Microsoft has offered extended security updates for terminals currently running on Windows 7. However, in a case where neither of these options are availed for any terminal, the latest OS security patches will not be available for those terminals, thereby exposing them to higher security risks,” said a spokesperson for AGS Transact Technologies, which manages ATMs on behalf of banks.

“Banks would have saved a lot of money had they moved to Linux , which is preferred by Indian manufacturers over Windows. This would have also encouraged Indian manufacturing of ATMs,” said Mani Mamallan, founder of Electronic Payments and Services, which manages ATM networks on behalf of several banks.

Bankers point out that most ATMs are simple electro-mechanical devices and do not really need a high-end operating system as most functions are basic. Among other things, Windows is used in ATMs for its graphics capability. Even in cases of upgrade to Windows XP, banks continued to run the older operating system on their machines till 2019 although support had ended in 2014.

Apart from RBI regulations, the payment card industry’s data security standards (PCI-DSS) requires that operating systems should receive security patches regularly.

Title: Puri sells Rs 156cr HDFC Bank shares
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Mumbai: HDFC Bank CEO Aditya Puri sold 12.5 lakh shares of the private lender worth Rs 156 crore earlier this month. The bank informed the exchanges that Puri sold shares held by him to exercise stock options vested in his name, which would otherwise lapse imminently.

“We would like to further inform you that Puri intends to sell some more equity shares of the bank held by him through previous stock options, primarily to exercise stock options already vested in his name,” the lender said.

Puri, the founding CEO of HDFC Bank, is the longest serving bank chief in India. The bank, which he started in 1994, currently has a market capitalisation of Rs 6.6 lakh crore.

Puri’s term ends in October this year and the bank has appointed a search committee to identify a successor.

Title: Nobody wants to kill telcos: SBI
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Mumbai: State Bank of India ( SBI ) chairman Rajnish Kumar indicated that efforts are on to ensure survival of telecom sector, stating “nobody wants to kill the sector”.

Speaking to newspersons on Monday, Kumar said the bank has not heard from the government on the issue of adjusted gross revenue ( AGR ) dues of telecom companies. The firms owe the government Rs 1.47 lakh crore by way of outstanding licence fees and spectrum charges.

State Bank of India has a loan outstanding of Rs 29,000 crore from the telecom sector and another Rs 14,000 crore in bank guarantees, which can get invoked in case of a non-payment of dues by the telcos.

The Supreme Court has set a deadline of March 17 for telcos to repay their dues. Kumar Mangalam Birla, chairman, Aditya Birla Group , promoters of Vodafone Idea, had indicated the company may have to close shop if forced to pay all the claimed dues.

“Nobody wants to kill the sector, let me be very clear,” Kumar said, when asked about the problems being faced by the telecom industry.

Title: Facebook eyes minority stakes in Indian startups
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

(Representative image)

BENGALURU: Facebook is looking to back more startups as a minority investor in India, participating with traditional venture capital and private equity investors. The move is a first for the social media major, which typically invests for majority control or acquires 100% stake in other startups in the US and other markets.

“Facebook does not do minority investments anywhere in the world. This is an extremely unique Indian programme, where we are making consistent minority investments. The idea is to accelerate this even more,” said Facebook India VP & MD Ajit Mohan. He told TOI that the Menlo Park-based company, with a market capitalisation of $600 billion, will increase its pace of investments in new-age companies here.

India is the largest market in terms of customers for Facebook, which has about 260 million users as of January based on data from Statista . Messaging application WhatsApp , which is owned by Facebook, has 400 million monthly active users.

According to Mohan, Facebook does not have any constraint on the size of investments. But underlying themes would be startups that are uniquely Indian, focused on inclusion, and delivery of internet’s benefits beyond the large cities. This comes after Facebook invested in education technology startup Unacademy, along with General Atlantic, in a $110-million round last week. It had also backed social commerce startup Meesho in June last year, along with Naspers (now known as Prosus). But its first deal in India was in 2014 when it acquired Hyderabad-based performance analytics startup Little Eye Labs.

According to people aware of the matter, Facebook, for now, will largely be writing $20-25 million cheques for startups. It will focus on growth-stage startups while remaining sector-agnostic. Facebook did not comment on the investment size. Typically, these startups rely on Facebook or its group companies — WhatsApp and Instagram — for multiple aspects like building a network, advertising and marketing.

Mohan highlighted how both Meesho and Unacademy see large parts of their users being from tier-2 and -3 markets. In terms of engaging with early-stage startups, Facebook also runs its venture capital brand incubator programme where it has tied up venture capital funds like Fireside Ventures and SAIF Partners.

Mohan said he is working with many new-age ventures as part of his day-to-day mandate as many of them “disproportionately gravitate towards Facebook platforms” for various needs. On top of that, he is working along with the corporate development team, which specialises on the minority investments of Facebook in India. He did not share the details of this team.

While large Chinese internet companies like Tencent and Alibaba have emerged as active investors in multiple unicorns (worth $1-billion and more) in India, US technology majors like Google and Facebook have not been as active as investors in startups. Investors tracking the space said Facebook taking a more collaborative approach will help them partner with more startups.

“In general, good things happen to companies that have good customer engagement and are creating real value. Facebook’s entry as a minority investor is a good one since it is not looking to run these companies and founders will also be more open to having them as an investor as this is non-threatening to them,” said Prime Venture Partners managing partner Sanjay Swamy.

Title: RBI governor Shaktikanta Das: New norms on anvil for troubled lenders
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

RBI governor Shaktikanta Das (File photo)

MUMBAI: New laws for resolving troubled financial institutions is on the anvil. RBI governor Shaktikanta Das said the central bank will have an integrated framework for resolution of finance firms. Das also said the banking regulator will soon issue guidelines on corporate governance in banks.

According to Das, a new framework is on the works although the government has notified section 227 under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code ( IBC ), which provides for bankruptcy proceedings to be initiated against non-banking finance companies. One of the key issues in resolving troubled financial sector companies is that there are many retail creditors.

The government had earlier introduced the Financial Resolution and Deposit Insurance (FRDI) Bill, but had withdrawn it in 2018 after concerns over the ‘bail-in’ clause. The clause provided for retail depositors sacrificing their dues to get a lender back on track. According to reports, after hiking the deposit insurance cover to Rs 5 lakh, the centre is working on the FRDI Bill again.

“On the resolution front, some progress has been made in terms of the notification issued by the central government under section 227 of the IBC. We may, however, expect to have an integrated framework for resolution of financial firms operating in India in the near future. The implementation of this reform is of particular importance for having a resilient financial system in India,” Das said. He was speaking at Mint’s annual banking conclave in Mumbai.

Reiterating that the RBI would issue draft guidelines for corporate governance in banks, Das said the strength of a banking system depended on that of corporate governance. He pointed out that the RBI has already issued several instructions on corporate governance. These include norms for compensation of senior executives, rules for internal control systems to identify emerging risks and revised rules for conducting a concurrent audit.

Title: CCI Probe: Treebo joins CCI’s probe into Oyo, MakeMyTrip
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

(Representative image)

BENGALURU: Budget hotel chain provider Treebo has also filed a complaint against both online travel agency MakeMyTrip and rival Oyo , whose contractual relationship is already being investigated by the Competition Commission of India ( CCI ).

The CCI probe is for adverse impact on competition in the market. The complaint by Treebo, a five-year-old startup co-founded by former Myntra executives, will be included in the ongoing inquiry. CCI is investigating if MakeMyTrip abused its dominant position in online hotel booking in India for predatory pricing and high commissions.

The existing probe has been ongoing since October based on a complaint filed by the Federation of Hotel and Restaurant Associations of India (FHRAI). Treebo has alleged that MakeMyTrip is a dominant player in its market with 63% share and its “vertical integration” with Oyo creates “significant barriers of entry given the network effects”. The complaint says Oyo controls 89% of the budget and franchised hotels space.

Calls and messages to Treebo’s co-founder Sidharth Gupta did not elicit a response till the time of going to the press. MakeMyTrip said it is reviewing the “prima facie” order passed, which does not have any final or binding observations. “We are confident of demonstrating compliance with the principles of competition law, while providing our partners and consumers the best-in-class services,” a MakeMyTrip spokesperson said.

The issue started in February 2017 for an investment by MakeMyTrip that would involve Treebo listing its hotel exclusively on the OTA. As part of the negotiations, top MakeMyTrip executives, including then India CEO (now global CEO) Rajesh Magow, turned into “a threat” that Treebo would be removed from the platform, the complaint alleges. The talks then fell through and Treebo was delisted from MakeMyTrip in March 2017, but decided to list back in six months by entering an “exclusivity agreement” as it “incurred excessive losses”.

After relisting on MakeMyTrip, Treebo has faced restrictions on listing properties on other platforms like Paytm and Booking at a lower price as part of the “exclusivity arrangement”. Another issue is that Treebo was not allowed to list properties on Paytm and Booking for three days before check-in in 29 cities, including Bengaluru and Mumbai, and for 30 days in another 25 cities, which includes Delhi and Goa. Treebo said it had “no option but to accept the conditions” in the exclusivity arrangement.

The move effectively gave control to MakeMyTrip over Treebo’s inventory, according to people familiar with the investigation. “65-70% of the business in the budget hotel chains happens three days before the check-in date,” an industry executive told TOI.

Other players in the budget hotel space are also joining the CCI investigation as potential witnesses. In an order earlier in the month, the commission said it is satisfied that Fab Hotels has a substantial interest in the outcome of the proceedings and that it is necessary to allow it to present its opinion in this matter for a meaningful investigation.

Fab Hotels ($50 million in total funding) and Treebo ($57 million in total funding) competed with Oyo, which has been backed by Japanese investment giant SoftBank and has raised over $3 billion in funding.

“We have the utmost faith in our administrative and judicial processes. We will continue to engage with honourable CCI. We are also thankful for the CCI’s recognition of the fact that Oyo is a hotel chain and for dismissing certain prima facie allegations against the company. We have nothing more to share at the moment,” an Oyo spokesperson said.

Title: Rajkot: New town planning scheme finalized for area around AIIMS
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Posh Ghanteshwar and Parapipariya areas are set to be brought under Rajkot Municipal Corporation limits after ... Read More

RAJKOT: The Rajkot Urban Development Authority (RUDA) has finalized the town planning (TP) scheme for posh Ghanteshwar and Parapipariya areas that are set to be merged in the Rajkot Municipal Corporation (RMC), paving way for more development projects in the area. A notification regarding merger has already been issued by the state government.

Parapipariya is where the new All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) is coming up.

RUDA has also proposed a new 10-12 storey building for itself as the current one had become old and lacked enough space. The building has been proposed in Mota Mauva area at the coast of Rs 25 crore.

The proposed TP scheme for Ghanteshwar and Parapipariya is likely to come up for discussion along with the new building proposal, on February 27. It has been proposed to convert the TP for Ghanteshwar and Parapipariya into a preliminary scheme from draft.

The draft TP was sent into the state government in 2018 for approval but it was sent back in December last year. The RUDA has to give it’s final opinion on the TP scheme. According to RUDA officials, after draft TP gets converted into the preliminary scheme, they can reserve the plots for various purposes like school, garden and other housing and development works.

With regard to the new building, chief executive officer of RUDA, Chetan Ganatra, said, “We will propose to appoint an architect to give us an estimate for the new building during the board meeting.”

“The current building is 22-years-old and it’s very congested. As the work load has increased, we are recruiting more staff. But we need more space for that,” he added.

Title: TVS cuts February output by 10% on Covid impact
Content:
(File photo)

CHENNAI: Country’s third largest two and three wheeler maker, TVS Motor on Monday said that its vehicle production for February would be 10% lower due to Corona virus outbreak in China.There is a supply chain disruption caused due to the outbreak of Corona virus as parts suppliers in China are either shut or have fewer workmen reporting for work.At TVS Motor Company, the outbreak of pandemic Coronavirus (COVID-19) has led to impact on supply of certain components for production of BS-VI vehicles.China is a key part of the global automobile supply chain.While TVS Motor’s direct dependency on China is limited for components, some Tier II suppliers have been impacted adversely which will lead to 10% drop in the planned production in February 2020. All efforts are on to normalise this at the earliest, a company statement said.KN Radhakrishnan, director & CEO, TVS Motor Company, said, “At TVS Motor Company, we have completely transitioned to BS-VI in the month of January 2020. To minimise the impact on production of BS-VI vehicles, we are consistently monitoring developments with those of our suppliers who are sourcing certain components from China. Parallelly, we are also exploring suppliers in other regions and are looking to localise within India,” he said.

Title: Jamui MP Chirag Paswan seeks CBI probe into alleged paper leak
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Chirag Paswan

PATNA: LJP chief and Jamui MP Chirag Paswan on Monday wrote a letter to CM Nitish Kumar and demanded a CBI probe into the alleged paper leak in the police sub-inspector recruitment examination conducted by Bihar Police Subordinate Selection Commission (BPSSC) in December last year.

Around 5.86 lakh candidates appeared for the preliminary test (PT) for altogether 2,446 posts of sub-inspector, sergeant and assistant superintendent jail, held at around 495 examination centres across the state on December 22 last year. The PT results were published on January 28 this year.

“During my recent visit to different places in the state, I was informed by the aspirants that the question papers were leaked before the examination. Applicants had also held protests on December 26 and 30 last year,” Paswan has said in his letter.

“The aspirants went to the BPSSC office on January 7 and submitted certain proof of the paper leak to the officer on special duty (OSD) at the commission. The OSD assured the aspirants that an inquiry would be conducted on their complaint and they would be invited during the probe. But without conducting a proper investigation, the PT results were announced. Because of this, applicants called for a ‘Bihar Bandh’ and held demonstrations on February 4, 13 and 20 this year demanding a CBI investigation. The police resorted to lathicharge and many applicants were injured. Some of the agitating aspirants were sent to jails,” Chirag has stated in his letter.

“I request you to look into the demand of the aspirants and take necessary step for a CBI probe into the matter. I also demand immediate release of the arrested aspirants,” Chirag said.

Earlier on Saturday, Chirag supported the agitating contractual teachers. He said the demands of niyojit (contractual) teachers of the government schools, who have been on an indefinite strike since February 17, would be included in his party’s manifesto for the upcoming assembly elections due later this year.

Around 4.5 lakh teachers of the government schools have been on strike with their eight-point charter of demands, which include ‘equal pay for equal work’.

Title: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot asks Centre to increase its share for water projects to 90%
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Ashok Gehlot

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot has requested the union water resources minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat to increase the Centre’s share from 50% to 90% in the Jal Shakti Mission project , considering Rajasthan ’s difficult climatic and topographical conditions.

In a letter to the union minister, the chief minister said, “Rajasthan has been included in the category of states like Bihar, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Gujarat and Chhattisgarh where the Centre and states share 50:50 ratio for the project but the climatic condition of Rajasthan varies widely from these states. Rajasthan is the largest state and availability of water here is the lowest.”

Gehlot pointed out that about 85% of the state is now in the dark zone where underground water has gone down drastically.

The CM wrote that in desert areas, the villages are scattered and located in far flung areas due to which the drinking water projects are highly expensive compared to other states. Since the Union minister hails from the state, he is aware of the issue of water crisis and the ground situation in the state, he mentioned.

Gehlot said in 2013 under the national rural drinking water programme, the Centre was initially bearing 90% of the cost for the desert state but this was later reduced on a 60:40 ratio and now to 50:50.

The CM said in the 13 districts in eastern part of the state where water crisis is the worst, providing five litres of water per person is an impossible task without a river linking project. But that involves huge investment. He asked the Centre to assist the state liberally to execute such a project.

Title: PSC to act tough against coaching centres
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Kerala Public Service Commission (PSC) will ask the state government and the police to initiate measures against those misusing the name of PSC to run ‘PSC coaching centres’. The decision was taken at a board meeting held on Monday in the wake of growing complaints against coaching centres run by senior government employees and their alleged nexus with PSC staff for leaking question papers.

The meeting chaired by chairman M K Sakeer also entrusted PSC’s regional and district officials to identify coaching centres across the state, which are misusing PSC’s name, and to recommend action. The chairman, on Sunday, had clarified that PSC had nothing to do with these private coaching centres, and the board’s decision would mean that these centres will no more be allowed to advertise or function as ‘PSC coaching centres’.

Meanwhile, vigilance and anti-corruption bureau (VACB) questioned the two government secretariat employees against whom vigilance probe was ordered for running PSC coaching centres. The VACB on Sunday had raided two centres in Thampanoor — Lakshya and Veto — allegedly run by these employees working in the general administration department.

The raid was conducted after GAD principal secretary K R Jyothilal ordered a vigilance inquiry against the employees on a request by the PSC secretary who had received complaints against the duo from a group of PSC candidates. The vigilance team is also inquiring into the assets of the two employees against whom the allegations have been raised.

The employees are learned to have dismissed the allegations that they have any connection or influence over the PSC staff for leaking question papers. One of them produced documents to prove that he has the required permission from the government to publish guides for candidates appearing for PSC exams.

During Sunday’s raid, the VACB’s special unit 2 team led by DSP Prasad could gather preliminary evidence to prove the employees’ connection with the two coaching centres, besides catching red-handed a fire and rescue department person who was found giving lectures at one of the centres.

Title: Sensex tanks 807 pts, gold at lifetime high of Rs 43,250
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Mumbai: The sensex recorded its second-biggest fall this year on Monday in line with global markets as the coronavirus infection spread to Italy, Iran and South Korea. Risk-averse investors turned to gold, which hit a lifetime high of Rs 43,250 per 10gm in Mumbai (for 99.5 purity). The gold price for 99.9 purity was Rs 49,500.

The 30-share index fell 807 points, or nearly 2%, to close at 40,363. The fall in equities was led by stocks of automobiles, pharmaceuticals and consumer durables over fears of disruption of supplies from China, which accounts for 14% of India’s imports.

In the foreign currency markets, the rupee fell 34 paise to close at a more than three-month low of 72 against the dollar, as there was flight to safety.

In Europe, early trades saw Britain’s FTSE 100 fall nearly 3.5%, while the CAC 40 in Paris as well as Germany’s DAX lost almost 4%.

The Dow Jones was down nearly 3% after opening on Monday but slipped further by over 1,000 points (see graphic). South Korea’s Kospi fell 3.9% with 231 new cases of the virus being reported on Monday. Earlier in the day, Sydney’s ASX/200 lost 2.3% and Hong Kong’s Hang Seng dropped 1.8%.

Auto companies, represented in the BSE auto index, were hit the most with the index declining 3.3% on fears of disruption of supplies from China. Tata Motors and Eicher Motors were down 5%, and so were Maruti Suzuki (4.2%), Hero MotoCorp (2.5%) and Mahindra & Mahindra (2.2%).

“Headline indices are down around 2% across all market cap categories, suggesting that the broad-based sell-off is largely in response to weakness in sentiment across the region and spilling over into European trading,” said Emkay Global Financial Services head (sales trading) S Hariharan.

“News around the spread of the coronavirus and its concomitant impact on trade and activity levels have been the strongest driver of daily moves in the last few sessions and would continue to be a major factor. The auto sector has been the worst hit over the last two weeks, driven primarily by concerns on supply chain disruptions,” he added.

Banks were hit hard over fears of fresh non-performing assets with the government digging in its heels over its demand for adjusted gross revenue dues from telecom companies. ICICI Bank was down 3% and Axis Bank 2.4%. “We believe new forms of stress are emerging (for banks). On the retail side, we have stress from agriculture and commercial vehicle space, and on the corporate side there is stress in real estate, telecom and small and medium enterprises/mid-corporate space,” said Macquarie Capital Securities research analyst (financials) Suresh Ganapathy.

Title: Drizzle brings temp down by 3°C
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kolkata: The city woke up to a light drizzle on Monday under the impact of a cyclonic circulation. As the day progressed, the cloud cover receded and the drizzle stopped, but it brought the maximum temperature down by around three degrees to 27.1°C. The Met office predicted that it could remain overcast on Tuesday and the city could receive light to moderate showers during the day.

A cyclonic circulation — that has triggered rain — reached east Uttar Pradesh and Bihar on Monday. It is set to move towards north Bengal on Tuesday, leading to moderate rain across the districts of Malda, North and South Dinajpur, Jalpaiguri, Cooch Behar and Darjeeling. South Bengal, on the other hand, could receive light to moderate showers till Wednesday afternoon.

“Some parts of the city could receive steady drizzles on Tuesday, but heavy showers are unlikely. Since the circulation is moving towards north Bengal, the sub-Himalayan districts could receive moderate rain,” said G K Das, director, Regional Meteorological Centre, Kolkata.

The rain will provide temporary relief from the early summer heat that has started setting in. Last Thursday, the day temperature had soared past the 30-degree mark for the first time this season. With the cool northwesterly wind having stopped, the mercury will now rise steadily, the weathermen said.

Title: Cash growth slow since DeMo: RBI
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Mumbai: The RBI has said that if notes in circulation had grown at the same pace as pre-demonetisation levels, the currency in circulation would be Rs 3.7 lakh crore higher than it currently is.

The RBI said notes in circulation increased at an average rate of 14% between October 2014 and October 2016, in a report on the progress of digitisation of payments. “Assuming the same growth rate, notes in circulation would have been Rs 26 lakh crore in October 2019. However, it was Rs 22.3 lakh crore, indicating digitation and reduction in cash usage helped reduce notes in circulation,” the RBI said.

According to the report, retail digital payments have registered a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 56% since December 2015 to hit 325 crores in 2019. In value terms, the CAGR has been 30% during the same period.

However, the report notes that share of cash in the Indian economy continues to be high. “India continues to have a strong bias for cash payments. Demonetisation and active growth in GDP brought down the cash in circulation as a percentage of GDP to 8.7% in 2016-17. This increased to 10.7% in 2017-18 and 11.2% in 2018-19, which, however, is less than the pre-demonetisation level of 12.1% in 2015-16,” the report said. It added that the rate of increase is lower, indicating a perceptible shift away from cash.

The high dependence on cash is reflected on the cash withdrawals from ATMs, which have increased over five years. While India is next only to China in terms of the cash withdrawals from ATMs, the percentage of cash withdrawals to GDP has been constant in India at around 17%. Also, with a CAGR of 9% in terms of volume and 10% in terms of value, the growth has been slow when compared to digital payment transactions (which grew at a CAGR of 61% and 19% in terms of volume and value, respectively), indicating a shift towards digitisation, the report said. Further, ATMs have grown at a low pace (CAGR of 4%) in the past five years.

Title: TechNova CMD awarded by printers’ body
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Mumbai: TechNova Imaging Systems CMD and founder Pranav Parikh has won the MMS Lifetime Achievement Award for 2020. The award was conferred by Maharashtra governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari in Mumbai last week.

It was during the golden jubilee year of the printers’ body Mumbai Mudrak Sangh (MMS) in 2004 that this award was instituted. Since then, the award ceremony has also been used to celebrate Printer’s Day and to honour the inventor of the movable type, Johannes Gutenberg. Former MMS president Anand Limaye said, “This is an industry trail blazer who has contributed to our industry through innovative development and creating a mark in the international market, plus giving back to society.”

He added, “Today, TechNova is the fourth-largest manufacturer in plate-making and second-largest in chemicals. It is my personal opinion, but thanks to TechNova, the prices of plates are under control in India. He is a man of integrity and ideas, and a believer in processes and systems.”

Title: Bihar: Primary teachers to protest at block headquarters on Thursday
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative Image

PATNA: Teachers of primary government and government-aided schools would hold protest march near the collectorates across the state on March 5 and submit the memorandum of their demands to the district magistrates concerned.

Bihar Rajya Shikshak Sangharsh Samanvay Samiti (BRSSSS) convener Brajnandan Sharma said on Monday that all primary schoolteachers would hold ‘Aakrosh’ march to collectorates in support of the contractual teachers’ demands of equal pay for equal work and old pension scheme among others. Sharma said the decision was taken at a meeting of primary schoolteachers’ associations in Bihar.

“On February 27, protesting teachers would hold dharna at block headquarters with their family members whereas on March 1, they would gherao the government bungalows of legislators to press for the revocation of the termination of regular and niyojit teachers,” Sharma, who is also the president of Bihar State Primary Teachers’ Association, said.

Around 4.5 lakh teachers of 32 associations or organizations have been on indefinite strike since February 17 under the banner of BRSSSS. So far, two regular teachers — Manoj Kumar and Mohd Mustafa — in Patna have been terminated for not reporting to the examination centre for invigilation duty whereas over 250 niyojit teachers have been served show-cause notices for the same reason.

Meanwhile, around 40,000 teachers of secondary and higher secondary schools would also join the indefinite protest from February 25 by boycotting the evaluation duty of Intermediate examination, which is scheduled to begin the same day.

The high schoolteachers’ demands include service conditions for niyojit teachers, not to involve them in non-academic activities and remove the discrepancies of salary payment.

Title: Bihar: Muslim bodies urge CM to pass resolution against NPR and NRC
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Nitish Kumar

PATNA: The representatives of Muslim religious bodies and social organizations on Monday urged chief minister Nitish Kumar to pass a resolution by the state legislature against National Population Register (NPR) in the present format and National Register of Citizens ( NRC ) in Bihar.

The religious bodies and social organizations making such demands included Imarat Shariah, Jamaat-e-Islami Hind, Jamiat Ulema, Khanqah Munimia and Loktantrik Jan Pehal. Their representatives said they will go against NPR, if not implemented in its old format.

CM Nitish Kumar, however, has already said in Darbhanga on Sunday that he would allow the NPR in Bihar only in its old format and there was no question of implementing NRC in the state.

“We welcome what chief minister has said in Darbhanga and expect only the old format of NPR to be used in Bihar,” said Maulana Shamimuddin Ahmad Munemi of Khanqah Munimia, Patna City. “If new format of NPR is implemented then we will go against that,” he added.

The state president of Jamaat-e-Islami Hind, Maulana Rizwan Ahmad Islahi, said the condition of country has deteriorated since the new CAA came into existence and discussions on NRC and NPR began. “We want the gazette notification of NPR to be recalled and reverted to old format. We request our CM to listen to the voice of people and pass a resolution in the House in this regard,” he said.

Imarat Shariah (Bihar, Jharkhand and Orrisa) acting general secretary Maulana Shibli al-Qasmi appreciated Nitish’s announcement in Darbhanga and called CAA a black law.

Loktantrik Jan Pehal convener Satyanarayan Madan said in the last Census, people were not asked to show documents, but in the present format of NPR they have to show various documents. “This is the beginning of NRC. Nitish should take some substantive steps, instead of giving political statements. He (Nitish) should pass a resolution in the House not to implement NPR in its present format,” said Madan.

He further said Assam government had asked for authentication of 73,019 citizens from Bihar government staying there and a letter in this regard was sent by director of land acquisition department to all the district magistrates on October 12, 2018. “The DMs were asked to verify the names on the list sent by Assam government. But only 17,227 could be verified and over 55,000 people lost their citizenship in Assam. Even if they are given citizenship under CAA, they will be treated as refugees,” said Madan.

Others present at the press conference were Jamait-e-Ulema state general secretary Alhaz Husn Ahmad-Qadri, Sajjadanashi of Khanqah Shah Arzani Syyed Shah Anzar Hussain, Swaraj India member Rishi Anand, state general secretary of Majlis Khutba Amamia Maulana Syyed Amanat Hussain, state general secretary of All India Majlis-e-Mushawarat Anwar-ul-Hoda, Bihar Rabta Committee secretary Afzal Hussain and Maulana Khurshid Ahmad Madni of Jamiyat-e-Ahle Hadis.

Later, through a press release, Maulana Qasmi extended support to the Vidhan Sabha march organized by CPI-ML against CAA, NRC and NPR from Chitkohra on Tuesday and asked people to participate in it.

Title: Poultry farming, egg production boost rural economy of Bihar
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Sushil Kumar Modi

PATNA: The foodgrain production in the state has registered sustained growth. The Economic Survey 2019-20, based on the achievements made in the 2018-19, noted that the potential of the primary sector (agriculture) needed to be tapped to give a boost to the rural economy and, thereby, through it to the state’s economy itself.

The Economic Survey report tabled in both the Houses of state legislature on Monday, has noted that foodgrain (rice, wheat, maize and pulses) production in the state stood at 163.12 lakh tonnes in 2018-19.

Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi, who tabled the survey report in the state assembly, later said the state has won Krishi Karman Award twice from the Centre for the record production of maize and wheat.

The Economic Survey has noted that as the farmers of the state are faced with extreme weather conditions arising from climate change, the state government has launched the ‘jalvayu ke anukul krishi’ (climate resilient agriculture) as part of the Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali campaign. The stress is also on restoring underground water resources by recharging and ponds and wetlands were being revived and renovated for that.

While the state has been making headway in foodgrain production and other cash crops (like vegetables), it has made a remarkable achievement in poultry farming, as egg production increased in the state from 111.17 crore in 2016-17 to 176.34 crore in 2018-19, Modi said, adding that even fish production increased from 4.79 lakh tonnes in 2013-14 to 6.02 lakh tonnes in 2018-19. Poultry and fish farming are considered an allied activity in the agriculture sector.

In tune with the trend, the government took to promoting organic farming of vegetables in 12 districts — Patna, Buxar, Bhojpur, Nalanda, Vaishali, Saran, Samastipur, Begusarai, Lakhisarai, Khagaria, Bhagalpur and Munger. A sum of Rs155.88 crore had been earmarked to extend support to the farmers concerned who take to organic farming, said the report.

It has also pointed out that the operational agro-based factories in the state have registered an annual growth rate of 16.4% over the last 10 years, compared to only 3.3% at the national level.

The report noted that Rs742.54 crore was invested in food processing industries during 2017-18 and 2018-19, which is the “highest among all the industries classified as the high priority sector.”

Title: Dalit youth murdered in caste clash in Tiruvannamalai
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kalaiarasan

TIRUVANNAMALAI: Five two-wheelers were torched after a dalit youth was stabbed to death, allegedly by a group of vanniyars, at Vilvarani near Polur in Tiruvannamalai district on Sunday evening, police said. More than 150 police personnel were deployed in the village’s dalit colony.

Demanding compensation to the family of the slain youth, Kalaiarasan, 25, and action against the gang, including prime accused Dayalan, members of the dalit colony blocked Chenagam-Polur Road, disrupting traffic till Monday evening.

Superintendent of Police M R Cibi Chakravarthi told TOI that a case was registered under various sections of the IPC and the SC/ST (prevention of atrocities) Act against 11 accused. While Dayalan and his friend Dilipan, 27, were arrested, a hunt is on for the others including a final year UG college student, he said.

A senior police officer said ahead of former chief minister J Jayalaithaa’s birthday, rural games were organized for schoolchildren on Sunday evening, when a few vanniyar youths including Dayalan of neighbouring Ambavaram Thoppu were chided by people in the dalit colony for teasing girl students.

The argument led to a scuffle and Dayalan was injured after he allegedly abused the dalits by their caste name. Dayalan left in anger and returned a few from his community, the officer said. They began attacking the dalit, stabbed Kalaiarasan, who was present in the crowd, and fled.

Kalaiarasan, son of M Maheshwari, 48, a widow, was rushed to Government Tiruvannamalai Medical College and Hospital where he died.

Title: Veteran banker Nanoo Pamnani dies aged 74
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

MUMBAI: Veteran Citibanker and chairman of Bajaj Finserv Nanoo Pamnani passed away on Saturday aged 74. Pamnani, who headed Citibank in India between 2004 and 2006, had joined Bajaj Finserv’s board after the business was demerged from Bajaj Auto in 2008.
