The company said in his 16 years of journey with Bajaj, he was on the boards of several group companies including Bajaj Finserv (chairman), Bajaj Auto, Bajaj Finance (VC), Bajaj Housing Finance (chairman), Bajaj Holdings, Bajaj Allianz Life Insurance and Bajaj Allianz General Insurance.

An alumnus of the London School of Economics , and Mumbai’s Elphinstone College, Pamnani began his career with Citi in the early ’80s. At 37, he was among the youngest CEOs at the bank. He headed Citibank Philipines and was involved in the country’s debt rescheduling.

Title: HUL sets up wholly owned manufacturing subsidiary
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

(File photo)

MUMBAI: Hindustan Unilever ( HUL ) is perhaps the first large company to take advantage of the lower corporate tax by announcing setting up of a 100% subsidiary for greenfield manufacturing. The FMCG major on Monday said its board of directors approved a proposal to form a 100% subsidiary to help the company “become more agile and customer-focused”.

The government had slashed the corporate tax rate from 30% to 22%, and for new manufacturing entities the corporate tax rate was brought down to 15%. HUL, which is a market leader in several FMCG categories, falls under the 22% corporate tax bracket. Any new manufacturing undertaken by HUL would be taxed at this rate.

However, new manufacturing units set up by the wholly owned subsidiary, which is yet to be named, would attract a lower tax rate of 15%. The company has a window to set up manufacturing units under the new subsidiary before March 2023.

HUL CFO Srinivas Phatak told TOI, “The move is in alignment with the government’s ‘Make in India’ initiative and it will also create new employment. We will explore all possibilities in manufacturing under the new subsidiary. It could also mean that some of the products that are currently imported, could be manufactured locally.”

The new subsidiary will have an authorised share capital of Rs 2,000 crore. It is expected to become operational in 12-18 months. An initial investment of Rs 500-800 crore is expected to go into setting up FMCG manufacturing units under the new entity. “The law on the new tax regime is clear and there is a thrust on investments,” said Phatak.

Other manufacturing companies may follow the example of HUL. Tax and corporate law advocate Mohamed Nawaz Haindaday said, “Under the new corporate tax regime, a company opting for the tax rate of 15% can look forward to improving its margins or profitability at the cost of forsaking the carry forward of unutilised depreciation and set off losses. Such corporates would lose on the MAT (minimum alternate tax) credits which they would have otherwise paid and accumulated under the higher tax rate regime.”

HUL has 28 manufacturing units across India. The Rs 38,000-crore company employs about 18,000 people. According to the company’s annual report for 2018-19, HUL has 10 wholly owned subsidiaries and one in which HUL has 80% ownership.

Title: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot asks Centre to increase its share for water projects to 90%
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Ashok Gehlot

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot has requested the union water resources minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat to increase the Centre’s share from 50% to 90% in the Jal Shakti Mission project , considering Rajasthan ’s difficult climatic and topographical conditions.

In a letter to the union minister, the chief minister said, “Rajasthan has been included in the category of states like Bihar, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Gujarat and Chhattisgarh where the Centre and states share 50:50 ratio for the project but the climatic condition of Rajasthan varies widely from these states. Rajasthan is the largest state and availability of water here is the lowest.”

Gehlot pointed out that about 85% of the state is now in the dark zone where underground water has gone down drastically.

The CM wrote that in desert areas, the villages are scattered and located in far flung areas due to which the drinking water projects are highly expensive compared to other states. Since the Union minister hails from the state, he is aware of the issue of water crisis and the ground situation in the state, he mentioned.

Gehlot said in 2013 under the national rural drinking water programme, the Centre was initially bearing 90% of the cost for the desert state but this was later reduced on a 60:40 ratio and now to 50:50.

The CM said in the 13 districts in eastern part of the state where water crisis is the worst, providing five litres of water per person is an impossible task without a river linking project. But that involves huge investment. He asked the Centre to assist the state liberally to execute such a project.

Title: As judgment day nears, farmers form human chain to seek justice
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: With the petitions challenging the bills establishing three capital cities and repealing Capital Region Development Authority Act to come up for hearing on February 26, agitating farmers of the capital city region have pinned their hopes on the high court. On Monday morning, the farmers formed a human chain at the Seed Access Road from Venkatapalem to Rayapudi and held up placards pleading the judges, who use the road to reach the court,to do justice.

The capital region farmers continued their protests for the 69th day on Monday. While relay hunger strikes continued at Velagapudi , Mandadam, Thulluru, Rayapudi, Pedaparimi and Tadikonda, dharnas were staged at Tadikonda crossroad and other villages. Meanwhile, beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana held a rally demanding that the government complete the houses under construction at Thulluru.

On the one hand, Amaravati Parirakshana Joint Action Committee (JAC) has announced that they will intensify protests from February 26. The convenor of JAC, R Swamy said they are going to conduct a huge rally in Vijayawada on Wednesday for which police permission has already been sought. A round-table conference with all political parties is also scheduled to be held on February 29 at Vijayawada. Meanwhile, a delegation of farmers will again visit Delhi to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union home minister Amit Shah as the officials from the Prime Minister’s office have asked them to be available in Delhi, he said.

On the other hand, war of words broke out between farmers and YSRC activists over the stalling of Bapatla MP Nandigam Suresh’s convoy on February 23 at Lemalle village. While farmers alleged that aides of Suresh attacked the women protesters, YSRC workers held a rally at Amaravati condemning the attack on Suresh. Women at Thulluru formed a human chain on their knees and demanded the arrest of Suresh under Disha Act for unleashing brute force on women protesters. The YSRC has denied the allegations and counter-alleged that, in fact, Suresh and his gunman were attacked by TDP workers in the guise of farmers.

Title: Two arrested for abducting minor girl in Junagadh
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

Title: Newly-wed woman dies in accident
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: A woman riding pillion with her husband on a bike was killed after a truck rammed the two-wheeler from the rear near Aji Dam Chowkadi on Sunday night.

Police said deceased Kajal Chudasma (18) and recently married Uttam Chudasma and were living in Shapar-Veraval of the city. Uttam survied with severe injuries, but his conditions is said to be stable.

According to the police, the newly-wed couple was returning home after paying visit to their aunt in Manchhanagar, when they met with the accident.

“An unidentified truck driver rammed their motorcycle from the rear and fled from the accident spot. While Uttam survived the accident with injuries, Kajal, who had received severe head injuries, died on the spot,” said Aji Dam police.

Cops have booked the unidentified truck driver and launched a manhunt for him.

Title: JNTU-H ninth convocation in May
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University (File photo)

HYDERABAD: Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University , Hyderabad (JNTU-H) will conduct its ninth convocation ceremony in May.

The varsity recently issued a notification for the convocation seeking applications from those who have completed or will complete their undergraduate, post-graduate, MPhil or PhD courses before February 24.

Only gold medal recipients will be awarded their medals in person at the event, the provisional list of which shall be declared by the university on its official website on April 22.

All eligible candidates can register for the convocation from March 11 to April 16. They must pay a fee of Rs 600 to be a part of the convocation.

The university has set up a helpline desk for the convocation at the student service section in the examination building (ground floor), which will be open on all working days from 10:30am to 5pm. JNTUH had conducted its last convocation on May 9, 2018.

Title: ‘Matric exams end peacefully’
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

PATNA: The Matriculation exams, which are conducted by the Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB), concluded peacefully at 1,643 centres across the state on Monday.

As many as 19,180 candidates appeared for optional papers like music, home science, dance and fine arts in two sittings (9.30am to 12.15pm and 1.45pm to 4.30pm) on the last day. Some students also wrote mathematics, science, Sanskrit, Maithili, Persian and Arabic papers.

Altogether 15.29 lakh students, including 7.82 lakh girls, took the Matric exams , which had begun on February 17.

According to the data released by the BSEB, 368 candidates were barred from writing exams for malpractices. Of these, 83 were from Bhojpur, 43 from Nalanda, 25 from Gaya, 22 from Madhepura, 18 each from Munger, Jamui and Rohtas, 17 from Patna, 16 from Madhubani, 12 from Samastipur and 11 from Arwal, nine each from Saran and Siwan, eight from Aurangabad, seven each from Vaishali and Nawada, six from Jehanabad, five each from Buxar, Begusarai, Gopalganj, Saharsa and Supaul, three from Khagaria, two each from West Champaran, Lakhisarai, Purnia, Sheohar, East Champaran and Darbhanga, and one each from Banka, Muzaffarpur and Sheikhpura.

There were also 11 impersonators, who were caught during the exams. Of these, four cases each were reported in Madhubani and Gaya, two in Nawada and one in Rohtas.

BSEB chairman Anand Kishor claimed that the examinations were conducted peacefully, but many students were booked for adopting unfair means.

“The BSEB will upload the answer key for objective type questions of Matriculation and Intermediate exams to its official website soon,” Kishor said, adding the evaluation of Intermediate answer sheets was likely to begin from February 25.

Title: Build own tech capability: Nadella to cos
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Mumbai: With every sector from hospitals to hotels embedding technology in their systems more than ever before, building tech capabilities will be the defining factor of the coming decade, said Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella .

Speaking at a Microsoft-organised ‘Future Decoded’ summit in Mumbai on Monday, Nadella urged organisations to build their own tech intensity.

Some 150 India Inc leaders, including Kotak Mahindra Bank VC & MD Uday Kotak, Tata Steel CEO T V Narendran, Hindustan Unilever CMD Sanjiv Mehta, Pidilite Industries MD Bharat Puri, SBI chairman Rajnish Kumar and McCann Worldgroup India CEO Prasoon Joshi, attended the event.

“Our mission is to empower organisations to achieve more — on how we can help you build your own independence,” Nadella said, while adding that 72% of job openings for software engineers come from outside the tech sector. Microsoft hires the second-largest number of engineers from India.

In a fireside chat with Nadella, Reliance Industries CMD Mukesh Ambani said, “The opportunity that we have for India really is the opportunity to become the premier digital society in the world.”

“I have no doubt that we will become among the top three economies in the world. We can argue about whether it will happen in five years or 10 years, but it’s going to happen. When that happens, our opportunity will be to see if we can be the most tech-enabled society,” said Ambani, who has entered into a long-term alliance with Microsoft to accelerate digital transformation.

Nadella’s visit coincides with Donald Trump’s maiden India visit as US President. “As we are speaking, President Trump has arrived in Ahmedabad, and the India that he will see in 2020 is very different from what President (Jimmy) Carter or (Bill) Clinton or even (Barack) Obama saw. I can easily say that the mobile networks in India now are better or on a par with anybody else in the world. And that’s the big change,” said Ambani.

Commenting on Nadella’s career trajectory, Ambani said, “You joined Microsoft in 1992, when India was a $300-billion economy. Today, India is $3-trillion.”

Title: Short stint: 18 SHOs shunted from Gomtinagar police station in 5 yrs
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Lucknow: The Gomtinagar police station is earning notoriety among police officials for instability and short tenures with as many as 18 station house officers being shunted out within months of posting in last five years.

On an average, one officer served for just three-and-half-months at the police station in the city’s VIP area.

In comparison, among the other police stations falling in VIP areas, 10 Vibhutikhand SHOs were transferred in five years, while five were shifted out in Hazratganj, as per records accessed by TOI.

Besides, records also show that Gomtinagar police station has the highest pendency of around 1,200 unsolved criminal cases in last five years, followed by 400 in Vibhutikhand and 396 in Hazratganj in the same period.

In most transfers of SHOs from Gomtinagar police station, police administration had cited spurt in crime due to laxity and poor supervision as the reason. However, despite frequent reshuffling, the crime rate did not come down.

The Gomtinagar police station saw the arrival and departure of three SHOs in 2015, two others in 2016, five in 2017, five more in 2018 and two in 2019. Among these SHOs, Amber Singh was suspended and shifted in March 2018, within a month after joining, because he did not register a missing complaint. His successor, Jitendra Pratap Singh, was also given marching orders within a month for failure in controlling a mob angry over the death of a child in road accident.

Triloki Nath Singh, who took charge in October 2018, was shifted following 20 thefts in the area within a month.

Syed Mohammed Abbas enjoyed the longest tenure as SHO Gomtinagar in five years, and served for eight months from January 2015.

“Gomtinagar is a sensitive posting since top politicians, judges, bureaucrats, businessmen and advocates live in the area. You can understand the kind of pressure we deal with,” said a senior police officer, who has served as Gomtinagar circle officer.

Title: Foundry sector records 10%-15% drop in demand due to poor tractor sales
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Chennai: The demand for metal castings has seen a fall of 10%-15% due to slowdown in automotive sales, more particularly tractors, senior official at Indian Institute of Foundrymen (IIF) said on Monday. “However, we do expect demand to pick up in next 6-9 months of 2020-21, especially with the proposed scrappage policy round the corner,” said Sanjay Shroff, president, IIF. On the other hand, the foundry industry has seen about 200% increase in demand for exports from the United States and Europe who are looking at an alternative source for supplies — that otherwise come from China — given the instability caused by coronavirus breakout.

“Though this sudden demand is a welcome trend, there is a higher demand and supply gap. At present, we have only 30%-40% supply to meet this sudden demand,” said SRV Ramanan, managing director of Sri Venkatachalapathy Alloys.

With the roll out of BSVI powered automotive vehicles from April 1, the foundry sector is optimistic about seeing a pick-up in demand from the auto industry. “The foundry industry can grow at 8%-10% YoY keeping in view the Government policies — launch of electric vehicles and BSVI-compliant vehicles — and stable interventions and investments in technology (induction melting, greener technologies in sand reclamation, semi-mechanization for better production, IT & simulation software), skilling and focussing on value addition. Production is also expected to go up to 19-20 million TPA (compared to current 13.4 million TPA currently) and turnover is expected to improve at $29-$30 billion for the sector (compared to $20 billion currently),” Shroff said.

Demand from railways is expected to grow by 10% on yearly basis, while it consumes 4.5-5 lakh TPA of castings currently. Similarly, the defence sector is expected to drive demand for highly value added complex castings of special metallurgies for critical applications. There are about 4,500 foundries across India incuding in Chennai, Coimbatore, Hyderabad, Belagavi, Kolkata, Sholapur, Rajkot, Mumbai, Ahmedabad, and are largely in the MSME category employing over 2 million people.

Title: Documents of illegally parked cars may not be renewed
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kolkata: To curb the menace of illegal night parking on city roads, the civic authorities are asking the transport department to withhold their certificate of fitness (CF) and pollution-under-control certificate (PUC). KMC officials have discussed the issue with the transport department and the state pollution control board and urged PVD to share data on vehicles with contact numbers of the owners. The data will be incorporated in an app that is under development to help bring down illegal night parking.

Car parking department officials said that while there are specified night parking lots in the city, a large number of commercial, as well as private, vehicles are usually parked outside these spaces to avoid payment of night parking fee.

“When civic staff conduct raids, they face resistance. Once the data of various departments are integrated and renewal of several key documents are stalled, the owners of these vehicles will be bound to toe the line and pay the fees,” an official explained.

The KMC expects the initiative to lead to a substantial increase in revenue. At present, the department earns arou-nd Rs 5 crore a year from night parking.

Title: TVS cuts February output by 10% on Covid impact
Content:
(File photo)

CHENNAI: Country’s third largest two and three wheeler maker, TVS Motor on Monday said that its vehicle production for February would be 10% lower due to Corona virus outbreak in China.There is a supply chain disruption caused due to the outbreak of Corona virus as parts suppliers in China are either shut or have fewer workmen reporting for work.At TVS Motor Company, the outbreak of pandemic Coronavirus (COVID-19) has led to impact on supply of certain components for production of BS-VI vehicles.China is a key part of the global automobile supply chain.While TVS Motor’s direct dependency on China is limited for components, some Tier II suppliers have been impacted adversely which will lead to 10% drop in the planned production in February 2020. All efforts are on to normalise this at the earliest, a company statement said.KN Radhakrishnan, director & CEO, TVS Motor Company, said, “At TVS Motor Company, we have completely transitioned to BS-VI in the month of January 2020. To minimise the impact on production of BS-VI vehicles, we are consistently monitoring developments with those of our suppliers who are sourcing certain components from China. Parallelly, we are also exploring suppliers in other regions and are looking to localise within India,” he said.

Title: ‘Agriculture and allied sectors major source of employment in Bihar’
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Sushil Kumar Modi releases the Bihar Economic Survey 2019-20 in Patna on Monday

PATNA: The state witnessed growth in the agriculture and allied activities, as well as expansion of roads, transport and power sector, that opened new avenues for self-employment and income generating activities for both male and female workers.

The Economic Survey report 2019-20 tabled in the state assembly on Monday has noted that the state’s male workforce found employment mostly in agriculture, forestry and fishing (44.6%), construction (17.1%), wholesale and retail trade, repair of vehicles (12.3%) and manufacturing (9.3%) sectors.

On the other hand, the female workers largely concentrated on two areas for employment and engagement — agriculture, forestry and fishing (53.6%) and education (25.7%).

The report has also pointed out that Rural Self-Employment Training Institute (RSETI) produced skilled workers by training slightly over 1.38 lakh candidates. Of them, 45% were males, 54% females and around 1% transgender. It has also noted that of the total trained persons, 74% were able to get gainful employment in various economic activities.

The wholesale and retail business across the state has been facilitated by the laying of a network of roads and burgeoning expansion of the transport sector, which registered growth of 11% from 2011-12 up to 2018-19.

The physical infrastructure of roads expanded with a massive investment that tripled from Rs5,988 crore in 2012-13 to Rs18,677 crore in 2019-20. Bihar had the credit of becoming the sixth highest state in building additional road length of 1.30 lakh km during 2008-17, and the total paved road in rural areas increased from 35% in 2015 to 75% in 2019.

As a result of this, as many as 11.89 lakh vehicles were registered in the state during 2018-19, in comparison with only 5.53 lakh in 2013-14. The increased registration of vehicles also yielded increased revenue — from Rs835 crore in 2013-14 to Rs2,067 crore in 2018-19, an annual growth rate of 20%.

Similarly, the contribution of the air transport sector to the gross state domestic product (GSDP) increased from Rs31 crore in 2011-12 to Rs252 crore in 2018-19, when as many as 40.61 lakh passengers availed themselves of air travel during 2018-19.

Title: East Central Railway: Frequency of many trains reduced till March 31
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

An East Central Railway train

PATNA: The East Central Railway (ECR) has further extended the period of cancellation of several mail and express trains, which originate from different stations under its jurisdiction, till March 31. They had, earlier, been cancelled till February 29 because they were running late due to foggy weather conditions in the North Central Railway (NCR) region located on the Tundla-Kanpur-Allahabad-Pt Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Junction-Patna Junction-Jhajha route.

According to ECR’s chief public relations officer (CPRO) Rajesh Kumar, the Patna-Howrah Jan Shatabdi Express (12023/12024) is cancelled every Thursday from both Patna Junction and Howrah while the Patna Junction-Ranchi Jan Shatabdi Express (12365/12366) will not run on Fridays from both ends till March 31.

“The Rajendra Nagar Terminal-New Delhi Sampoorna Kranti Express (12393/12394) will also not run on Wednesdays from Rajendra Nagar and on its return journey, it will not run on Thursdays,” the CPRO said, adding the Gaya-New Delhi Mahabodhi Express (12397/12398) will not run on Mondays from Gaya and on Tuesdays from New Delhi.

Similarly, the Jayanagar-New Delhi Swatantrata Senani Express (12561/12562) is cancelled every Thursday from Jayanagar and every Friday from New Delhi. The Patna-Kota Express (13239/13240) has been cancelled every Friday from Patna and every Saturday from Kota while the Barauni-Lucknow Express (15203/15204) will not run on Tuesdays from Barauni and on Wednesdays from Lucknow.

“While the Darbhanga-Amritsar Jannayak Express (15211/15212) is cancelled every Wednesday from Darbhanga and every Friday from Amritsar, the Dhanbad-Ferozpur Gangasutlej Express (13307/13308) will not run on Thursdays from Dhanbad and on Saturdays from Ferozpur Cantt,” Kumar said and added the Raxaul-Anand Vihar Satyagraha Express (15273/15274) would remain cancelled every Thursday from Raxaul and every Friday from Anand Vihar.

Besides, the Muzaffarpur-Anand Vihar Sapt Kranti Express (12557/12558) has been cancelled every Wednesday from Muzaffarpur and every Thursday from Anand Vihar while the Danapur-Anand Vihar Jan Sadharan Express (13257/13258) is cancelled every Thursday from Danapur and every Friday from Anand Vihar.

The railways has also cancelled the Varanasi-Singrauli passenger (13345/13346) and Chopan-Shaktinagar passenger (23345/23346) while the route of Patna-Kota Express (13237/13238) has been diverted to Kanpur-Farrukhabad-Kasganj-Mathura-Achhnera-Bharatpur till March 31.

Title: ‘Plant saplings for bar registration in Bhagalpur’
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

BHAGALPUR: Providing fillip to the movement for conserving nature and restoring underground water resources, the District Bar Association (DBA) of Bhagalpur has issued directive to fresh law graduates to plant at least two saplings in order to get registered with the DBA for starting legal practice in the courts.

The saplings can be planted on public parks, on roadside, farms or even private properties with the tag mentioning his or her name.

Christened as ‘Green & Clean Bhagalpur’, the DBA initiative is perhaps the first among the legal fraternities in the country to encourage the budding lawyers towards tree plantation and conservation of nature besides motivating people to check spreading trash at public places.

Apart from planting saplings, the law graduates would also have to protect them for one year so that it grows into trees. The DBA committee would also do spot verification of the saplings and make inventory before providing certificate of registration besides checking the growth of the saplings for at least one year and beyond as well.

Inspired by the state government’s Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali Abhiyan, the DBA initiative is being talked about in Bhagalpur. Along with the planting of saplings, the DBA has also taken initiative to protect and preserve the old trees on the court campuses as well as on the roadsides.

Bhagalpur DBA general secretary Sanjay Kumar Modi said development comes with a cost. Trees are cut for the construction of roads, buildings and other developmental activities and it is everyone’s duty to make efforts to conserve nature through intensive tree plantations besides checking the use of plastic, he said.

“We are also introducing rainwater harvesting system at DBA premises and other court premises in order to conserve groundwater resources,” he said and added: “We are also writing to the bar associations across the country to take initiative for tree plantation on the lines of Bhagalpur DBA and also to introduce rainwater harvesting system inside the court premises”.

Title: Two die in Nalanda road accidents
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

BIHARSHARIF: At least two persons, including the son of a mukhiya, were killed and another sustained critical injuries in two separate road accidents in Nalanda district on Monday.

According to police sources, a speeding vehicle hit a cycle near Mora Talab under Bhagan police outpost (OP), killing one Akhilesh Kumar on the spot and injuring Rajesh Ravidas, who was admitted to Biharsharif Sadar hospital.

A police officer said the duo belonged to BN Pahadi under the same police outpost area. They were daily wage earners and on way to Sohsarai on a bicycle in search of work.

In another accident, one Abhishek Bharti of village Nuawan under Asthawan police station died after sustaining injuries when a truck hit his bike near Noorsarai under the same police station area. Noorsarai police station SHO said Bharti was on way to Patna . He said the deceased was the only son of Nuawan panchayat mukhiya Manoj Kumar. He said the truck was seized but its driver escaped.

Title: Kolkata: ‘Touts’ fleece motorists parking in Wood St area
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Cars double-parked on Wood Street

KOLKATA: On the Wood Street-Short Street stretch in south central Kolkata, close to Park Street, new parking rates have been set by attendants, whom cops have termed “parking touts”. Instead of the sanctioned rates of Rs 10/hour, car owners have to pay Rs 20 if the vehicle is double-parked and Rs 30 if the car is in an illegal slot — termed “police parking”.

Kolkata traffic police’s Facebook page has received many complaints in this regard. “This incident took place on Wood Street-Short Street crossing around 7pm. I had parked my car near Lifeline Nursing Home behind Vardan Market. While leaving, a person in civil dress came to me and asked for parking fees. I asked him how much and he said it had been more than an hour so I should pay Rs 30. Before giving him the money, I asked for the parking slip and he said there was none. When I asked how that was possible, another attendant told me that it was a police-parking slot. He harassed me into paying the amount without any receipt. When I asked him to show his parking ID card, he refused. I was in a hurry so I told him to take down my number and report it and left without paying anything. I hope, like always, Kolkata Police shall look into this matter,” wrote Gaurav Dugar.

Following up on this complaint, TOI visited the spot on Monday and found the rates were indeed higher. TOI also found cars parked in double lines. A parking attendant, who introduced himself as Mihir Purkait, said what they were doing was legal. “This is a fixed rate here. You find out which are the KMC slots and pay Rs 10. Do you think that with so many cars parked here, anyone will find a KMC slot?” he asked.

When contacted, officers of the south traffic guard said double parking was not allowed anywhere in the area.

“This must be a one-off incident that you are referring to. As for allegations of police parking, let us assure you there is no such thing. Since you have brought the incident to our notice, we will definitely increase patrolling. If indeed there are touts using our name, we will not spare any one of them,” said an officer.

Title: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot asks Centre to increase its share for water projects to 90%
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Ashok Gehlot

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot has requested the union water resources minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat to increase the Centre’s share from 50% to 90% in the Jal Shakti Mission project , considering Rajasthan ’s difficult climatic and topographical conditions.

In a letter to the union minister, the chief minister said, “Rajasthan has been included in the category of states like Bihar, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Gujarat and Chhattisgarh where the Centre and states share 50:50 ratio for the project but the climatic condition of Rajasthan varies widely from these states. Rajasthan is the largest state and availability of water here is the lowest.”

Gehlot pointed out that about 85% of the state is now in the dark zone where underground water has gone down drastically.

The CM wrote that in desert areas, the villages are scattered and located in far flung areas due to which the drinking water projects are highly expensive compared to other states. Since the Union minister hails from the state, he is aware of the issue of water crisis and the ground situation in the state, he mentioned.

Gehlot said in 2013 under the national rural drinking water programme, the Centre was initially bearing 90% of the cost for the desert state but this was later reduced on a 60:40 ratio and now to 50:50.

The CM said in the 13 districts in eastern part of the state where water crisis is the worst, providing five litres of water per person is an impossible task without a river linking project. But that involves huge investment. He asked the Centre to assist the state liberally to execute such a project.

Title: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot asks Centre to increase its share for water projects to 90%
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Ashok Gehlot

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot has requested the union water resources minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat to increase the Centre’s share from 50% to 90% in the Jal Shakti Mission project , considering Rajasthan ’s difficult climatic and topographical conditions.

In a letter to the union minister, the chief minister said, “Rajasthan has been included in the category of states like Bihar, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Gujarat and Chhattisgarh where the Centre and states share 50:50 ratio for the project but the climatic condition of Rajasthan varies widely from these states. Rajasthan is the largest state and availability of water here is the lowest.”

Gehlot pointed out that about 85% of the state is now in the dark zone where underground water has gone down drastically.

The CM wrote that in desert areas, the villages are scattered and located in far flung areas due to which the drinking water projects are highly expensive compared to other states. Since the Union minister hails from the state, he is aware of the issue of water crisis and the ground situation in the state, he mentioned.

Gehlot said in 2013 under the national rural drinking water programme, the Centre was initially bearing 90% of the cost for the desert state but this was later reduced on a 60:40 ratio and now to 50:50.

The CM said in the 13 districts in eastern part of the state where water crisis is the worst, providing five litres of water per person is an impossible task without a river linking project. But that involves huge investment. He asked the Centre to assist the state liberally to execute such a project.

Title: Patna civic body’s tentative budget gets ESC nod
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Sita Sahu

PATNA: The empowered standing committee (ESC) of Patna Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Monday approved the tentative annual budget of Rs3,800 crore for 2020-21 fiscal. The final budget will be tabled at the 40th PMC’s board meeting by March-end.

Patna mayor Sita Sahu, who chaired the ESC meeting, said the annual budget amount is likely to exceed up to Rs4,000 crore with minor changes to be made by the standing committee members. “The revised budget would likely to be tabled in the standing committee meeting with some additional proposals within the next 15 days,” she said.

PMC commissioner Himanshu Sharma, while addressing the mediapersons, said the proposed budget has been planned to expedite the development process with focus on earning revenue through establishing malls, cafeterias, parking slots and hotels.

“We have continued some projects in this budget as well like construction of malls or supermarkets, vending zones and vending shelters for hawkers, Nali-Gali yojana, construction of affordable housing for economically weaker sections and providing basic amenities at Ganga riverfront, among others,” Sharma said.

Altogether 11 proposals were passed in the meeting, including construction of drains in areas with no drainage system and schemes under ‘Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali’ mission.

Sahu said drains are to be constructed in areas which had suffered severe waterlogging last year. “The ward councillors and engineers would identify the locations where drains are to be constructed. These areas include Rajendra Nagar, Kankarbagh and Kadamkuan,” she said.

“Besides, the PMC would also find out the reasons behind the poor functioning of ‘online building plan approval system’ (OBPAS). Only 13 maps were passed through this portal since September last year even though the PMC received 81 maps for approval,” Sahu said.

“To make OBPAS more user-friendly and transparent, the urban local body would empanel a private agency for fast and efficient execution of work,” she said.

The PMC is to remove six parking spaces from ward number 2 as it causes inconvenience to commuters.

Title: ‘Construction of enclosures at safari reaches final stage’
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: The construction of enclosures for wild animals at the upcoming wildlife safari in Rajgir was in its final stage, said forest department principal secretary Dipak Kumar Singh on Monday.

“The construction of administrative blocks, restaurants, ticket counters, waiting area and other facilities are underway,” Singh added.

The project, which entails a total expenditure of Rs 60 crore, will have facilities like butterfly area, walking trails, trekking, observation towers and accommodation for the convenience of the visitors.

Nalanda district magistrate (DM) Yogendra Singh told this newspaper that the safari was targeted to be completed by August and would be thrown open for the visitors after that. “Roads in between the inner and outer peripheral boundaries are almost ready. Vehicles of several departments, including animal husbandry, fire and water among others, will use the them to move along the jungle safari,” he said.

The DM added, “Rajgir and Nalanda already witness major footfall of tourists, both Indian and foreigners. With the jungle safari, we are expecting an even higher footfall.”

Nearly 110km from Patna , Rajgir is situated outside the reserve forest area and is in the foothills of the Jethian Hills. Adjacent to it is the Rajgir forest reserve where the jungle safari is being developed. “The jungle safari is totally different from zoos, including Sanjay Gandhi Biological Park, where animals are kept in cages with limited space. Over here, huge spaces have been allotted to the enclosures and wild animals can roam around freely in their natural habitat,” forest department principal secretary Dipak Kumar Singh said.

He added, “The safari, which is spread over an area of 480 acres of land, has altogether five enclosures for animals, including lions, tigers, bears and leopards. Besides, there will be several well as herbivores in an 80-acre enclosure.”

Singh also said visitors would be allowed to watch wild animals in special vehicles. “Keeping in mind the safety of visitors, around 30 special vehicles will be procured for them,” he said.

Title: Gaya airport gears up to operate in two shifts
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

GAYA: With the expected arrival of about 100 CISF personnel to strengthen the existing manpower, the Airports Authority of India (AAI) now gears up to operate at Gaya airport in two shifts. As of now, about 160 CISF personnel provide security to the airport. The present strength is inadequate for two-shift operations.

According to AAI sources, Ministry of Home Affairs has cleared the deployment of additional forces and if everything goes as per plan, they are likely to be deputed there before March-end. Refusing to share details, Gaya airport director Dilip Kumar said the airport would be soon in a position to handle air traffic in two shifts. As of now, the airport operates in a single 8-hour shift from 8am every day.

The AAI also needs another 25 officials, including those skilled in air traffic control, communication navigation and fire fighting etc for two-shift operations. Regular personnel for these positions are required, an AAI official said. The airport director said getting more skilled manpower would not be a problem.

Earlier in November, 2019, a SpiceJet team conducted survey to start operations on the Gaya-Delhi route. However, the airlines, according to sources, has not as yet formally applied for a time slot. Two-shift operations may give impetus to private operators to introduce more flights via Gaya.

As of now, there is only one direct flight on the Gaya-Delhi route. It may be recalled that earlier IndiGo sought an afternoon slot for its proposed Gaya-Delhi flight. But on account of congestion in the afternoon slot, the airlines was advised to seek a time slot between 9-12 in the forenoon, which it did not find suitable.

During its November survey, SpiceJet is also learnt to have studied the viability of introducing a flight for Dubai/Jeddah. Though, sizeable number of workers from Bihar and Jharkhand work in the Middle East, there is no direct air link for these countries from anywhere in the two states.

Gaya is the only international airport in Bihar and Jharkhand and does have the immigration and customs facility to handle international passengers.

Title: Patna: Toddler dies in fire, two struggle for life
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: An 18-month-old baby lost his life and two others were badly burned after fire broke out in a room they were in under Jakkanpur police station in the city on Monday. The injured were battling for life in a private hospital with 90% burn injuries.

The incident took place in a room at Bengali Colony on road number 1 of Indira Nagar. The deceased toddler was identified as Abhinav Kumar, the only child of Phalguni Pandey. the other two injured were 19-year-old Sonali and 20-year-old Sujeet alias Golu.

Jakkanpur police station SHO Mukesh Verma said an FSL team was called to find out the cause behind fire. “But one thing is clear that it did not occur because of LPG cylinder blast as the cylinder in the adjacent kitchen was intact. However, the room was badly burned and there was smell of kerosene inside,” he said.

He further said Sonali had brought Abhinav to meet her friend Sujeet. “Sujeet’s parents had gone to attend a wedding and no one was present in the house when the incident took place,” said Verma.

Title: Gujarat: New Civil Hospital superintendent justifies gynaec, pregnancy tests
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Congress stages sit-in demanding early release of inquiry report

SURAT: Even as inquiry by a three-member woman committee is probing the alleged stripping of probationary women clerks, the state-government run New Civil Hospital (NCH) waded itself into the row with its superintendent addressing media persons on the issue on Tuesday.

The incident had happened in SMIMER which is run by the Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC), but NCH superintendent Preeti Kapadia addressed media persons in her office and justified undressing of women for fitness and medical test.

Even as she denied having approval from her department to address media when the inquiry committee is already doing its work, Kapadia claimed she had been asked by municipal commissioner Banchhanidhi Pani and explain how the tests are done. Pani, however, categorically denied having asked anyone to hold a press conference.

It is learnt that theprobe committee had sought response from SMIMER regarding rules of fitness test for women.

When contacted, Kanani told TOI: “Why is she holding press conference in NCH on this issue? It is a matter related to SMC and SMIMER. She has not been authorised to speak on this issue by the health department. She cannot do this even if it was done in the capacity of NCH superintendent Kanani said he will inquire and take action if necessary. “I have been asked by the municipal commissioner to call media and explain them that how these fitness tests are conducted. He was to remain present but due to some reason he could not come,” Kapadia said to a question. However, Pani said, “I have not asked anyone to hold a press conference. NCH officials could have requested SMIMER superintendent. I have no role to play in this. I am also not aware that SMC's PRO department made calls to media persons to attend the press conference.”

Title: Textile processors mulling hike in job charges
Content:
The prices of colour dyes have gone up by 7% in the last few days due to coronavirus epidemic

SURAT: Prices of famous Surti saris and dress material may go up with owners of textile dyeing and printing mills mulling increase in job charges due to 7% hike in rates of colour dyes in local market.Industry sources said chemicals and dye manufacturers in south Gujarat have been importing raw material from China in bulk quantities. Manufacturing of colour dye raw material has been affected after outbreak of coronavirus in China.South Gujarat Textile Processors’ Association (SGTPA) president Jitu Vakhariya told TOI, “Colour dyes are an important content in dyeing and printing of finished fabrics. The prices of colour dyes have gone up by 7% in the last few days due to coronavirus epidemic. This has increased production cost of textile processors in the city. We have called an urgent meeting of textile processors in the next few days to decide on hike in job charges. We may increase job charges by 5-7%.”There are about 350 textile dyeing and printing mills in Sachin , Palsana, Pandesara and Kadodara. About three crore metres of fabrics are processed in dyeing and printing mills per day.Pandesara Textile Processors’ Association (PTPA) president Kamal Vijay Tulsiyan said, “Hike in job charges is imminent as prices of colour dyes is likely to increase further due to coronavirus epidemic in China.”Meanwhile, textile traders are unhappy with price hike to be announced by textile processors.Champalall Bothra, secretary of Federation of Surat Textile Traders’ Association (FOSTTA), said, “The business in domestic market has picked up pace due to marriage season and upcoming Holi festival. In this situation, traders will not be able to adjust to increase in job charges by processors.”Krishna Banka, a textile trader from JJ textile market, said, “The prices of finished fabrics will increase by Rs2 per metre, which will reflect in finished items, including saris and dress material. The job charge hike by textile processors will affect trade.”

Title: DGVCL targets 25MW rooftop solar power generation by March
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: The Dakshin Gujarat Vij Company Limited (DGVCL) has set the target of generating 25 mega watt (MW) of rooftop solar power in south Gujarat region by March 2020.

Official sources said that about 16,700 applications have been received from consumers, mainly from the residential areas, under the solar rooftop scheme of the state government since September 2016. About 9,700 have already submitted the application with their initial payments for setting up of the rooftop solar plants at their facilities.

At present, there are about 1,400 rooftop solar installed in Bharuch, Surat, Valsad and Navsari districts falling under the jurisdiction of the DGVCL. The per day solar energy generation is pegged at 5MW.

On July 2, 2019, the state government in its budget announced to launch a new scheme for solar rooftop. This scheme will directly benefit more than 2 lakh families, who will adopt solar in the financial year 2019-20.

T P Chaudhary, additional chief engineer of DGVCL said, “About 8,600 solar rooftops have been installed in the region and we are expecting the solar power generation of about 25MW per day starting from March 2020.”

According to Chaudhary, majority of the rooftop solar applications have been received from the residential consumers from the areas including Rander, Jehangirpura, Saroli, Ramnagar, Puna areas in Surat, Bharuch district , Navsari and Valsad.

Chaudhary added, “The beneficiaries are given subsidy of 40% under the State Government’s scheme for solar rooftop for up to 3 kilowatts system and subsidy of 20% for a system of 3KW to 10 KW”

Ends

Title: Man murders wife suspecting her of having an affair
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: Suspecting his wife of having an extra-marital affair, a man allegedly strangled her inside a ginning mill on Rajpar Road in Morbi on Monday.

Police said the accused was identified as Dhularam Parmar, who strangulated his wife Manisha.

“Our preliminary investigation revealed that Parmar suspected Manisha of having an extra-marital affair, following which the couple would fight frequently. The couple had come to Morbi to work as labourers from Rajasthan ,” said an official from Morbi A division police station.

Meanwhile, the police have launched a manhunt for Parmar, who has gone absconding after committing the crime.

Title: Chopper to cost state Rs 1.7cr/month
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The government has sanctioned funds for wet-leasing a helicopter for multiple purposes including troop deployment and aerial survey in deep forests, rescue and reconnaissance missions and VIP movements .

The home department issued an order sanctioning Rs 1,70,63,000, for the chopper, which is being leased at the rate of Rs 1.44 crore per month, and an additional 18% GST.

The twin-engine AS 365 Dauphin N3 helicopter that has a seating capacity of 10 persons is being leased from Pawan Hans Ltd, a public sector undertaking, and includes 20 hours of flying every month. However, every additional hour of flying beyond 20 hours per month would incur Rs 67,926 in addition to the fixed cost. The government had considered proposals from Pwan Hans and private operator Chipsan Aviation Private Ltd before choosing Pawan Hans.

The financial as well as technical parameters of the proposals received by the government were analyzed and the committee constituted for the purpose had observed that Pawan Hans, being a public sector undertaking, is more efficient and effective in dealing with emergency situations. The committee, headed by the chief secretary, also includes finance and transport secretaries, secretary in charge of aviation and representatives of Indian Air Force. The decision was taken after a series of meetings of the committee.

The police had given its requirements that it should be a twin engine helicopter, the load factor, the equipment carrying facilities and the altitude up to which it can fly, etc, aimed at mid-air operations like air dropping troops.

Title: SMC’s three urban health centres get NQAS certificates
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Surat: Three urban health centres (UHCs) of Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) have received National Quality Assurance Standards (NQAS) certificates for their public health services.

The quality certification programme for the public health facilities has been launched with the aim of recognizing the good performing facilities as well as improving the credibility of public hospitals in the community.

The SMC’s urban health centres at Adajan, New Dindoli and Umara have been given NQAS certificates.

The certification is provided for being able to meet the standards set by the NQAS.

The quality urban health focuses on assessment, improvement and certification of urban health facilities and urban outreach under National Quality Framework.

“The NQAS are currently available for district hospitals, CHCs, PHCs and urban PHCs. Standards are primarily meant for providers to assess their own quality for improvement through predefined standards and to bring up their facilities for the certification. The National Quality Assurance Standards include service provision, patient’s rights, inputs, support services, clinical care, infection control, quality management and outcome,’’ said an SMC official.

“During the next round of inspection of the NQAS, the SMC’s Lakhpati and Palanpore health Centres will be covered under this programme. We aim to cover all our urban health centres to get accredited with this certifications,’’ added the official.

Title: UP: 10 SHOs shifted, 3 sent to lines for poor performance
Content:
Representative image

LUCKNOW: Effecting his first major reshuffle a month after assuming office, Lucknow police commissioner on Monday shifted 10 station house officers (SHOs) from various police stations.SHOs of Hazratganj, Vibhuti Khand, Alambagh, Sarojininagar, Gosainganj, Krishnanagar, and Alambagh were shifted, while Gomtinagar Vistar, a newly constructed police station, got its first SHO.Also, three SHOs were sent to lines for poor performance. These included SHO Chinhat, Gomtinagar, and Jankipuram.SHO Gomtinagar Amit Dubey was in news for not being able to check the spurt in SUV lifting cases in his area, while SHO Chinhat Sachin Singh had invited criticism for delay in the registration of FIR in connection with a gang rape case. Besides, last week, a 61-year-old private security guard was looted of his licensed rifle in Chinhat.Senior officers said that SHO Jankipuram Mohammed Ashraf was sent to lines for delay in reacting to a case of a minor allegedly kidnapped by neighbours.On the other hand, inspector of Hazratganj was made SHO Gosainganj. He has been replaced by crime branch inspector Santosh Singh. SHO Gosainganj DK Upadhyay has been made SHO Krishnanagar and SHO Sarojininagar is the new SHO of Gomtinagar. Similarly, SHO of Alambagh Anand Shahi has been shifted to Sarojininagar.

Title: Minor raped for three months, thrown off roof by friend’s cousin
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Bareilly: “Raped” repeatedly for nearly three months on the pretext of marriage by a minor boy of her locality, the 15-year-old was allegedly thrown off the roof of her house when she protested "advances" by her boyfriend’s cousin in Bareilly on Sunday night.

Bareilly Cantonment police station SHO Dharmendra Singh told TOI that the accused, both 17-year-old, were booked under IPC sections 376 (rape), 338 (causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety) and 323 (causing grievous hurt) and under relevant sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act, following a complaint lodged by the girl’s father; further investigation is on.

The accused are on the run, while the girl is recovering at the district hospital, said the SHO.

“The sexual relationship with a minor girl is considered rape. The main accused has been sexually assaulting the girl for the past three months. Even his cousin tried to take advantage. After the girl resisted, he threw her off the roof. Fortunately, the girl didn’t receive serious injuries. The girl’s medical examination was completed on Monday. In her statement recorded to police, the girl said that as her friend had promised to marry her, she did not reveal her sexual relationship with her parents. We will nab the accused soon,” said the SHO.

According to police, on Sunday evening, when the girl’s parents had gone to attend a wedding in the city, finding her alone, her boyfriend visited her at her home while his cousin was waiting for him outside.

“Later, the cousin also entered the house and made advances. When the girl protested and threatened to raise an alarm, the cousin forcibly took her to the roof of the house and threw her off. Afterwards, both the accused fled the spot,” said police.

Title: 5 centres of excellence planned
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Times News Network

Jaipur: In a major thrust to technical education, the state technical education department has announced to establish five centres of excellence in its five engineering colleges.

The engineering college in Bikaner will become a centre of excellence on energy sector, while the college in Barmer will become a centre for ceramic science. The engineering college in Ajmer will become the hub for computer science. The aim is to increase enrolments by providing exclusive courses.

The idea was mooted by technical and higher education secretary Suchi Sharma.

“Developing centres of excellence in our colleges has multifold objectives. Its primary aim is to create expert learning centres on subjects which has huge job potential and scope for research. It is also targeted to channelise our limited resources at a particular place for optimum utilisation of resources. Finally, the department sees it as a stepping stone to revive the technical education in the state,” said Sharma.

The state has chosen five colleges in the first phase while the remaining eight government engineering colleges will be taken up in the next phase. The government engineering sector in Bikaner has been chosen to create a hub for energy sector which focusses on clean and green energy.

“Experts are being roped in for designing the subjects making it job oriented. The idea is that students should get the job as soon as he/she completes the course,” said Sharma.

Experts have hailed the idea. “Upgrading or improving the existing institute is a well thought decision taken by the government instead of announcing a new institute. It will certainly attract quality students which has been missing from institutes in the state,” said Puneet Sharma, an educationist.

The state has been drastically loosing enrolments in its engineering colleges from the past few years. The situation has become so grim this year is that out of 50,000 seats, barely 12,000 students take admission in engineering colleges.

Title: Ganga Yodha Mahotsav: Kailash Kher to perform at Assi today
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Varanasi: Celebrating the efforts of a special unit of Indian Army, Ganga Task Force, in rejuvenating the Ganga, musician Kailash Kher will give a performance at ‘Ganga Yodha Mahotsav 2020’ to be held at Assi Ghat on Tuesday evening.

The concert is being organised under the ‘Clean Ganga Campaign’ run by the force, a unit of the Indian Territorial Army. In his video message, Kher made an appeal to the masses to extend support to the endeavour of Indian Territorial Army for making the river free from pollution. The event has been organised by the Indian Army.

As per the Indian Territorial Army, the event aims at creating awareness about the work being done by the armed forces towards effective abatement of pollution, conservation and rejuvenation of Ganga. The ‘Clean Ganga Campaign’ is an initiative by the Territorial Army’s 137 Central Ecological Task Force Battalion (TA) 39 GR. The Ganga Task Force was raised under the leadership of Commanding officer, Colonel Amith Pandey. Working in coordination with National Mission for Clean Ganga, the unit is also working in Kanpur and Varanasi after Prayagraj.

Budget for Ganga Yodha Mahotsav is supported by the ministry of water resources, river development and Ganga rejuvenation. The initiative took shape under the aegis of Additional Director General of Territorial Army, Major General Dev Arvind Chaturvedi, PVSM, AVSM, SM, along with officers Major Pradeep Shoury Arya, I R S, Shaurya Chakra and Capt Neil Shaji, VSM.

The battalion (ex-servicemen) was raised for NMCG in 2016. The Ganga Task Force has been trained for works like plantation of trees on the banks of river Ganga, strengthening of pollution monitoring mechanism on ground, management of public awareness and participation programmes, and monitoring of Ghats for the ongoing works.

Title: Telangana government mulls loan waiver in one go for small farmers
Content:
The state-level bankers’ committee has also been urged to give details of farmers and loan amounts

HYDERABAD: Small and marginal farmers of Telangana who have taken loans up to Rs 50,000 and less are likely to get the loan waiver in one go.The state government has started working out modalities to implement the loan waiver scheme, which is set to cost Rs 25,000 crore to Rs 30,000 crore, senior officials said. Sources said the government is planning to extend a one-time settlement to the farmers whose loans are less than Rs 50,000.Farmers who had obtained loans of over Rs 50,000 and those whose loans exceed Rs 1 lakh are likely to get waiver in three to four instalments. The government’s decision to waive off loans of small and marginal farmers in instalments had drawn a lot of criticism last term.The government allocated Rs 6,000 crore in the current fiscal for the crop loan waiver scheme but has not released any money for it yet.Officials of the agriculture department, in consultation with the finance department, have been working on the number of farmers who had taken less than Rs 50,000 loan. The state-level bankers’ committee has also been urged to give details of farmers and loan amounts, an official said.It is estimated that less than Rs 5,000 crore would be required to provide crop loan waiver to farmers whose loans did not exceed Rs 50,000 each. Though chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao will take a final call before the budget is presented in March, officials have proposed to categorise farmers under four categories of loans for implementation of TRS’s poll promise.The first category would be farmers with less than Rs 50,000 loan, second category will have farmers who obtained loans from Rs 50,000 to Rs Rs 75,000, third category will be between Rs 75,000 and up to Rs 1 lakh and the fourth category consists of farmers who had taken loans of over Rs 1 lakh.The maximum crop loan waiver would be up to Rs 1 lakh only, officials said.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Praja Vedika furniture to be auctioned
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

File photo illegal construction Praja Vedika being demolished

AMARAVATI: Nearly eight months after the demolition of Praja Vedika, the CRDA has decided to auction the furniture left at the spot. CRDA will accept applications from bidders to pick-up the furniture from Praja Vedika till March 3. Auction will be held on March 4.

The conference hall was constructed with nearly Rs 9 crore during the TDP regime. The Jaganmohan Reddy-led YSRC government razed it in June last year as it was an illegal structure. Although,a few social activists had approached the high court seeking a stay on the demolition, as it involved a large amount of public money, the high court had declined as the petitioner himself had stated that the structure was illegal.

The CRDA, which bulldozed the structure, has left many valuable utilities including air-conditioners, chairs and tables at the spot.

Following the decision to auction the Praja Vedika furniture, former minister and TDP senior leader Nakka Anand Babu said, “The government should have auctioned the remaing furniture immediately after the demolition. They would have got at least a few crores then. The CRDA might not get even 10% of what it would have got eight months ago,” said Anand Babu.

Title: Little sets apart Vijayawada canals and dumpyards
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

The plight of Eluru Canal on Monday

VIJAYAWADA: The end of the Kharif season has exposed the state of Vijayawada’s canals. Heaps of plastic and other garbage can be seen floating in the city’s canals and clogging its lock gates. Campaigns and special drives conducted by Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) have failed to stop people from using them as dumping grounds.

Vijayawada city is also known as the Venice of Andhra Pradesh as a large section of it lies among three irrigation canals, Eluru , Bandar and Ryves canals. These canals not only water the fields and boost groundwater level, but also adds to the city’s beauty. But given the apathy of the irrigation department, rather than adding to the beauty, the dirty canals are now marring the look of the city.

Speaking to TOI, former city mayor Jandhyala Shankar said VMC authorities should utilise the canal bunds as marketplaces. “Canal bunds are used for dumping construction debris and other garbage in the city. Fruit vendors and small business units are major culprits in polluting canals with plastic and solid wastes. During my term in office, we did a detailed study on canals and proposed to construct markets on both sides, so that people stop polluting the canal bunds. Encroachments on the canals can be accommodated on the markets constructed on the bunds. This will also enhance the beauty of the canals,” Shankar said.

Krishna district administration and VMC, which cleared around 1,200 tonnes garbage in canals as a part of ‘Nenu Saitham Krishnamma Suddhi Sevalo’, are now preparing to start a canal beautification drive. Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy directed officials to develop parks and green belts on canal bunds.

Speaking to TOI about the issue, district collector Mohammed Imtiaz said, “We have kept a special focus on protecting canals. We have already installed a fences on the bridges and barring people from dumping garbage in the canals. VMC authorities are preparing designs to restore canals and beautify the canal bunds.”

Title: Ram idol to be moved for first time in 28 years
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Taking shape, brick by brick

AYODHYA: For the first time in 28 years, the idol of Ram Lalla will be shifted from the makeshift structure in Ayodhya when construction of the temple at Ram Janmabhoomi commences. The idol will be moved to a bulletproof fibre structure which will have a transparent glass screen so that devotees can have 'uninterrupted darshan', Champat Rai, secretary of the Ram temple trust, said on Monday .

Rai said the idol has to be shifted as the construction of the temple will begin from the 'garbh grih' (sanctum sanctorum). "The idol will be kept towards Manas Bhawan building, 150 metres away from the sanctum sanctorum but within the temple premises. Once the construction of the 'garbh grih' is complete, the idol will be shifted back to the original place," he said.

The spot where the idol will be shifted has been identified by office bearers of the Ram temple trust following the advice of the engineers and architects involved in the construction of the temple.

The specially designed structure which will temporarily house the idol will be covered with fibre sheets from three sides and will have a canopy. "The front side of the structure will have a transparent bulletproof glass screen to allow devotees unrestricted darshan of Ram Lalla," Rai added. On the appointment of the priest for the Ram temple, Rai said the individual has to be "learned, educated and gentle".

Title: Mohammed Ali Shabbir dares K Chandrasekhar Rao, Mohammed Mahmood Ali to show documents
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Mohammed Mahmood Ali

HYDERABAD: Former minister Mohammed Ali Shabbir has slammed home minister Mohammed Mahmood Ali for stating that the Telangana government will implement National Population Register ( NPR ) in a new format.

Addressing a ‘Mushaira’ against Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ), NRC and NPR on Monday, Shabbir Ali strongly condemned home minister Mahmood Ali for announcing that NPR would be implemented in Telangana with six additional questions that require people to report the date and place of birth of their parents during the survey.

The Congress leader also slammed MIM leader Waris Pathan for his controversial '15 crore Vs 100 crore' remark, saying that the anti-CAA protest is a battle between communal BJP-MIM and rest of India to protect the Constitution and the nation.

Title: FB page for city’s ‘smart’ services
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Lucknow: A Facebook page detailing all 18 facilities to be offered under the Smart City Mission will be launched on March 15. The page is an initiative by Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC). The civic agency decided to start the page during a meeting chaired by district magistrate and attended by municipal commissioner Monday

Under SCM, LMC is currently providing 10 services like online tax assessment for properties, smart bus shelters, information about online parking, mechanised road sweeping and online registration of complaint of government departments.

March 15 onwards, eight more services would be added to the list. The new services would include smart dustbins, area-based development of Kaiserbagh, a smart parking centre and e-library.

Title: Dacoits poison watch dogs, loot Rs 7 lakh from Parsi couple’s Palghar bungalow
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: Five unidentified armed dacoits assaulted an elderly Parsi couple, poisoned their two watchdogs and hens, and fled with cash and jewellery worth nearly Rs 7 lakh from their bungalow in the Dahanu taluka of Palghar district in the early hours of Saturday. One of the dogs and two hens died.The dacoits damaged the closed circuit television (CCTV) at the bungalow before committing the crime.Rohinton Taraporewala (73) and his wife Homai (70) were asleep in their ground-plus-one-storey bungalow, Tarapore Villa, in the Bawda village of Vangaon . Around 1.30am, the couple was woken up by some sounds from the rear side of the bungalow. Before they could react, they were surrounded by the dacoits who had gained entry by breaking open the rear door of the bungalow. One held a revolver at Homai while the others, armed with sickles , knives and iron rods , assaulted Rohinton on his right eyebrow and back.The dacoits demanded the keys of the cupboard in the bedroom. Rohinton, a retired chikoo farmer, and Homai pleaded with the dacoits to spare them and handed over the keys. The dacoits ransacked the cupboards in the bedroom and near the dining table and fled with cash and jewellery worth Rs 6.6 lakh. They also stole the digital video recorder (DVR) of the CCTV and the cable box.It was only after the dacoits fled that the couple came out of their bungalow to find the canines had been poisoned. While one of them was already dead, the other survived as it vomited. Two hens were found dead too.Rohinton said, “While we are lucky to have been spared by the dacoits, my licensed revolver, which I had surrendered to the police ahead of the zilla parishad elections, would have helped scare away the dacoits.” It was returned to him after the dacoity.The couple that lives alone had installed the CCTV a few years ago. The two strays that the couple had adopted would be let loose in the bungalow premises at night.The couple’s son, a doctor, lives in the UK and their married daughter in the US.Police suspect the dacoits may have kept a watch on the bungalow. They knew about the watchdogs and hence silenced them before breaking in. Residents of other bungalows, located at a distance, did not hear any sounds. Police are questioning painters who were carrying out work in the bungalow.Vangaon police registered a case under Indian Penal Code sections 394, 395 and 397 for dacoity and 429 and 427 for maiming cattle. Police said they will examine CCTVs in the locality for leads.

Title: ‘Gall Bladder and liver cancer new challenge in Gangetic belt’
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Varanasi: Despite registration of over 20,000 cancer patients in past two years after Tata Memorial Centre run- Mahamana Pt Madan Mohan Malviya Cancer Centre and Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital became operational in Varanasi, many patients still run to Mumbai hospitals. In an alarming revelation, TMC’s population-based cancer registry programme shows gall bladder and liver cancer emerging as unique problem in the Gangetic belt of Varanasi.

Talking to TOI, deputy director, Centre for Cancer Epidemiology at Tata Memorial Centre, Mumbai, Pankaj Chaturvedi said, “On an average 20,000 cancer patients from Varanasi and adjacent regions reach TMH Mumbai. Despite registration of over 20,000 patients after HBCH and MPMMMCC became operational, the number of patients coming to TMH Mumbai has not reduced. We are expecting a decrease in cancer patients from east UP region in coming two-three years once MPMMMCC becomes fully functional.”

Chaturvedi signed an MoU with Varanasi Municipal Corporation for cancer prevention awareness campaign. TMC, in collaboration with Banaras Hindu University and state government, had conducted a population-based cancer registration study in Varanasi in 2017. Covering over 40 million population, including 57% of rural belt, the study revealed that incidence of mouth cancer among males is 19 per one lakh population and goes upo to 24 if mouth, tongue and lip cancer are combined. One in every 35 men is at oral cancer risk.

The emerging cases of gall bladder and liver cancer in Varanasi are unnerving, said Chaturvedi adding, that one in 179 women is at risk. In other parts of India, the incidence of gall bladder and liver cancer is less than one percent while in Gangetic belt it is above 15%, he said.

One in 71 women is at risk of breast cancer while one in 90 is at risk of cervix uteri cancer, said Chaturvedi adding that 1,066 male and 850 female cancer cases were registered in Varanasi in 2017. He said 721 cancer deaths, including of 305 women had been registered in past two years.

Title: Petroleum university to run from MBM College in Jodhpur
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

The Barmer oil refinery is being set up in the region close to the MBM Engineering College in Jodhpur

JAIPUR: The MBM Engineering College in Jodhpur is set to run as a petroleum and earth sciences university from the coming session aimed at tapping the growing demand for engineers in the sectors related to crude oil. The Gehlot-government’s pet project, the Barmer oil refinery, is in the same region and has given high hopes about employment to the local youth.

The technical education department is working on MoUs with public and private petroleum companies for designing the course and seeking their help in installing tools and equipment related to the subject. The Barmer oil refinery is being set up in the region close to this college has been the motivation for the university. This will be state’s second subject specific university after Rajasthan Sports University in Jhunjhunu.

Officials said the MBM College has a very huge campus which is sufficient for the setting up of a state varsity. “The department is seeking necessary approvals from the concerned authorities and the formal process of upgrading will start in the next 15 days,” said Suchi Sharma, secretary, higher and technical education, Rajasthan.

Officials say that admission in the university from the coming session seems possible as the required infrastructure is available. Sharma cleared that change of status will see addition of new courses related to petroleum while the existing courses will continue to run as usual.

Experts says that discovery of oil in Barmer has already evoked lot of interest among the grads in the sector. “It is the right time for the state to take a plunge in the branch of engineering which has job prospects in Rajasthan and across the globe. But, the success of the university will depend on the uninterrupted financial support from the government, autonomy and industry tie-up for its progress,” said Puneet Sharma, a technical education expert.

Title: Y S Vivekananda Reddy murder: HC reserves order
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: The high court on Monday reserved orders in the petitions seeking Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) probe into Y S Vivekananda Reddy’s murder. While petitioners argued that the special investigation tseam (SIT) constituted by the state government failed to make headway in the case and in identifying the perpetrators, the state government argued that the SIT investigation is at an advanced stage of completion and CBI probe is not necessary.

Vivekananda Reddy’s wife Sowbhagyamma and daughter Sunitha raised doubts in their petitions over family members, including chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy. The counsel for Sunitha argued that the memo filed by Jaganmohan Reddy to close his petition cannot be accepted as it is not in the form of an affidavit.

He also said that in his earlier affidavit, Jaganmohan Reddy had raised doubts over the state police and the same police are now investigating the case. “Although the ruling party has changed, the government is a continuous process and the doubts expressed by Jaganmohan Reddy still stands valid even now” he said.

Continuing to argue for a CBI probe, the counsel said, when five people moved the court over the same issue and raised the same contentions, even if one petition is withdrawn, the contents of the affidavit stand valid in the court. “The chief minister announced that he will hand over a rape and murder case of a girl to CBI after the parents gave him representation, why he is reluctant to do the same when his sister is asking for the same in case of her father’s murder case” he said.

Arguing on behalf of Jaganmohan Reddy, senior counsel Vivek said the earlier petition was moved as the then chief minister had made public statements about the investigation of the case, giving directions to the police. The circumstances have changed and as the investigation is going on in an impartial manner, there is no need for a CBI inquiry.

On the other hand, advocate general S Sriram submitted the case diary and general diary to the high court. Upon hearing the arguments of all the parties, the high court reserved orders.

Title: Spl teams to crack down on tax evasion by traders
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Amaravati: The state government has launched a special drive to detect tax evasions by traders following allegations of malpractices.

Sources said chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy has directed the officials not to spare fraudulent traders. The CM asked the commercial taxes department to constitute special teams to unearth malpractices after massive tax evasion by a trader in Visakhapatnam was found out. The officials have slapped a criminal case against the iron merchant for duping the government with bogus returns to claim input credit.

The state has reported decent growth in GST revenues during the current fiscal. The GST revenue in January reported nearly 9% growth over the corresponding period in the last fiscal.

While the state mopped up Rs.2159 crore during January, 2019, it fetched Rs.2,356 crore during the last month. Although many states reported a growth rate of 11 to 16% in GST collections, AP’s 9% growth rate is considered to be decent keeping in view of the slowdown in economic activity in the state.

However, the state government believes revenue could go up if malpractices are contained. The government has taken serious note of the complaints received from different sections that some traders were resorting to malpractices to avoid taxes thanks to cooperation from officials.

Besides tax evasion, some traders believed have been claiming huge amounts from the government as input credit.

“We got some information about our own officials’ connivance. The CM has directed us not to spare the officials who are helping the fraudulent traders,” said K Narayana Swamy, deputy chief minister (commercial taxes). Swamy said he had asked the commissioner to look into the issue.

Sources said that the commercial taxes commissioner Piyush Kumar had conducted surprise inspection of field offices to detect the role of insiders. Piyush Kumar was surprised when officials in Sattenapalle failed to open the keys of the office iron safe when he went there on an inspection. Suspecting that the officials had deliberately misplaced the keys to avoid the inspection of the records, the commissioner suspended three officials.

Title: Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan releasing their stray cattle into UP: Suresh Khanna
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Suresh Khanna

LUCKNOW: The menace of stray cattle in UP took political overtones on Monday when state parliamentary affairs minister Suresh Khanna said that the people living across the borders in Congress-governed MP and Rajasthan were releasing their herds into UP.
