Incredible, unbelievable, tweet the guests

Donald Trump, from his personal Twitter account, shared pictures of the event and also tweeted in Hindi. In one of the tweets featuring him and PM Modi, he wrote, 'Our two national constitutions both begin with the same three beautiful words: ‘We the people’. That means that in America and India alike, we honor, respect, trust, empower and fight for the citizens we proudly serve!' The tweet also had flags of both the nations. Robert C O’Brien, US national security advisor, who was part of the Trump convoy, tweeted video of the roadshow. In his tweet, he mentioned, ‘Incredible crowd for @realDonaldTrump & @narendramodi in India. Bigger attendance than a SEC football game! USA-India relations are at an all time high point! #NamasteTrump. Another tweet by him, capturing the roadshow, was retweeted by Ivanka Trump .

In a tweet, Don Scavino Jr., director of social media for Trump, mentioned, ‘In motorcade en route to the stadium. I've never seen anything like this. Unbelievable!!! #NamasteTrump.

Title: Madurai: Man killed by friend over illicit affair
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative Image

MADURAI: A 30-year-old rowdy from Alanganallur was murdered by his friend after the former developed an illicit relationship with a woman, who was his friend’s relative. The accused severed the head and carried it to the Alanganallur police station and surrendered.

The murder took place late on Sunday night near a public toilet in Alanganallur. The victim was identified as S Muthuvel , an history sheeter and a butcher by profession. The accused has been identified as M Nagarajan .

Police sources said that Muthuvel continued his relationship despite Nagarajan’s relatives warning him. As the relationship continued, the relatives started ridiculing Nagarajan, who then decided to murder his friend.

Nagarajan took Muthuvel to the public toilet, where the two consumed liqour. When Muthuvel became high, Nagarajan took out a knife and slit open his throat. He cut his head and walked straight to the police station situated close by. TNN

Title: Oppn wants govt to submit white paper on Mhadei in one month
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Panaji: The united opposition , comprising Congress , Goa Forward Party ( GFP ), MGP and independent MLA Rohan Khaunte, has accused the state government of lying to the people on the Mhadei issue.

They gave the government a month to submit a white paper on the issue, inclusive of all details, affidavits and prayers in various courts and the tribunal. Further, they have threatened a joint agitation if it fails to do so.

“We need to know what the government’s stand was at various stages. Did they oppose the notification of award or did they keep quiet at that time? Everybody is discussing the issue but we don’t know what the prayers of the Goa government were. Let the entire state know,” opposition leader and former chief minister Digambar Kamat said.

GFP president Vijai Sardesai said the white paper is necessary because “the ministers, CM and water resources minister are telling lies”. “We cannot trust what the government and the ministers say,” Sardesai said.

“They keep uttering nonsense. We want it on paper,” he said, adding that on the ground, water is already being diverted.

Sardesai said the state is “succumbing to pressure from the big brother from Delhi” and that former chief minister Manohar Parrikar’s 2017 letter to Karnataka BJP chief B S Yeddyurappa was just an election gimmick. Kamat added that the letter was used to show that Goa was sympathetic to Karnataka.

Former Congress chief minister Pratapsingh Rane meanwhile warned that the state could face an ecological disaster.

Accusing the central government of being biased towards Karnataka, MGP’s Ramkrishna Dhavalikar said the diversion of water for Karnataka would dry up the state’s dams much before May. The first to be hit will be the water treatment plant in Sattari, which will affect supply to Bardez, Tiswadi and Ponda talukas, he said.

Khaunte said the Goa government should have been more proactive considering that the Karnataka government has made a huge provision for the water project in its budget.

Title: BJP: Event a diplomatic masterstroke
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

NEW DELHI: BJP described the ‘ Namaste Trump ’ event as a “masterstroke” of public diplomacy between India and the US, which would be written in golden letters in Indian history.

“Namaste Trump is a masterstroke of public diplomacy between India and the United States ,” BJP’s overseas affairs department head Vijay Chauthaiwale said in a series of tweets.

“Tell me any other foreign head of state praising so profusely the visiting country, it's national heroes, heritage, culture, music and the leader. This day will be written in golden letters in the history of India, thanks to the visionary leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi ,” he added.

‘Namaste Trump’ was held at Motera Stadium in Ahmedabad to welcome US President Donald Trump , who is on a two-day visit to India. Trump and Modi addressed a gathering of an estimated one lakh people at the stadium.

Title: Madurai: GRH tests access card system for entering labour theatres
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representaive Image

MADURAI: The Government Rajaji Hospital (GRH) sources, on Monday in Madurai , said that to prevent the entry of unauthorized people, only an access card can now open the grill gates leading to the section of corridor outside the two labour theatres at the comprehensive emergency obstetric and newborn care (CEmONC) building in the hospital. The access card system has been implemented on a trial basis, said hospital sources.

The system has come into place after over two months since the incident when a woman PG doctor was assaulted by a patient’s kin in the same area on December 14. After the attack, GRH doctors and staff had protested demanding for better protection and safety. “The access card system is on trial for a week first. The mechanism for it has been set up. Depending on the feedback, any flaws may be rectified and then it may be implemented full time,” said a hospital source.

According to hospital sources, the GRH dean Dr Sangumani J has distributed access cards to select doctors, medical professionals, staff nurse and PG doctors. The card can be swiped on the machines installed just outside the grill gates leading to the labour theatres to open them. “Without the card, the gates cannot even be opened. Only the security can now allow attenders. They have been instructed to allow attenders inside only in case of emergency. Even the needs of patients like food, water, towels or napkins will be taken in only by the security staff from the attenders to the patients,” said a security staff.

While GRH staff has welcomed the move, there is also concern regarding the practical difficulties of implementation. “Many times previously as well, there has been much resistance and difficulties when we try to restrict the number of attenders and their access. A lot depends on the security staff, who need to be vigilant,” said sources.

Title: NCH chief justifies stripping women for medical test, minister fumes
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Surat: Even as the inquiry by a three-member women committee is probing the alleged stripping of probationary women clerks, the state-government run New Civil Hospital (NCH) waded itself into the row with its superintendent addressing media persons on the issue on Tuesday, much to the chagrin of junior health minister Kishore Kanani.

While the incident of stripping had happened in the Surat Municipal Corporation-run SMIMER hospital, the NCH superintendent Preeti Kapadia addressed media persons in her office and justified undressing of women for fitness and medical test.

Even as she denied having approval from her department to address media when the inquiry committee is already doing its work, Kapadia claimed she had been asked by municipal commissioner Banchhanidhi Pani to explain how the tests are done. Pani, however, categorically denied having asked anyone to hold a press conference.

When contacted, Kanani told TOI: “Why is she holding press conference in NCH on this issue? It is a matter related to SMC and SMIMER. She has not been authorised to speak on this issue by the health department. She cannot do this even if it was done in the capacity of NCH superintendent.

Kanani said he will inquire and take action if necessary.

"I have been asked by the municipal commissioner to call the mediapersons and explain how these fitness tests are conducted. He was to remain present but due to some reason he could not come," Kapadia said while replying a question.

However, Pani said he had not asked anyone to hold a press conference. “NCH officials could have requested SMIMER superintendent. I have no role to play in this. I am also not aware that SMC's PRO department made calls to media persons to attend the press conference,” he clarified.

Kamlesh Naik, assistant commissioner, SMC, said, "The PR department was instructed by the NCH superintendent to ask media persons to come to NCH for briefing. I am not aware about the purpose of press conference.”

Undressing necessary for examination

Surat: Preeti Kapadia was joined in the briefing by Dr Vandana Desai, superintendent of SMIMER and Dr Ashwin Vachhani, head of gynaecology department, SMIMER.

"To examine some parts of a woman, their clothes have to be removed. Cancers of different types require physical examination for which removing clothes is necessary," said Kapadia.

"I should not speak this but if I am 25 years of age, unmarried and if I say that my last menstrual was three months ago then obviously I could be pregnant. In that case we will have to check the patient and bring this on record. It can become an issue in job of the woman," Kapadia added.

Kapadia, however, could not explain why doctors consider pregnancy as the only cause of disturbed menstrual date. She contradicted the stand of Kamal Dayani, principal secretary, general administration department (GAD) who had stated that there are no rules to check pregnancy or other conduct any such gynaecology tests.

Title: IOC to set up EV charging stations across Kerala
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kochi: As a part of its green initiative, Indian Oil is setting up electric vehicles ( EV ) charging stations across Kerala, said V C Asokan, chief general manager and head of Kerala office, Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) Ltd.

“We presently have two EV charging stations in Kerala and 14 more stations will be set up soon. We plan to have at least one EV charging station in every district headquarters,” Asokan said in Kochi on Monday.

IOC is developing an integrated fuel complex in Thiruvananthapuram with LNG storage, production and dispensing of CNG and a retail outlet for dispensing petrol, diesel, lubricants and CNG, he said.tnn

Title: Neighbourhood horror: Minor raped in Ahmedabad
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

Title: Madurai: School students in district observe Girl Child Safety Day
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative Image

MADURAI: School students from across the district, on Monday, celebrated former chief minister J Jayalalithaa’s birthday by observing ‘ Girl Child Safety Day’, as announced by the Tamil Nadu government. Along with celebratory events, students of all age groups from various schools across Madurai also took a ‘Girl Child Safety’ pledge administered to them by dignitaries, school principals or teachers.

The pledge stressed on protection and empowerment of the girl child and elimination of child marriage and child labour.Additional district collector, B Priyanka Pankajam, took part in the celebratory event at LPNI girls’ higher secondary school, organized by members from the district Child Protection Unit and Child Welfare Committee (CWC). Meanwhile, on the occasion of Jayalalithaa’s birthday, AIADMK functionaries and leaders garlanded the newly established statue of the leader next to MGR’s statue in the island in KK Nagar. The party cadres also paid floral tribute to her portraits and distributed sweets to the public at various places in Madurai and many places in the southern districts.tnn

Title: Free helmets for school kids’ parents
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Nagpur: Last week, Vinayakrao Deshmukh High School & Junior college, Lakadganj, distributed free ISI-marked helmets and held a rally under its Ride to Safety inititave. This rally aimed to raise awareness about road-safety measures, predominantly among two-wheeler riders along with the pillion riders.

As per the statistics shared by Nagpur City Traffic Police, although the overall road accidents in Nagpur declined by 9.84% in 2019, there was still a 4.8% rise in overall fatalities. The rally was attended by senior dignitaries from the traffic and transport department of Nagpur. Chinmay Pandit, deputy commissioner of police, traffic, Nagpur, along with Jerry Jose, head, human resources, ICICI Lombard, flagged off the event.

During the event, various experts pointed out statistics culled from the data released by the ministry of road transport and highways in 2018 to draw attention towards the issue of rising road fatalities. Among the different vehicle categories, two-wheelers account for the highest share in the total number of accidents (35.2%) in the country. Non-wearing of helmets by two wheeler riders caused 43,614 deaths and accounted for 28.8 per cent of total road accident deaths in the country.

Title: Telangana gets tough on illegal layouts, stops registration sans papers
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

HYDERABAD: In a crackdown against sale of properties without necessary approvals, registration of thousands of open plots has been stopped by the government across Telangana .Since February 22 the stamps and registration department has been directed by the government to not register open plots in unapproved layouts. “This move will act as a deterrent for developers from selling open plots without approval of authorities,” a top government official said.The municipal administration department has made it mandatory for developers and property buyers to submit approved layout plans or the Layout Regularisation Scheme (LRS) papers before applying for registration of open plots along with other documents.“Under the 2019 Municipalities Act, the municipal authorities have powers to ask the registration department to not register open plots in illegal layouts,” a senior registration department official said, adding: “The decision has been taken to stop proliferation of such layouts.”Municipal commissioners have written letters to sub-registrars to stall registrations, officials said.Sources said this move would make prospective buyers come forward to regularise their plots under LRS in case the layouts have already been developed. In the past few months, the registration department has been insisting on mutation proceedings for registration of properties (houses and flats) if it’ a re-sale along with property tax receipt mainly to put an end to unassessed properties.In April last year, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) had written a letter to the registration department to not register plots in unauthorised layouts. HMDA commissioner and principal secretary, municipal administration, Arvind Kumar told the registration authorities that HMDA would share the details of all approved layouts in a dynamic manner to prevent illegal layouts mushrooming and gullible buyers investing in it. This proposal, however, did not make much headway.But the fresh development has the registration department worried about the impact on its revenues. “Due to economic slowdown, there is no revenue growth in the department, especially in the municipalities and surrounding areas of Hyderabad. The new clause will adversely affect our revenues from registrations,” said a senior official of the stamps and registration department.

Title: Church dispute: 2 HC benches recuse
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kochi: Two high court benches have recused from considering the appeal filed by the state government against a single bench’s order to take over Kothamangalam church and hand it over to the Orthodox faction.

The appeal came up for hearing before a bench comprising Chief Justice S Manikumar and Justice Shaji P Chaly during the forenoon session on Monday but the bench said it is recusing from the matter.

In the afternoon session, the appeal was scheduled to be heard by another division bench comprising Justice CK Abdul Rehim and Justice TV Anil Kumar but that bench also recused.

The single bench had ordered Ernakulam collector S Suhas to appear before it on Tuesday along with the plan to take over the church and associated properties. In the appeal filed by the collector and other officials on behalf of the government, a stay on the single bench’s directive was also sought.

It was on December 3 that the single bench ordered the collector to take over the church and hand it over to the Orthodox faction. When the order was not implemented, the Orthodox faction had filed a contempt of court case.

Title: HC seeks a week’s response from state after PIL wants ban on animals’ entry for slaughter
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Nainital: The Uttarakhand high court on Monday gave the state government a weeks’ time to respond to a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) that has sought a complete ban on the entry of living animals into the hill state.

The division bench of Chief Justice Ramesh Ranganathan and Justice Ramesh Chandra Khulbe heard the matter and listed the case for further hearing next Monday.

The petitioner has argued that since there is a blanket ban on the illegal slaughterhouses in the state and there are no legal ones, the entry of live animals means that they are being brought in for slaughter which is a crime within the territory of the state.

“We said that the honorable high court has banned the illegal slaughterhouses in the state and the government has not set up any slaughterhouse yet. Therefore, the logical conclusion is that the animals brought in are being slaughtered in illegal slaughterhouses. That’s why we have said that the court should ban the entry of such animals in Uttarakhand,” said Kartikey Hari Gupta, the lawyer appearing for the petitioner.

As reported by TOI earlier, the HC has also been hearing a bunch of petitions which have said that there are no slaughterhouses in the state. The HC has directed the administration as well as municipal councils and corporations across the state to set up slaughterhouses in places like Nainital, Haldwani and Haridwar.

While different district administrations have said that many of the slaughterhouses are at various stages of completion, none of them have become functional yet.

Title: Ahmedabad: Chorus of 1.2 lakh responds to US president Donald Trump’s ‘Namaste’
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

CM Rupani, Union home minister Amit Shah and other dignitaries at the Motera stadium on Monday

AHMEDABAD: What does it sound like when 1.2 lakh voices cry out an exuberant ‘Namaste’? The warm salutation easily flies across the world’s largest cricket arena — the Motera stadium — from the galleries to the ground, and envelops the VVIP zone on the stage.

"When US President Donald Trump began his speech with ‘Namaste,’ more than 1 lakh people returned the greeting together," said Pravin Chauhan, one of the attendees of Monday’s ‘Namaste Trump’ event at the stadium. "Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s call, ‘Long Live Indian-American Friendship’, received a similar response. Besides, the sheer size of the stadium inspired awe."

The stadium was packed before Modi and Trump arrived at noon. They received a spectacular ovation when they strode onto the stage. Groups from several districts of Gujarat were spread across the stadium. The loudest roar of approval came when Modi and Trump addressed each other as ‘friends’.

The US president’s allusion to Bollywood blockbusters, his ‘chaiwala’ reference about Modi, and his appreciation of the contribution of NRIs in the US drew spirited cheers from the crowd. Moreover, the spectacle seemed to mitigate the effects of the scorching heat for the crowd.

Senior city police officials said that the bandobust at the stadium rivalled that for the annual Rath Yatra in Ahmedabad. "We had an extensive plan to handle the arrival of participants from outside the city to prevent jams on arterial roads and highways," said a senior city police official. "We also scheduled the entry of people to prevent crowding outside the stadium."

People were frisked by two cops simultaneously — one focused on the upper part of the body and the other on the lower part. "This allowed us to frisk each person in just five seconds," the official said. "Still, it took about three-and-a-half hours for the stadium to fill up."

To provide uniformity to the crowd, various groups had provided specially designed white T-shirts and caps to the participants. A few groups entered the stadium with saffron jackets with ‘Namaste Trump’ logo emblazoned on them. Legions of people wore Modi and Trump masks.

A participant from Khokhra in Ahmedabad, who did not wish to be named, said that the area corporators took him and others in the neighourhood to the venue in buses.

"In the morning, we were provided breakfast before the start of the journey at 8.30am," said the participant. "On the ground, boondi-ganthiya and buttermilk were served." He said that corporators were asked to take pictures of groups they had brought to the ground.

The stadium began to fill up from 7.30am and a host of performers kept the people entertained before the two world leaders arrived. Among those who performed were Kailash Kher, Veena Saxena, Kinjal Dave, Kirtidan Gadhvi, and Sairam Dave. The energy of the people was reflected in their enthusiasm to dance whenever a folk song was presented.

Title: Students march to create awareness on plastic pollution
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative Image

MADURAI: Students from various schools in the city took part in a rally held on Monday to create awareness on plastic pollution and on ways to avoid the use of plastic.

The rally was organised under the ‘Swacchh Bharat mission’ by the district National Green Corps (NGC) with support from the ministry of environment, forest and climate change, and Tamil Nadu department of environment.

Over 300 students and teachers from Madurai educational district took part in the rally and the workshop that was held subsequently as part of the campaign.

The rally was flagged off at Sourashtra Boys Higher Secondary School by Jeyamurugan, district environment engineer, Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB).

During the course of 1 km-long rally towards Teppakulam, the students carried banners and posters while raising slogans against plastic pollution.

In the workshop held post the rally, experts in environmental science like Gunasekaran, additional environment engineer, TNPCB, Rajesh, Assistant Professor, The American College and Sivaraman , district joint secretary, Tamil Nadu Science Forum (TNSF) addressed the students.

“The students were addressed on various topics like the use of plastic, the harm it causes and how to reduce and avoid the use of plastic,” said MSP Kulanthaivel, Environmental Awareness Co-ordinator, Madurai.

The students interacted with the experts and were also provided study materials.

Title: Regularise ‘badli’ drivers, KTC protesters demand
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: Demanding that ‘badli’ drivers and conductors in KTC , who have completed two years of service, be accorded permanency in employment, the KTC Drivers and Allied Employees’ Association held a protest in Panaji on Monday.

Over 300 employees participated in the protest, which interestingly went on without any disruption to the KTC’s bus service schedule.

Their other demands include that the probation period of ‘badli’ drivers be restricted to six months and a minimum monthly salary of Rs 25,000 for them versus the current Rs 15,000, the association’s general secretary Christopher Fonseca said.

“KTC’s management must sign a comprehensive wage agreement with the association and pay all wage arrears with effect from January 1, 2016,” Fonseca said, adding that the management must regularise the services of security workmen and that salaries of sweepers and other sections be paid on the due date every month.

Title: Villagers lock school where teachers forced students to perform in TikTok videos
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Aurangabad: A zilla parishad school at Dharkhed village of Gangakhed, in Parbhani district, was locked down by the locals on Saturday after they came to know that two teachers (a couple), were forcing students to perform in TikTok videos.

Demanding action against the teachers, the villagers sent a letter to the education department alleging that instead of imparting education, the couple was making the students perform in videos for a social networking platform.

On Monday, the villagers were informed by the education department that the two teachers have been shunted out and two new teachers have been appointed in their place. The ZP school in Dharkhed has seven teachers and 163 students of Classes I to VIII.

ZP CEO Pruthviraj BP said, “Today (on Monday), the school functioned normally and all the students attended their classes. I have sought a detailed report from the block education officer based on which, appropriate action would be initiated against the teachers.”

He added that allegations against the teacher-couple resorting to frequent leaves and not focussing on education by the villagers are also being checked.

Meanwhile, the residents said that locking down the school was the last resort as several of their earlier pleas have fallen on deaf ears. Parents Teachers’ Association (PTA) president Ankush Bobde said: “This has been going on for the past three months. Initially, we raised the issue with the school authorities, but nothing happened. So, we finally decided to lock the school.”

After the villagers locked the school gate, the headmaster tried to intervene. Later, the block education officer was forced to go to the village and accept the written complaint.

It was also alleged that teachers used to punish the students who refused to perform in the videos. Panchayat samiti member Jankiram Pawar said nobody at the school was ready to take cognizance of their complaints and that is why the villagers were compelled to take things into their own hands.

“Several videos of the school students have been uploaded on the video-sharing platform by the teachers from their account,” a villager said, adding that teachers should be banned from using mobile phones during the school hours.

Title: Conspiracy to defame India: MHA
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

New Delhi: The heavy stone-pelting, violence and arson witnessed in parts of Delhi on Monday was a conspiracy to defame India at a time when US President Donald Trump is visiting, minister of state for home G Kishan Reddy has said.

Hitting out at opposition parties for backing the protests against Citizenship Amendment Act, Reddy stated: “This is a conspiracy to defame India. Why are these protests taking place at a time when the US President Donald Trump is visiting the country… Will the opposition parties take responsibility for the death of the Delhi Police constable? Will Congress take responsibility?”

Delhi Police head constable Rattan Lal was killed in the violent protests on Monday. A native of Sikar, Rajasthan, the 42-year old was posted in the office of assistant commissioner of police, Gokulpuri. Many police personnel, including Shahdara DCP Amit Sharma, were injured in the violence. Sharma is now okay, said a source.

Holding out the assurance that the law and order situation of the city had been brought under control, home secretary Ajay Bhalla said: “Senior officers of Delhi Police are in the field with adequate central para-military force personnel, managing the situation.”

According to sources in the government, the violent anti-CAA protests appear to be orchestrated to coincide with Trump’s India visit in a bid to garner headlines in the international media. Stone-pelting and crowds of protesters started building up on the eve of US President’s arrival and intensified as his special flight was about to touch down in India. This, many point out, cannot be a coincidence.

“This is a matter of investigation,” an officer said when asked what had triggered the crowd build-up and violent protests on Monday. He stated that while things got a little tense in the afternoon, with attempt to set fire to a petrol pump and riders moving around with country-made weapons, “the situation was subsequently brought under control”. Sources said Delhi Police will be registering cases in connection with the violence and arson and the suspected perpetrators arrested.

Discounting the possibility of Delhi Police having failed to act in time to control the violence, a senior government official said the police casualties are testimony to the fact that the police was in the thick of action against the protesters.

Title: HC declines to quash case against ‘stalker’
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kochi: Case against a youth who followed a woman walking alone through a public road on his bike and asked whether she wants to accompany him cannot be quashed, the high court has held.

Justice R Narayana Pisharadi declined to quash the case registered by Petta police against 23-year-old Abhijeet J K of Anayara Pump House near Kadakampilly in Thiruvananthapuram for insulting modesty of the woman (Section 509, IPC).

The 39-year-old woman was going home around 9.30pm on July 12, 2018 when the accused allegedly followed her. Along with inviting her to accompany him on the motorcycle, he is also accused of making a sexual gesture to her with his hand. The case was registered on the basis of a complaint by the woman.

Declining to quash the police case, the court said that the accused and the victim were total strangers and therefore, the intention was not to give a lift on account of friendship or relationship.

Title: Meeting in a week to decided outstanding dues between Uttarakhand and UP: High court told
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

The Uttarakhand HC has been hearing a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) which has alleged that the government h... Read More

NAINITAL: After the Uttarakhand high court (HC) issued a bailable warrant against him, Sudip Dutta, the under-secretary in the Union ministry of roadways and transport, told HC on Monday that he will hold a meeting between the officials of UP government and Uttarakhand within a week to resolve the issue of payment of dues to the sum of Rs 800 crore by the UP to Uttarakhand.

The bench of Chief Justice Ramesh Ranganathan and Justice Ramesh Chandra Khulbe had issued a bailable warrant against the secretary after he failed to appear before the court last week. “The officer was present in the court on Monday and he said that after holding the meeting he will file a progress report before the court in a month as well. After hearing him, the court gave him a month’s time,” said MC Pant, the lawyer appearing for petitioner.

The Uttarakhand HC has been hearing a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) which has alleged that the government has not paid the salaries of over a thousand of its workers since October.

“Uttar Pradesh owes around Rs 800 crore to Uttarakhand after the bifurcation. However, even after 20 years since the division, the money has not been paid yet. The state of Uttarakhand cites this as one of the reasons for its account books running into negative and that they need that money to pay the dues,” Pant said. The case will now be heard after Dutta files his response.

The court, meanwhile, also refused to vacate the stay it had put on the transfer of roadways to the urban development department after the petitioners said that the rate paid for the transfer of land was way below the market price. “We had said that the land was sold at a much cheaper price than the market rate. While the roadways could have got over Rs 250 crore for it, it was paid only around Rs 50 crore. Therefore, the court had stayed the transfer of land and on Monday it refused to vacate it as well,” Pant said.

Title: Weaving a new khadi tale
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

When Trump and Melania Trump were led by Modi to the charkha for a brief demonstration, Melania began spinning the wheel even as Modi was explaining its importance. Modi told his guests that Mahatma Gandhi believed the charkha would ease economic distress of India.

Modi also sought help from Lata Parmar , an employee of the ashram and expert at the spinning wheel, to help Trump use the charkha. Parmar asked Melania to spin the wheel. Parmar then steadied the hand of the President, who was holding a cotton ball. The three worked together till a thread emerged. Trumps were amazed and thanked Parmar.

Title: TB Cases in Hyderabad: Hyderabad sees 40 per cent increase in tuberculosis cases just in a year
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: Despite attempts to clamp down on tuberculosis, the disease is spreading in Hyderabad. The number of TB cases in the city have gone up by nearly 40 per cent — from 10,836 in 2018 to 16,481 in 2019, as per the data available on Nikshay portal, a website launched by the Union government under the National Tuberculosis Elimination Programme (NTEP).The fact that 15-20 TB patients (from Hyderabad and other parts of Telangana ) seek admission every day at TB and Chest Hospital in the city, apart from another 20-40 who are diagnosed with TB every day, hint at the gravity of the situation.The upward trend has been attributed to urban congestion with majority of the cases coming from slums and the fact that at least 40 per cent of the patients discontinue medication, leads to further spread of the disease.“Earlier, patients were kept in the hospital for two to three months, now with the domiciliary treatment (at home), patients tend to discontinue medication within 3-4 weeks as soon as the symptoms disappear. The complete course of medication for six months is mandatory as patients remain carriers. As per known statistics, each patient infects another 10-12 people,” said Dr Mahaboob Khan, superintendent, TB and Chest Hospital.While majority of the patients coming from poor socio-economic background tend to discontinue treatment due to lack of awareness, side effects like severe pain, rashes and jaundice push many to discontinue the treatment as well.As there is no system in place to trace the patients after their initial stay at hospitals, the Chest Hospital has been appointed as the nodal centre to put a plan in place.The health authorities are now holding emergency meetings to come up with a plan to trace patients by involving district hospitals, community health centres, public health centres, private hospitals and healthcare workers, said sources.“The idea is to provide treatment to as many as patients as possible and as early as possible. As the deadline to eradicate TB (by 2025) has been set by the Centre, there is an urgent need to contain its spread. It is a challenge to contain TB in slum areas in the peripheral areas of the city,” said a highly placed source in the state health department.

Title: 16 motorbikes with illegal carriers seized near India-Nepal border
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Pithoragarh: Champawat police has seized at least 16 motorbikes with illegal carriers plying along the India-Nepal border on Monday. These bikes were reportedly carrying passengers illegally, mainly from India to Nepal and also near the border area.

“There has been a crackdown on these bikers at Tanakpur and Banbasa by police. The drive against such illegal bikers will continue in the future,” said Lokeswar Singh, Champawat SP. “There are several complaints of motorbikes carrying passengers illegally in Tanakpur and Banbasa and they are taking Rs 200 to Rs 300 from Banbasa (in India) to Gadda Choki (in Nepal),” Singh said, adding that at Tanakpur, the bikers carry passengers from Tanakpur barrage to Baramdev market.

“Bikers from Nepal usually come to Banbasa for their personal work and on their return they carry people on illegal carriers and take money from them. Some bikers make it their profession and routinely come into India looking for passengers. They sometimes come twice a day,” he further said.

“This practice is totally illegal and the border is very sensitive. A few foreign nationals, who were trying to sneak into India, were caught at Banbasa immigration office recently. So, order has been given to police to seize vehicles, illegally carrying passengers,” the Champawat SP added.

Title: BJP MP Swamy to move HC over shrine board Act
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Dehradun: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy has announced that he will move Uttarakhand high court (HC) this week seeking to quash the Devsthanam Bill 2019 which paves the way for the state government to take over the management of around 50 temples in Uttarakhand, including the Char Dham shrines.

In a tweet, Swamy said that on Tuesday, he will file a petition to seek quashing of the Act which was passed by the Trivendra Rawat government recently.

Meanwhile, on Monday evening, the state government appointed IAS Ravi Nath Raman as CEO of Uttarakhand Char Dham Devsthanam Board. Raman is also Garhwal Commissioner with administrative control over the entire region. As per the Act the CEO shall handle all funds and also fix remuneration of priests, officeholders and trustees. The CEO is also empowered to undertake Devasthanam area development and activities such as boarding, lodging, medical services, hygiene sanitation facilities and general supervision.

Swamy’s decision has cheered the priests of Char Dham who had been agitating against the state government’s decision. Gangori shrine priest Ashok Semwal said, “A group of priests had met Swamyji in Delhi and he had committed to support our demand of abolishing the new Act since it ruins the centuries-old traditions and their control over the char dhams.”

Title: Swachh survey over, trash piles up in several areas of Jaipur
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Garbage strewn on road at Brahmapuri in the city on Monday

JAIPUR: The sanitation condition is back to square one after the Swachhta Survekshan 2020 came to an end recently. Piles of garbage can be seen at several corners of prominent areas in the city. Besides, residents are complaining that garbage pick-up vans are not coming on time.

Raghunath Sharma, a resident of Mansarovar area, has been stacking the garbage in his house for many days as the waste pick-up vehicles arrived on Monday after six days. “A month back, things were perfect. Garbage collection vehicles were on time. However, now hoopers are coming on alternate days. On Monday, hoopers arrive after six days of gap. We have to complaint many times on the Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) helpline number,” said Raghunath.

Similarly situation has occurred at most places Kalwar Road, a few areas in Vaishali Nagar, in the Walled City. Areas like Gangauri Bazaar, Chandpol Bazaar, Ramganj Mandi and other heritage parts of the city, piles of garbage can be seen on every corners. Kamal Meena, a resident of Gangauri Bazaar, said that trash depots have again started mushrooming in the city.

“For the last two months, sanitation was perfect but now garbage is not picked up from the depots till afternoon. Sanitation workers have stopped cleaning the inside lanes. Complaining to the officials is of no use,” said Kamal.

When the Swachhta Survekshan 2020 was going on till January 30 and all over the city sanitation situation in the entire city was up to the mark. Almost all the municipal employees were involved in it. Sanitation inspectors and in-charge were appointed in all the wards to closely monitor the situation. Every day, officials used to conduct morning inspection of the city. The situation improved in the city and garbage was picked up on time from the garbage depots.

This all has changed as the Swachhta Survekshan ended. A JMC official on condition of anonymity said that slowly officials have returned to their routine work.

“Survekshan is over so officials have returned to their work. Tussle with the BVG Company is going on regarding payment issues. Jaipur is in need of 800 hoopers, while only 530 are currently functioning. So, situation will degrade,” one JMC official said.

Title: For your ears only: Desi tunes to Elton John
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

File photo of Kailash Kher

AHMEDABAD: The audience was enthralled with Gujarati folk songs like ‘Kasumbi no rang’ and Bollywood medleys including ‘It happens only in India’ and ‘Desh mera rangrez hai babu’.

Kailash Kher and other Indian artists like Geeta Rabari and Kinjal Dave performed at the cricket stadium in Motera, Ahmedabad. The venue was decked up with huge hoardings and large screen displays of US President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi .

As Trump, accompanied by PM Modi , appeared on stage, he was greeted by approximately 1.25 lakh people, many donning white Trump hats. The playlist switched to ‘Macho Man’ song by Village People ringing over the loudspeakers as the crowd burst into a loud, rapturous applause.

The English songs played after Trump’s entry were selected by his team, said sources in Gujarat Cricket Association, which owns the cricket stadium.

Trump is believed to be an ardent fan of British singer Elton John and the songs played at the stadium are from his campaign rally playlist. Some of Elton John’s songs played at Motera included ‘Tiny Dancer’, ‘Rotten Peaches’ and ‘Indian Sunset’.

The bond between the two leaders was on full display. Trump delivered a speech in which he showered praises on Modi, calling him an "exceptional leader, a great champion of India ... and a man I am proud to call my true friend".

Addressing the ‘ Namaste Trump ’ event, he recounted decades of friendship between India and the US.

"The US will always be faithful and loyal friend of India. Thank you for the spectacular welcome," he said.

Trump said that India is a country that produces about 2,000 movies a year, from the hub of genius and creativity known as Bollywood. He recalled two of his all-time favourite movies - ‘Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" (DDLJ) and Sholay.

The event ended with ‘You Can’t Always Get What You Want’ by the Rolling Stones.

Title: ‘Sabarmati ke Friends’ left indelible imprint
Content:
President Trump and the first lady Melania had a brief stopover at the ashram

AHMEDABAD: President Trump visited Mahatma Gandhi’s Sabarmati Ashram where he thanked PM Modi for the ‘wonderful visit’ and called him a ‘great friend’ in the guest book. The president and the first lady were accompanied by their daughter Ivanka and son-in-law Jared Kushner. Trump and the first lady were welcomed with a khadi dupatta by Kartikeya Sarabhai on behalf of the Ashram trustees.President Trump and the first lady Melania had a brief stopover at the ashram and Bapu’s cottage ‘Hriday Kunj’ which was home to Mahatma Gandhi from 1917 to 1930.Sarabhai said that before Trump and the US first lady headed towards the charkha, President Trump told him, "Coming to the ashram was a moving experience." Jared and Ivanka took keen interest in Bapu’s life at the Ashram and made sure they visited every room of Hriday Kunj.Before entering Hriday Kunj the US president and first lady took off their shoes, according to the Ashram’s custom. Melania put on ankle socks to enter. After Hriday Kunj, PM Modi took them for a demonstration of the ‘charkha’ or spinning wheel, where they were helped by an Ashram employee Lata Parmar.Before the the US president and first lady left the Ashram, the trustees presented them ‘Gandhi’s talisman’ printed on khadi cloth, a pencil sketch of Mahatma Gandhi by city-based artist Vijay Shrimali. Then there was a collection of 150 quotes of the Mahatma, a copy of Bapu’s autobiography ‘The story of my experiments with truth’, a small replica of the charkha or spinning wheel and a 9-inch tall marble statue of Bapu’s proverbial ‘three-monkeys’.

Title: Revision in the Metro
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Nagpur: The Metro has come as a boon for several students who are opting for the mode of transport to reach their exam centres. It has also ensured that they reach on time without the support of parents who would have otherwise brought them on private transport.

“Taking the bus is the only other public transport option. But all buses heading towards Sitabuldi get filled up very quickly. Even standing is uncomfortable, “ said Piyush Pramanik, a STD XII student.

Another student Saket Rahate said, “If my parents had to drop me, it would have taken at least 35 minutes to commute. With Metro, I can reach my centre in 20 minutes.”

Another student Mukesh Yadav said he “revises comfortably in an air-conditioned train”. “It helps me to stay relaxed even if the weather outside is hot,” he said.

The three are demanding better frequency. “Just for board exams, they should make it 15 minutes. If we miss a train, we have to wait for half an hour for the next,” said Yadav.

MahaMetro spokesperson Akhilesh Halve said, “Commuters are like owners of MahaMetro and we will try our best to comply with the request.”

Title: Woman tries to end life over dowry abuse
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Jaisalmer: A 25-year-old woman who was allegedly harassed for dowry by her in laws tried to commit suicide at the railway crossing opposite the district collector’s office in Barmer on Sunday. Police personnel deployed for a dharna of RLP and other people present there rushed to the rescue of Dhudi Devi, wife of Bhura Ram, a resident of Mangta.

SP Sharad Choudhary said alert police personnel pulled her from the tracks and stopped her from committing suicide. Devi alleged that her in-laws were harassing her for dowry and she had also lodged a case in this regard, but no action has been taken in this regard.

DySP, woman cell, Dhanapuri Goswami said Dhudi had lodged a complaint against her husband and brothers-in-law for dowry harassment, rape and forceful abortion. However, when police wanted her to undergo medical test, she refused and withdrew her case stating that she was not raped.

Goswami said later she again filed a case and police are investigating it. Efforts were made to take her statement in the last three days, but she was not available. Both the families have a dispute and Dhudhi’s sister-in-law has also filed a dowry harassment case.

Title: Secunderabad: Tax hike likely for commercial properties on cantt main roads
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Houses in BHEL Colony, Rasoolpura

SECUNDERABAD: The Secunderabad Cantonment Board (SCB) on Monday took up triennial revision of property tax for 2018-2021 for both commercial and domestic properties in its jurisdiction.

This time, however, commercial property owners are likely to see a hike in property tax rates for properties located on main roads.

According to SCB records, there are 36,000 properties, including commercial and residential, in cantonment areas. Of these, 8,000 to 10,000 are shops and businesses that have been operating for more than three decades.

The tax for each commercial property has been fixed at Rs 4 per sqft and Rs 12 per sqft. “The area of the property, its location, plinth area and number of floors will be assessed,” SCB deputy chief executive officer Vijay Kumar Balan Nair told TOI. “We are calculating the percentage of the property tax in the same way as Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC),” he added.

Regarding residential properties, the deputy CEO said that the tax for each property has been fixed between Rs 1.20 and Rs 1.80 per sqft, adding that a separate price will be charged for structures with asbestos sheets as roof. “The revision will be carried out as per the self-assessment proforma that was submitted by the respective property owners,” he said.

The property tax will be levied separately for partly-commercial, commercial and highly-commercial properties. “Property owners can raise objections over the increase in property tax rates, but we will reduce the tax rate only after analysing each property owner’s request,” said a tax department official.

However, the official admitted that the process of calculating the property tax in the cantonment area was higher compared to that of the GHMC.

The last triennial revision was carried out between 2015-18, which fetched the board a revenue of nearly Rs 60 crore. This time around, the fund-starved SCB is hoping to get revenue of Rs 100 crore.

Title: Manish Sisodia: Schools in northeast Delhi to remain closed on Tuesday
Content:
Delhi deputy CM Manish Sisodia. (Photo: @msisodia)

दिल्ली में हिंसा प्रभावित नोर्थईस्ट ज़िले में कल स्कूलों की गृह परीक्षाएँ नहीं होंगी और सभी सरकारी एवं प्राइवेट स्… https://t.co/LBg5K2UOgx — Manish Sisodia (@msisodia) 1582560160000

NEW DELHI: Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia said all schools in the capital will remain closed on Tuesday, on account of the violence perpetrated in northeast Delhi. “There will be no internal exams in the violence-hit northeast Delhi on Tuesday. All government and private school in the area to remain closed,” Sisodia tweeted on Monday.On the micro-blogging site, the Delhi education minister said that he had a word with the Union HRD minister, Ramesh Pokhriyal ‘Nishank’, to reschedule the CBSE exam slated for Tuesday.However, the central board said the only exam scheduled for Tuesday was for vocational subjects for Class XII students and there was no need for rescheduling.“It is informed that as per schedule for Tuesday, there are exams only for Class XII in four vocational subjects in 18 centres in the western part of Delhi. There are no centres in the northeast Delhi for exams scheduled for tomorrow,” said a CBSE official.

Title: ‘State isn’t giving us anything new, 6-month maternity leave was HC order’
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Dehradun: The state government’s recent announcement to provide six-month maternity leave to anganwadi workers has apparently failed to appease them. The members of Anganwadi Karamchari Union of Uttarakhand (AKUU) allege that the Uttarakhand high court (HC) had directed the state to provide six-month maternity leave to them two years ago and the state has simply announced that they will comply with the order.

“So far, we were being given just two months of maternity leave. This was against the HC order. The state government has now only announced that they will now follow the HC guidelines. They aren’t giving us anything new. This is just their way to fool us,” said Rekha Negi, AKUU president.

Negi added that anganwadi workers need a hike in wages and such perks cannot address their issues. “Most of the anganwadi workers are above 45 years of age. Also, many of us are either separated, divorced, or widowed. So, extending maternity leave won’t help us much. We need more money for our work. State government must understand and respect our needs,” Negi told TOI.

Earlier, anganwadi workers had agreed to return to work after Dehradun mayor Sunil Uniyal Gama met them on behalf of chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat on February 4. The mayor had assured them that a committee will be set up by March 10 to look into their demands and their honorarium, in all likeliness, will be increased from April, the start of the next financial year.

Notably, the anganwadi workers have been protesting for months to push for a honorarium of Rs 600 per day. “They are not talking about core issues with us. We want to know the actual status of the committee proposed for us. We want to know if our demands would be considered or not during the cabinet meeting in March,” Negi added.

Title: Pinarayi slams HC ex-judge for Jamaat leanings
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kollam: Coming down heavily on a former high court judge for his alleged pro-Jamaat-e-Islami stand, chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday said the ex-judge has become the voice of the Muslim outfit. Without mentioning any name, the chief minister asked why the former judge was getting disturbed when he referred to SDPI and Jamaat-e-Islami.

The chief minister was apparently referring to a former HC judge who is known for making controversial statements. The former judge had criticised the government alleging that large-scale human rights violations were taking place in the state in the name of Maoist hunt. He also had warned the government of having to face severe repercussion if it was not correcting its approach.

Inaugurating the farmers’ rally held as part of the culmination of the 26th state conference of Kerala Karashaka Sangham here on Monday, VIjayan said the former judge’s behaviour was unbecoming of the position he had held.

“The judge’s behaviour was unbecoming of the position he had held. He tried to mislead the public about the government's policy on National Population Register (NPR). He also tried to misquote me by putting words which I never said,” he said.

Title: Unauthorised structures to be included
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative image

SECUNDERABAD: Illegal structures in the cantonment areas will also be taken into account during the triennial revision of property tax .

According to the SCB , over 60% of the structures in the cantonment areas are illegal, however, the board does not have accurate data on the number of illegal properties in the cantonment areas as no survey has been conducted so far regarding these structures. Officials said that unauthorised structures are razed when they receive a tip-off or when a court rules in their favour.

“The engineering wing has to decide whether a structure is legal or illegal, but the tax department’s duty is to calculate the property tax for every structure as per the rates fixed by the SCB,” said an SCB official, adding that special teams deployed to assess the properties will go door-to-door and calculate the property tax.

The triennial revision will be completed in a year and notices would be served to owners of unauthorised constructions.

Title: Probe into Rohingya getting Aadhaar cards: BJP
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

N Ramchander Rao (Image credit: Twitter)

HYDERABAD: Telangana BJP on Monday urged DGP M Mahender Reddy to order a probe into Rohingya staying in various districts with a majority of them being in possession of Aadhaar cards and other important documents. A delegation of BJP leaders, including Hyderabad unit president, MLA N Ramchander Rao, met the DGP and submitted a representation with a plea to order full-fledged probe on Rohingya refugees .

The leaders said a majority of Old City residents who were sent notices by UIDAI were Rohingya. “There should be a separate inquiry as to how these refugees could gain access to Aadhaar, ration and other important cards. These people can be manipulated by ISI and other agencies and can cause trouble,” the leaders said.

Title: Man killed over land row, five booked
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kota: A 52-year-old man, who was allegedly beaten by his brother, his two wives and two minor children over a land dispute on Tuesday last week, died at his home in Dabi town of Bundi district on Monday.

The deceased was identified as Babulal Bairagi (52), resident of Dabi town of Bundi district. Family members of the deceased have lodged a case of murder against his brother, his two wives and two minor children later in the day.

Police lodged a case against five accused and initiated investigation.

Title: Javadekar’s driver suffers heart attack, dies
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Mussoorie: Due to a sudden heart attack, Kapil Dev, the driver of minister of information and broadcasting Prakash Javadekar died while travelling from Dhanaulti to New Delhi on Sunday evening. Dev was on a trip to Mussoorie and Dhanaulti with his family and co-workers.

On Sunday evening, while returning from Dhanolti, he started vomiting and also complained of uneasiness following which he was rushed to Max hospital in Dehradun where he was declared dead. According to doctors he suffered a massive heart attack.

On Monday, after permission from the district magistrate, the body was handed over to his family after the family refused post-mortem.

Title: US President Donald Trump and PM Narendra Modi batted for four hours, won with a hug sixer!
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

PM Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump hug as they attend the 'Namaste Trump' event (REUTERS photo)

AHMEDABAD: PM Modi and President Trump did not stop at just calling each other "true friends". They actually shared at least six hugs in less than four hours that Trump spent in Ahmedabad. The PM received him with the famous "bear-hug" at the airport. Later, Modi and Trump shared repeated hugs at the Namaste Trump event at the Motera.

They hugged again even as the compere invited PM Modi to make his introductory remarks. Then, Modi invited Trump to deliver his speech and they hugged yet again.

The great chemistry was evident as PM Modi stood up after the President’s speech, and hugged him once more. The two leaders embraced each other after PM Modi ended his speech.

Title: Telangana high court stays summons of BC Commission to JNTUH VC
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

JNTUH vice-chancellor Jayesh Ranjan

HYDERABAD: Vice-chancellor of Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad ( JNTUH ) got a reprieve from the Telangana high court on Monday after it stayed the summons of the National Commission for BCs directing the VC to appear before it on Tuesday.

The commission had summoned the vice-chancellor in connection with a complaint filed by a candidate who argued that the university was not following the rule of reservation in relation to Backward Classes (BCs) while recruiting lecturers and other faculty members. Senior IAS officer Jayesh Ranjan is officiating as in-charge vice-chancellor of JNTU.

Agreeing with the arguments of advocate general BS Prasad, Justice Abhinand Kumar Shavili of the high court directed the registrar of the varsity to appear before the commission since he represents the university.

The judge gave this direction while hearing an urgent petition moved by Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad through its counsel V Ramchander Goud urging the HC to stay the National Commission for BCs summons to the vice-chancellor.

According to the state counsel, all aspirants have to pass post-graduation in the first division. All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) provides relaxation of 5 per cent to Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) candidates. States are given the liberty to add Backward Classes reservation to this. JNTU, in its petition, said Telangana had not yet taken any policy decision in this regard so far.

The state counsel also argued that whenever a grievance is placed before it, the national commission should first try to know the version of the university. “It did not do so. Instead, it summoned the vice-chancellor straightaway,” Prasad said.

The advocate general also found fault with the language used in the summons threatening the vice-chancellor that the commission would invoke the powers of a civil court to ensure his presence in case the latter fails to appear before it. “The post of a vice-chancellor is an academically superior post and hence the commission should not summon him,” the advocate general contended.

The judge said it was sufficient if registrar appears before the commission with details of the case. “Vice-chancellor need not go,” he said.

Title: Corona scare may lead to shoe (price) pinch
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Indore: Corona has infiltrated the footwear industry. Squeeze in Chinese supply of PVC (polyvinyl chloride) — raw material used for making soles — has escalated cost of manufacturing and consumers may soon end up paying more to buy a pair of shoes or slippers from local bazaars.

Cost of PVC has surged by around 40 per cent in a fortnight while fresh supply has almost stopped raising fears among manufacturers sitting on exhausted inventory.

China dominates the footwear sector supplying over 70 per cent PVC and footwear accessories in local market. But shipments have squeezed since outbreak of Coronavirus for which the sector is contemplating a price hike.

Ranjan Bagga, a footwear manufacturer having facility on Sanwer Road said, “We are running out of stock. Traders importing PVC have raised prices by around 40 per cent. This sudden jump in prices has killed profit margins.”

Indore has around a dozen footwear manufacturers that purchase PVC and other accessories from Delhi and Mumbai traders.

Manufacturers said that cost of rexine, another footwear raw material, has jumped by around 5 per cent.

Ranipura Footware Vyapari Association secretary Jaipal Ahuja said, “China is a leading supplier of PVC and we all are dependent on traders of Delhi and Mumbai to source the raw material. But since past fortnight, supplies have been almost negligible.”

According to the association, small manufacturers are the most hit as they work in tiny margins and cater to lower income class while branded chains can afford to take the hit for a short duration.

Manufacturers said that outbreak of Coronavirus has hit supplies of many small items used in the sector such as buckles.

Bagga said, “Indian market do not have competitive and economical alternative for many things and due to this China has a lot of interference. With shortage in supplies of accessories, we are forced to purchase expensive items from local market.”

Manufacturers said supply line is expected to remain empty for a while as China has completely stopped selling raw materials.

Title: Poll officer absent from special camp in city, suspended
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Jaipur: Booth level officer (BLO) of Ward No 144 of Nagar Nigam Greater, Suresh Meena, was suspended on Monday for not present in the special camp organised on Sunday to receive claims and objections for the final publication of electoral roll ahead of the municipal elections in Jaipur. The BLO was suspended for "gross negligence" towards election duty as he did not turn up at the special camp set up at the polling station located at (Ward No 144, Part 3 D) Bharat Public School, Chaudhury Colony, Kartarpura under Malviya Nagar cosntituency.

Election registration officer Malviya Nagar and DIG Stamp Jaipur Circle II Bhagwat Singh informed that BLO Suresh Meena was directed to be present at his polling station on February 23 from 10 am to 5 pm.

Meena, senior assistant, office of the superintendent engineer, PHED, Jaipur, was found to be absent during inspection at the polling station. "This led to disruption in the election work as the duty was not discharged by the official," read the order.

"Recognising this as gross negligence and apathy towards election work, Meena has been suspended under the Representation of the People Act 1950 with immediate effect," it added.

Title: Nala chokes, GHMC blinks, activist protests
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Ramesh O

SECUNDERABAD: For almost three years now, Ramesh O (61), like other residents of East Anandbagh , has been forced to re-live the horrors of waterlogged streets and homes getting inundated due to an overflowing nala after heavy rainfall. As the GHMC has failed to widen the nala, which is the reason for the regular flooding during monsoons, Ramesh, an activist, staged a protest at the GHMC head office on Monday with a placard around his neck.

“Almost three-fourths of Bandla Cheruvu is filled with construction material and there was a time when the water used to be clean and could be used by the residents. Due to the debris in the nala, the sewage enters our homes, even otherwise, the water enters the houses,” said Ramesh.

He added that due to the GHMC’s failure to remove encroachments on the nala, the sewage overflows.

Further, the activist wrote to GHMC commissioner Lokesh Kumar regarding the pending construction of the Bandla Cheruvu culvert. In his letter, he said, “Traffic will be disrupted due to the work that will be taken up to construct the culvert. I request you to issue necessary instructions to officials concerned to complete the culvert work of Bandla Cheruvu at the earliest.”

Title: With nine zilla constituencies, Salcete crucial for BJP: Experts
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

MARGAO: With Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) enjoying a brute majority of 27 in the 40-member House, the March 22 zilla panchayat (ZP) elections is being viewed by observers as a referendum on the popularity of the BJP-led government which will face the assembly elections in nearly two years.

Also, as this will be for the first time that the ZP polls are being held under the stewardship of chief minister Pramod Sawant and BJP president Sadanand Tanavade, the leadership acumen of the duo will come under close scrutiny, political observers feel.

BJP therefore is pulling out all stops to ensure that the party has a smooth sailing in the ZP polls.

Salcete, which has nine zilla panchayat constituencies is crucial for BJP, as losing the Catholic-dominated taluka is likely to jeopardise the political fortunes of the neo-saffronite MLAs who had crossed over to BJP from Congress last year.

Cuncolim MLA Clafacio Dias, Velim MLA and minister for water resources Filipe Neri Rodrigues and Nuvem MLA Wilfred D’Sa are already in a dilemma over whether to field candidates on BJP ticket or extend support to independent candidates.

“For these three MLAs of Salcete , it is surely a trial by fire. For them it’s like damned if you do, damned if you don’t,” a political analyst said.

If they do field candidates on BJP tickets, the party risks losing the seats; and if they back independent candidates instead, the MLAs will be a tight spot in the 2022 assembly elections. Though BJP is divided over the issue, sources said the three Salcete MLAs have been offered a leeway by letting them support ‘independent’ candidates backed by the party.

The reservation of ZP constituencies that has seen much criticism from Congress is being viewed by political analysts as a means to further BJP’s political agenda.

In the March 2015 ZP polls, BJP had posted a victory in only Davorlim constituency of Salcete, the others being won by non-BJP players. Congress had then refrained from contesting the elections on party lines. This time, however, with three of its MLAs representing Catholic-dominated constituencies – following the altered political dynamics post defection of the 10 MLAs from Congress to BJP – BJP is intent on holding its sway over the second-tier panchayat bodies.

Political observers feel that the contentious CAA protest could influence the outcome of the polls in several constituencies in Salcete. “It will very much be an issue if the tempo of the protests is maintained until the polls. But it’s difficult to say which way it could sway the results – it could well be a double-edged sword,” a political observer said.

Congress, left with just five legislators, finds itself in a pitiable situation in South Goa. The party is likely to feel the heat in Quepem and Canacona constituencies where it was largely dependent on the performance of its formidable legislators, Chandrakant Kavalekar and Isidore Fernandes, both of whom are now key figures in the BJP camp.

In Canacona, BJP with three power centres – each headed by Fernandes, former minister Ramesh Tawadkar and former MLA Vijay Pai Khot - faces a further challenge to put up a united front in the zilla panchayat polls.

Losing the Catholicdominated Salcete taluka is likely to jeopardise the political fortunes of the neo-saffronite MLAs who had crossed over to BJP from Congress last year

Title: Supreme Court slams Delhi govt on payment of ad hoc school teachers
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Monday slammed Delhi government for paying a meagre Rs 4,000 per month to ad hoc teachers in schools when the minimum wage for unskilled labourer was fixed at nearly Rs 15,000 and asked it to come out with a policy to regularise their jobs.

A bench of Justices U U Lalit and Vineet Saran expressed surprise when it was informed that a nursery teacher who had been working on an ad hoc basis for the last 23 years in a government school was paid only Rs 4,000 per month. “How can you pay only Rs 4,000 to a teacher when the minimum wage for labour is around Rs 15-20,000. You use them only for statistics purpose to project that you have so many schools and teachers in your Shiksha Abhiyan,” the bench told additional solicitor general Vikramjit Banerjee who was appearing for Delhi government.

Expressing concern over low salary, the bench told the state government, “You are profiteering out of them by paying such a low salary.”

Last year, the Delhi government had fixed monthly minimum wage for unskilled, semi-skilled and skilled worker at Rs 14,842, Rs 16,341 and Rs 17,991, respectively.

The bench was hearing an appeal filed by the government challenging a Delhi high court order directing the department of education to treat the teacher as a regular employee with effect from 2001 and pay him back wages.

In this case, Milan Rana was appointed against a vacant post of nursery teacher in June 1998 at the Central Academy Senior Secondary School in R K Puram. As per the order of appointment, he was employed on an ad hoc basis till a regular appointment was made, and on a consolidated monthly salary of Rs 1,500. His job was extended in 1999 and 2001 on ad hoc basis. He made various representations to the authorities for regularisation of his job but it was not done and he continued to work on an ad hoc basis.

The court, while hearing the plea of another ad hoc teacher, had in 2010 directed the government to regularise her job effective from 2001. Rana, thereafter, moved the HC seeking regularisation of his service and the court said in September 2018 that he be also regularised from 2001. The NCT government moved the SC against the verdict.

The apex court said there was no merit in the appeal and asked the government to come out with a policy to regularise the jobs of all ad hoc teachers who could be regularised on the basis of their qualification and experience.

Title: Reach Dehradun from Delhi in just 2.5 hours via elevated road: CM Trivendra Singh Rawat
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Trivendra Singh Rawat

DEHRADUN: Chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat on Monday said that the Union government has given an in-principle approval to the construction of an elevated expressway between Dehradun and Delhi.

Once completed, the ambitious mega project will reduce the total distance between the two cities to 180km, a communique from the CM's office said. At present, the total distance between Dehradun and Delhi is around 250 km. "With the completion of the elevated road , the distance between Dehradun and Delhi can be covered in as little as 2.5 hours," the CM said.

The announcement of the approval of the elevated expressway project was made on Monday after National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) chairman SS Sandhu met the CM at the latter's residence in Dehradun.

While the present route between Delhi and Dehradun passes through Meerut, Muzaffarnagar and Roorkee, the new proposed elevated road will run via Baghpat and Saharanpur and touch Dehradun from the Mohand side.

NHAI officials also gave a presentation to chief secretary Utpal Kumar Singh about the elevated expressway project, which will be executed in three phases.

The first phase, as per information made available by the chief secretary's office, will be 31.2 km long, connecting Akshardham in Delhi and eastern peripheral expressway, which will include a 18 km stretch of elevated road. The total estimated cost of the first phase has been pegged at Rs 3,250 crore.

The second phase, which is the biggest among all the phases, will connect eastern peripheral expressway and Saharanpur. The 118-km-stretch will be constructed at a cost of Rs 4,830 crore.

The last phase of 20.7 km will connect Ganeshpur to Dehradun. This phase will include construction of a 1.8-km-long tunnel, an additional tunnel of 400 meters near Dehradun's Daat Kali temple and an elevated road of 6.8km.

As part of the mega project, a new tunnel at Mohand has also been proposed, the NHAI chairman informed the Uttarakhand CM.

Terming the project as a major initiative for boosting connectivity to the Himalayan state, CM Rawat said, “In times to come, the elevated road will give a major fillip to tourism in the state and prove to be a big factor in Uttarakhand's economic development.”

Sandhu said that some part of the proposed elevated expressway passes through neighbouring Uttar Pradesh and he has requested the UP government to expedite the forest and wildlife clearances so that the construction work of the expressway can start soon.

Title: If Centre says no, varsity may turn to MP Online for CET
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Indore: National Testing Agency (NTA) is awaiting approval of ministry of human resource development (MHRD) to conduct Common Entrance Test ( CET ) of Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya (DAVV).

The varsity is rooting for NTA to conduct the online entrance test. But before getting aboard, the agency has decided to take MHRD approval as entrance test of DAVV is conducted on a smaller scale as compared to entrance tests that the agency regularly conducts.

It has already been over a fortnight that the varsity had written to the agency for conducting the entrance test. However, the agency will revert only after getting approval from the ministry, media spokesperson of DAVV, Dr Chandan Gupta told TOI.

“We are constantly in touch with the agency. We expect a reply in one week,” he added.

The varsity is expecting that NTA will get a heads-up from ministry and as the agency also prepares the question paper. DAVV will only have to provide the course, number of questions and format to conduct the computer-based test.

Recently when the varsity had conducted doctoral entrance test (DET), there were complaints that Ordinance 14 was not followed while framing some questions. Such issues won’t crop up if the agency makes the question paper, said vice chancellor Dr Renu Jain.

“We have decided that we will not go for any private agency for CET,” she said.

In case agency doesn’t get approval, MP Online is the second option for the varsity.

Title: Bomb hoax sends police in a tizzy
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Hyderabad: A phone call at around 12 am on Monday to the police control room claiming there was a bomb at the Secunderabad Railway Station sent the police into a tizzy and triggered panic at the station.

The police took serious note of the call and alerted the railway police. However, investigation by the railway police revealed that it was a hoax . Police alleged that the caller used filthy language against them when they called him back and later switched off his phone. Sources said that the police have identified the caller and suspect that the caller was drunk when he made the phone call.

Earlier too, hoax calls have been made to the Secunderabad Railway Police. Early in February, the police received a hoax call stating that a bomb was planted on the Vijayawada-Secunderabad Intercity Express train.

Title: 10 kids forced into labour by parents saved
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Udaipur: The District Legal Service Authority along with police on Sunday night rescued 10 children from Fatehsagar lakeside who were selling toys and balloons. The kids in the age bracket of five to 13 were forced into labour by their parents who didn’t provide them enough food, clothes or even let them wear chappals.

ADJ Riddhima Sharma carried out operation after getting instructions from district and session judge Ravindra Kumar Maheshwari.

The rescued kids were produced before the child welfare committee which sent them to a shelter home. tnn

Title: Jaipur: Two charred to death as trucks collide
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Representative Image

JAIPUR: A truck driver and co-driver charred to death as two trucks collided head-on at Rajiyasar of Suratgarh area of Sriganganagar district on NH-62 on Monday morning.

Driver of truck with Punjab registration number Gulzar Singh, a resident of Rasulpur of Punjab and co-driver of another driver with Rajasthan registration number Manoj Ram, a resident of Janghu of Bikaner district were burnt alive. “They stuck inside the truck and as the truck caught fire, it became difficult to save them. The farmers in the agriculture field rushed to save them but they only managed to save driver of Rajasthan truck Devilal and co-driver of Punjab truck Satish Chandra, who is a resident of Ferozpur of Punjab.

The farmers doused the fire with tubewell pumps but all their efforts went in vain as they failed to save them. Following the collision, NH-62 witnessed traffic jam.

Since the police station was very close, one kilometre from the site of accident, the police rushed to the spot and took the injured to the hospital. They were admitted to Suratgarh’s government hospital.

Title: Top IITs, IIMs join hands to boost entrepreneurship
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Kozhikode: Premier technical and management institutions in the country have joined hands to solidify the entrepreneurship ecosystem through research in innovation, venturing and entrepreneurship.

The ‘Innovation-Venturing and Entrepreneurship in India Network’ ( iVEIN ) has as founding members faculty of the Madras and Bombay IITs , and Bangalore , Calcutta and Kozhikode IIMs .

The consortium will leverage strengths of the partnership and work with other stakeholders, such as incubators, investors and the government, to generate and disseminate knowledge, IIM-K authorities said in a statement on Monday.

iVEIN was launched on February 15, 2020 on the sidelines of the ‘Dialogue with Stakeholders’ event organized by SINE (Society for Innovation and Entrepreneurship) at IIT Bombay

Prof Debashis Chatterjee, director of IIM-K, said forging a close link between academic and R&D institutions, on one hand, and industry, on the other, will not only enable and empower future entrepreneurs but open up previously unexplored avenues for resource-sharing.

Highlighting the features of the initiative, Prof A Thillai Rajan, department of management studies at IIT-M, who is coordinating the initiative, said innovation, venturing and entrepreneurship are expected to play a key role in the economic growth of the country, in addition to strengthening India’s position as an innovation hub.
