Titans' tete-a-tete: RIL CMD Mukesh Ambani (left) with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella in Mumbai on Monday.

MUMBAI: With every sector from hospitals to hotels embedding technology in their systems more than ever before, building tech capabilities will be the defining factor of the coming decade, said Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella.

Speaking at a Microsoft organised ‘Future Decoded’ summit in Mumbai on Monday, Nadella urged organisations to build their own tech intensity.

Some 150 India Inc leaders, including Kotak Mahindra Bank VC & MD Uday Kotak , Tata Steel CEO T V Narendran, Hindustan Unilever CMD Sanjiv Mehta, Pidilite Industries MD Bharat Puri, SBI chairman Rajnish Kumar and McCann Worldgroup India CEO Prasoon Joshi, attended the event.

“Our mission is to empower organisations to achieve more — on how we can help you build your own independence,” Nadella said, while adding that 72% of job openings for software engineers come from outside the tech sector. Microsoft hires the second-largest number of engineers from India.

In a fireside chat with Nadella, Reliance Industries CMD Mukesh Ambani said, “The opportunity that we have for India really is the opportunity to become the premier digital society in the world.”

“I have no doubt that we will become among the top three economies in the world. We can argue about whether it will happen in five years or 10 years, but it’s going to happen. When that happens, our opportunity will be to see if we can be the most tech-enabled society,” said Ambani, who has entered into a long-term alliance with Microsoft to accelerate digital transformation.

Nadella’s visit coincides with Donald Trump’s maiden India visit as US President. “As we are speaking, President Trump has arrived in Ahmedabad, and the India that he will see in 2020 is very different from what President (Jimmy) Carter or (Bill) Clinton or even (Barack) Obama saw. I can easily say that the mobile networks in India now are better or on a par with anybody else in the world. And that’s the big change,” said Ambani.

Commenting on Nadella’s career trajectory, Ambani said, “You joined Microsoft in 1992, when India was a $300-billion economy. Today, India is $3-trillion.”

Title: 45 chemical firms in Dombivli fined Rs 25 lakh each for pollution
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

The action has shocked industries

MUMBAI/KALYAN: Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) on Monday issued notices to 45 chemical companies in Dombivli MIDC for violating pollution norms, and told each to pay a fine of Rs 25 lakh.

The action came few days after chief minister Uddhav Thackeray visited Dombivli MIDC, after the colour of a river had changed due to pollution. Thackeray had warned companies polluting rivers to take safety measures or else they would be shut. Thackeray had also told officials to come up with a plan to deal with pollution in Dombivli MIDC.

The action has shocked industries in Dombivli MIDC, and they have decided to move court against MPCB's order. A KAMA (Kalyan-Dombivli, Ambernath Manufacturing Association) member said, "The order is shocking, as MPCB, instead of taking action against those polluting rivers, is harassing everyone. We will move court against the order as we are not ready to pay the fine."

MPCB and MIDC officials on Monday met over the Dombivli fire and Waldhuni river pollution issues, and submitted an action plan to the state government.

In the river case, MPCB served closure notices to seven companies releasing effluents without treatment. A senior MPCB official said the companies that were found to have released effluents in Waldhuni have been told to stop the discharge till further orders, which implies that they have been told to shut operations. "We have told them to stop discharge till MPCB certifies its quality, and the process of effluent treatment," he said, pointing out that the penalty had been imposed on each of them for damaging the environment.

Meanwhile, sources said the main MIDC pipeline that carries effluents of these factories to the treatment plant, was also damaged, which was one of the reasons for the pollution. The river had turned orange and later dark blue.

MPCB officers said a notice had been issued to the unit in Dombivili that went up in flames recently, to not resume operations till it is certified safe.

Title: BS Yediyurappa: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa confirms he’ll attend Donald Trump banquet in Delhi
Content:
BJP workers in Shivamogga on Monday got a cake for BS Yediyurappa, who will celebrate his birthday on February... Read More

If @BJP4India feels Kashmir has returned to Normalcy, & If @BJP4India feels that there is no govt orchestrated viol… https://t.co/PfEnBnQu9C — Siddaramaiah (@siddaramaiah) 1582530899000

BENGALURU: Karnataka chief minister BS Yediyurappa will fly to Delhi on Tuesday morning to attend a banquet hosted for US President Donald Trump at Rashtrapati Bhavan.Yediyurappa is among eight chief ministers invited for the banquet. He may have a word or two with Trump on bilateral issues if he gets an opportunity to meet him, said sources in the chief minister’s office.On Monday morning, he told reporters: “Yes, I have been invited, but I have various engagements on Tuesday and busy with budget preparation, so let’s see.” Party sources said Yediyurappa decided to attend after party top brass in Delhi insisted on it. This was after several senior Congress leaders, including Manmohan Singh, opted out of the dinner because they’re upset that their chief Sonia Gandhi had not been invited.On his expectations of the Trump visit , Yediyurappa, said, “He has said he shares a good relationship with PM Modi and has confidence in him. We are looking forward to some tie-ups and bilateral talks.”Chief ministers K Chandrasekhar Rao (Telangana), Uddhav Thackeray (Maharashtra), Edappadi K Palaniswami (Tamil Nadu), Manohar Lal Khattar (Haryana) and Biju Patnaik (Odisha) will attend the banquet.Trump using visit for election campaign: Congress Opposition leader in the Karnataka legislative assembly Sidddaramaiah said the Union government should have hosted an event for Trump in Jammu & Kashmir to prove normalcy there. He hit out at Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the long wall built near the airport in Ahmedabad. He tweeted: ‘It is time for @realDonaldTrump to get inspired from @narendramodi. Inspiration to build decorative walls to hide not so decorative life!!’ AICC general secretary Mallikarjun Kharge said Modi is spending crores of money for Trump’s visit and added that the US President is using Indian soil for his upcoming election campaign.

Title: Karnataka School: Anti-national slogans found on school wall near Hubballi
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Residents demanded the arrest of those who wrote pro-Pakistan slogans on the Budarsinghi primary school buildi... Read More

HUBBALLI: Some miscreants wrote 'Pakistan Zindabad' in Kannada with chalk on the walls of a primary school in Budarsinghi village, 6km from Hubballi.

The graffiti was noticed on Monday morning when the school reopened after the weekend. Hubballi Rural police deputy SP Ravi Nayak, Kundgol tahsildar and School Development Monitoring Committee members went to the school and enquired about the incident.

Residents of the village staged a protest and condemned the incident. They demanded immediate arrest of the miscreants. Police assured the villagers they would arrest the accused at the earliest. Hubballi Rural police said the school headmaster and SDMC members were asked to lodge a complaint. Police are yet to register a case for promoting enmity between groups one grounds of religion and disrupt harmony.

Title: GAIL readies Rs 1 lakh crore for gas grid expansion
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

NEW DELHI: State-run GAIL has lined up a war chest of over Rs 1 lakh crore for expanding petrochemical capacity and network of gas pipelines — the latter with the objective of widening the reach of clean-burning fuel to help cities across the country breathe easy and reduce the economy ’s carbon footprint.

“We have planned a capital expenditure of Rs 45,000 to Rs 50,000 crore on laying pipelines, Rs 10,000 crore on petrochemical capacity expansion and another Rs 40,000 crore for city gas distribution (CGD, or CNG and PNG services) business,” the company’s new chairman Manoj Jain said on Monday. The investment will be spread over five years.

Title: Mumbai: With top cop Sanjay Barve in exit mode, all eyes on the frontrunners
Content:
Sanjay Barve is an IPS officer of the 1987 batch (File photo)

Parambir Singh

MUMBAI: If Sanjay Barve does not get a further extension, director-general of police (anti-corruption) Parambir Singh and Pune police commissioner K Venkatesham are front-runners for the coveted Mumbai police chief 's post.An IPS officer of 1987 batch, Barve was to retire on August 31, 2019, but a day before that he was granted a three-month extension. A week before his extended term was to expire, he was given a fresh extension of three months, till February 29, 2020. Some senior NCP cabinet members had expressed surprise and shock over the fresh extension granted to Barve.When a fresh proposal was sent to New Delhi, Uddhav Thackeray was chief minister-designate. At the fag end of his career, Barve was locked in a controversy over allotment of a digitization contract of Mumbai Police records to his son. The state home department has sought information from Barve on the contract. "So far, we have not received information from Barve,'' a senior official told TOI.Senior bureaucrats said if Barve is not granted a fresh extension, Singh and Venkatesham are among the top contenders.So far as seniority is concerned, home guards director-general Sanjay Pandey is the senior most IPS officer after DGP Subodh Kumar Jaiswal, followed by Bipin Bihari, S N Pandey, state security corporation managing director D Kanakratnam, DG (technical) Hemant Nagrale (all from 1987 batch), state intelligence department commissioner Rashmi Shukla and additional director general Rajnish Seth (1988 batch)."There is no question of seniority so far as appointment of Mumbai police chief is concerned. It's the CM's prerogative. Instead of waiting till the last moment, it will be better if an announcement is made as early as possible,'' the official said.

Title: Tata AGR dues Rs 2,197 crore, not Rs 13,823 crore
Content:
(File photo)

NEW DELHI: The Tata Group has told the government that its share in the adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues is Rs 2,197 crore only, which it has already paid, and not the Rs 13,823 crore that has been demanded by the telecom department (DoT).Sources said that top Tata executives have made their position “very clear”, and have categorically stated that they “do not have to pay anything more” towards past AGR dues, based on their self-assessed calculations.The matter appears to be escalating, with the telecom department now considering to issue a notice to the Tata Group, that ran operations under Tata Teleservices and Tata Teleservices ( Maharashtra ) brands, justifying its side of the calculations. “Our assessment is complete and will be seeking an explanation from the Tata companies over the next one-two days,” an official source told TOI.While the ministry appears to be clear on its demand, the source said, Tata executives had said that their calculations have been confirmed after a thorough internal assessment, which was thereafter verified by an independent consultant.When contacted, a company spokesperson said, “Pursuant to the October 24, 2019 judgment of the Supreme Court and in accordance with further communications from the telecom department, Tata Teleservices and Tata Teleservices (Maharashtra) have made a payment of Rs 2,197 crore to the DoT towards licence fees and spectrum usage charges. The companies have also submitted to the telecom department the details of calculations in support of the payment.”Sources also said that if the trouble escalates, it could also have an “indirect impact” on Airtel, which has acquired Tata’s telecom business. “We will demand the amount from the new owner, and that’s it. This is what the rules state,” another source said.

Title: Tamil Nadu adds 161 medical PG seats in government colleges
Content:
Representative Image

CHENNAI: Tamil Nadu has added 161 more postgraduate seats in government medical colleges for admission that is likely to begin in March 2020. This will take the total number of PG medical seats in the state to 1,919, director of medical education Dr R Narayana Babu said.Last year, the state added 508 postgraduate seats and admitted 1,758 PG students. It has 2,900 undergraduate medical seats. While a major share of the 40% increase in 2019 came through conversion of PG diploma seats - barring three in diabetology - into PG degree programmes, the state increased the number of seats for orthopaedic, general surgery, radiology and anaesthesia this year."Equipping trauma care centres set up by the Tamil Nadu Accident and Emergency Initiative is one of our top priorities," Dr Babu said.For 2021, the state has applied for 100 seats in emergency medicine, besides 288 in other specialities. This year, the state, which has 334 super-speciality seats, will add 25 more.State health minister C Vijaya Baskar said the increase in PG seats will directly benefit healthcare services in the state. Last year the number of obstetricians-gynaecologists passing out of government colleges every year will go up from 109 to 203, and the number of anaesthesiologists will go up from 126 to 193. There will also 29 more general surgeons and 18 more general medicine practitioners from the state colleges.With MCI now mandating that every medical college to start PG courses, more colleges in the state will start applying, officials said.The Postgraduate Medical Education (Amendment) Regulations, 2018 says medical colleges have to apply for permission to start postgraduate medical education courses within three years of grant of recognition or three years from the date of inclusion of the MBBS qualification. In 2021, Omandurar Medical College, Government Sivaganga Medical College and Government Tiruvannamalai Medical College will apply at least 50 seats each. "Appplications for colleges in Karur, Pudukottai and ESI-Coimbatore are in the pipeline," a senior official said.

Title: Forensic lab may come up in Dooars
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Jalpaiguri: Tired of waiting for test reports from Belgachhia forensic science lab , the forest department has decided to come up with a similar laboratory in the Dooars.

The decision was taken in the wake of the rhino deaths at Jaldapara.

The forest minister held a meeting with senior forest officials at Kolkata on Monday and there it was decided that to put an end to their dependence on the Belgachhia lab a new forensic science lab would be set in the Dooars. Madarihat in Alipurduar has been primarily identified as the site.

Title: Kolkata: BJP gets verbal nod from cops for Amit Shah rally
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Amit Shah

KOLKATA: BJP on Monday received “verbal permission” for Union home minister Amit Shah’s rally at the Shahid Minar ground on March 1. The rally, termed “CAA Abhinandan Sabha”, will be the first public meeting of central BJP leaders in Bengal after the CAA bill was passed in Parliament.

“We have got verbal permission from police. There is no reason why they should not give the permission,” Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh said. Kolkata police sources on Monday indicated that the rally will not hamper the examination process as the area near Shahid Minar ground does not have many residential units. Bengal BJP leaders will hold a review meeting for the preparations on Thursday.

“Shahid Minar ground is smaller in size and we are expecting a turnout between 25,000 and 40,000 people. We have, however, asked district leaders to restrict the number of supporters,” said a Bengal BJP leader.

While Shah is likely to spend a night in Kolkata, his office is yet to finalise the itinerary. BJP national president J P Nadda and national general secretary B L Santhosh may be present at the rally. It will be Nadda’s first visit to Kolkata after he was elected BJP president.

Shah, who is visiting Kolkata little more than a month before the

municipal poll in the state, is likely to touch upon local civic

issues during his visit. While party leaders are micro managing the

campaign for the poll, Shah and Nadda are likely to prepare a broader

roadmap for the municipal polls. BJP workers have also been demanding

projection of Mayoral candidate in a few key municipal corporations

like Kolkata and Howrah. Shah and Nadda are likely to take a decision

on that. “Normally, we do not project face in the election and we have

not taken any decision on that so far,” Ghosh said.

Title: West Bengal governor Jagdeep Dhankhar seeks municipal poll preparedness report from SEC
Content:
This story is from February 25, 2020

Jagdeep Dhankhar

KOLKATA: Bengal governor Jagdeep Dhankhar has sought an update from the state election commissioner over the upcoming polls in around 110 municipalities across the state, including Kolkata Municipal Corporation . The governor wants the report on February 27 from SEC Sourav Das on the commission’s preparedness in regard to holding free and fair polls.

This is the first time a governor has taken a “proactive role” even before the election notification. The governor, who appoints the state election commissioner, has mentioned why he did so in a tweet on Monday. “The commission is a constitutional body for superintendence, direction and control of municipal elections under Article 243K of the Constitution of India,” Dhankhar tweeted.

The purpose, according to a Raj Bhavan official, is to ensure free and fair civic polls, putting behind the 2018 panchayat polls that had sparked a controversy on the plea that candidates didn’t get a level-playing field. The matter went up to Supreme Court after opposition parties moved HC crying lack of democracy. Raj Bhavan sources said that Dhankhar doesn’t want a repeat of the 2018 experience.

Sources hinted that the government wants to hold the civic polls in mid-April and complete the process by mid-May. BJP leaders, on the other hand, called on the SEC urging the body to “advise” the state government that parties should get at least some time for campaign. However, a section within the ruling party wants the civic polls to be over by May 23 before the Ramadan month. Chief minister Mamata Banerjee had hinted that polls for most municipalities should be held in a day.

The opposition had moved Raj Bhavan against the government’s appointing administrators in a host of municipalities without holding polls in due time. The tenure of Kolkata Municipal Corporation is ending in May 2020.

“Board examinations are slated up to March 30. We can’t use microphones during this time. Holding civic polls in mid-April will leave less than 10 days’ time for campaign,” BJP leader Mukul Roy said.

Chief minister Mamata Banerjee had hinted that polls for most municipalities should be held in a day. The state government doesn’t want a prolonged phase-wise election schedule because that will throw a spanner on the ongoing development projects. But the decision has to come from the SEC, and not the government.

People in Bengal are aware of the legal battle between state election commissioner Meera Pande and the state government during the panchayat polls over deployment of forces and also determining the phases of polls.
